Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for above average price”
Reviews.Author: bobaloo000
Reviews.Content: Not much bad I can say for this hotel but not much good either. Average at best. OK, wait, the $11 drink I had at the bar was good but not worth $11. Bed was, OK. Bathroom, OK. TV, OK. Get the drift? Nothing spectacular to set it apart of other hotels. Oh, and the front desk ran after me to return my drivers license after they failed to return it. That was nice of them so I'll give them a 4 for service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel when you need to be at convention center”
Reviews.Author: Bondsammax
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here one night for a conference. The hotel lobby is spacious and check in was quick. The room was large and modern with desk space, safe and a comfy chair. The bathroom was large. The elevators were fast. All told this was a nice place if you have business here or at the conference center next door. The location is a problem in that it is far from the tourist areas. Thus, a nice place but mostly for business at the convention center, not straight tourism.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel espeically for business”
Reviews.Author: lynn0101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Hotel was perfect for that. It is about a 1 mile walk to town so not too far. Hotel was comfortable, had everything you needed and was quiet. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very convenient to convention center and the beautiful waterfront area. Check out Legal's Test Kitchen while”
Reviews.Author: Maegan S
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel that is very convenient to the Convention Center. The lobby is nice and has a Starbucks and an Irish Pub! The rooms were average, very clean...typical of a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cancunies
Reviews.Content: I travel for work extensively and stayed at the hotel while attending a conference this week. Very clean, great location and a typical great Westin service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel particularly for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Barry H
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with top quality staff. I couldn't fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Captive audience”
Reviews.Author: NYCFishGirl
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is clean, well maintained, has enough space/loby/elevators to service a large convention. Kind of makes you feel like a jerk when they won't give you late checkout even though you're paying for a large block of rooms and suites though. Not even for a few of the rooms so your team can use them to change after the events are over, and it's not like they have a lounge or any comfortable space you can use for this purpose. Overall it's a new hotel and very convenient (covered walkway) to the convention center -but there are good hotels in walking distance that will treat you better.

Reviews.Title: “Birch Bar.”
Reviews.Author: Glen k
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Boston Waterfront. I enjoyed my stay everything was as i expected. I had the pleasure of having dinner at their Birch Bar. The food was alright but my waitress was delightful. She has such a great personality. Easy to talk to and very knowledgeable about the area. I would recommend asking for Courtney if you dine here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but skip the smallest salad in the world”
Reviews.Author: GusterMcDuster
Reviews.Content: Check-in smooth, room available when I needed. Staff friendly and prompt. Love the Westin beds. Very nice. Room was clean. Only complaint was with in-room dining. I ordered a side salad for $10 to go along with my chicken quesadilla. When the meal arrived the deliverer was startled when i burst out laughing. The salad was served in a ramekin that was slightly wider than the width of my blackberry. Maybe five small pieces of green, two razor thin cucumber slices, and a tenth of a tomato. No joke, the dish containing the dressing was larger. I took a photo and showed it to the desk clerk when I was checking out. He could only smile and suggest I try the burger next time.

Reviews.Title: “efficient services but a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: gianpaolo b
Reviews.Content: The Westin Waterfront Boston is a huge hotel connected to the convention centre by a fly-over, so the most suitable solution for attending a meeting there. The Foyer and the rooms are fine and service very efficient. But the corridors at various floors are very narrow and long lanes with not even some prints on the walls or plants to embellish them a little. Such a hotel with more than 700 rooms has no proper restaurant in the evening, and one may not always like to go out if he is very tired or the weather very bad. In any case both at breakfast and lunch food was unusually for Westin of low quality. Two formal shirts of mine were damaged by the laundry service.

Reviews.Title: “Always my first choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: MJMH
Reviews.Content: If you travel frequently, you know it's the little things that make a big difference and in my experience the Westin in Boston always gets those things right. First, check-in and check-out are handled very quickly. That matters. Second, every one of the staff is helpful, courteous, and appears to enjoy their work: doormen, concierge, front desk staff, waiters. It's amazing how rare this is in many hotels, especially large ones. If the standard is maintained, I won't be staying anywhere else in Boston. I like the rooms. They're not especially large, but I've always found them to be clean, modern, and well-furnished. Everything just works. The beds in Westin hotels are always exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Employees are unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: Jillfromct
Reviews.Content: Got out of cab with my hubby and two young kids. Walked in and Nicole (from catering I then learned) asked me how I was. I told her I'm good except for the bOttle of wine we left in the cab. She asked me what kind it is and what our room number is. She sent us a free bottle of wine!! I've stayed at MUCH fancier hotels and I've NEVER received this treatment. You can tell that the mgmt must be fantastic because all the employees are upbeat and genuinely happy to help. All other amenities are like all Westins, in a good way. Thank you, Nicole for making my weekend!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: gjacoby126
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Westin for three nights in February to attend a science fiction convention and celebrate our first anniversary. The room was spacious, well-appointed and clean, with a nice view of the Boston skyline. (I agree, however, with the previous reviewer who pointed out that the Boston tap water was terrible looking.) Our room had an adjoining door with a group of teenage girls in town for a dance competition; the sound damping wasn't good so lots of giggling bled through the door and the hallway, but it was usually quiet by the time we went to bed. Service was great -- my girlfriend accidentally left one bag on the Silver Line on the way over to the hotel, and the gentleman at the front desk helped her get a number for MBTA that was still open after business hours, and they were able to sort out the situation. Having a Silver Line stop a block away, and South Station within walking distance if we stretched was quite convenient. We ate once at the Irish pub in the hotel; my burger was a little overdone, but her order of Irish sausages was excellent. On the weekends, there are very few dining options in the neighborhood, because the nearby Financial district is almost completely shut down. The small Starbucks in the lobby doesn't have enough capacity for the size of the hotel, which means that finding an affordable breakfast is difficult. All in all, it was a positive, though not perfect, stay, and I wouldn't mind staying there again if the price and location were convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Boston Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: SteveL114
Reviews.Content: There for a yearly convention. Parking prices too high. Reconfigured lobby not as comfortable and invitjng as before. Comfortable beds. Many attendees using other area hotels at much less expensive prices. We may consider this option too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Crocdaddy
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston for the first time for a conference, and brought my family so we could enjoy the city over the weekend. We were excited when we arrived at the hotel because of its location and potential views. Unfortunately, our room was on a lower floor with a limited view and we were all a bit disappointed. When I requested another room, I was told nothing was available due to the sold out convention. Recognizing our disappointment, Justin at the front desk began working with his supervisor, Tom, to help us. The next day they graciously moved us into another room, reserved for VIPs, with a spectacular view (see photo). They could easily have continued to say "nothing was available" because of the huge convention, but instead they made it happen and we spent three more nights in an awesome room. That was above and beyond, fellas, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really the Westin? Won't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: AFeist
Reviews.Content: Our company team traveled to Boston for the Yankee dental conference and chose the Westin because of it's convenient location. We have stayed in many Westin hotels and this one was incredibly disappointing. Why can I hear the people above us walking around? I just want some sleep. Is this the Motel 6? Oh, no that's right I paid over $249 a night to stay here so this must be the Westin but as we continued with the weekend it proved to be Westin employees working at some other hotel. The staff are wonderful with baggage, cleaning, and concierge services but they need to work on delivering on the amenities that are expected with the Westin name. We travel alot and try to stay healthy and one of the reasons we normally choose the Westin is to have a hotel that supports our healthy lifestyle, but not this one! There's a large non refrigerated snack case with nothing in it!!! Hello............. there is a convention going on and you know the hotel is going to be full, why are you not prepared? No snacks and No water in our rooms to purchase and the water out of the tap was appalling, get a filter!! So cloudy with sediment swirling (that never disappeared, yuck) that it was not something you would put in your mouth. Given that, why is there no water in my room???? Interesting that when I go down stairs even the Starbucks is out of water, really???? We are human beings we need water, kind of essential. I requested a refrigerator so I could have fresh healthy snacks for the convention, since eating out isn't that healthy or easy when 25,000 people are at the restaurants surrounding the convention center. They said they only have a few refrigerators and they were out, I had called to reserve one 2 weeks prior. Kind of ridiculous when a Radisson hotel can provide one in every room! It's a high end hotel get some refrigerators come on! It's great that it has a gym and pool but the chlorine in the pool area is so strong you wouldn't want to stand in that suffocating space for more than a few minutes, so it's pretty much useless. And again, no water in the workout room!! We are human beings and we paid a bunch of money to stay at your hotel, can we at least have some water????? On a positive note, the beds are amazing. But why are there no fans in the bathroom?? I am a professional, I need a bathroom that I can get ready in that has a fan for the steam from the shower!!! Seems so obvious, have these people ever traveled a lot? If the beds weren't so nice I would have changed hotels that weekend and gladly paid for a cab ride to the convention center each day. Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is CANNOT be a Westin”
Reviews.Author: love2travel1234
Reviews.Content: Just because it has the Westin name, it does not mean it functions like a real Westin - Starwood properties really needs to reevaluate this one. It is attached to a huge conference center and the crowds it gets are gi-normous, but I have satyed at this property annually since it opened (5 years...??) Unfortunately, it has gone down hill with each passing year. ...service, cleanliness, honoring requests made months earlier and calling three times on the day of check in to confirm availability (of king bedded room and refrigerator). Disappointing. Noise from room next door - up half the night ... Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: chacha46
Reviews.Content: The Westin Boston Waterfront is a very nice hotel, nice beds, nice tub with dual showerhead. The hotel seems to be a bit far from the downtown area but the train station is walking distance. The only issue with that was I went when it was snowing so 2 blocks seem very far when you have to deal with such cold temperatures. The only complaint I have was a less than friendly staff. The hotel has a free shuttle service to the downtown which I found out by a fellow traveler who told me about it. I had asked the staff and no one told me about it, they just pointed to the taxis outside & said the train was nearby. The staff seemed either very tired or not friendly at all, including the cleaning lady whom I said good morning to & not even a hi came from her mouth. There was a restaurant that served breakfast till 11 am, we arrived at 10 am & as soon as they brought our food they also brought the check. I felt rushed since there was no one left in the restaurant and it seemed they wanted to close. Overall the hotel is very nice but the staff is less than what you would expect in a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DandN D
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel that is within walking distance of many Boston convention centers, I think that this is an easy option. It's a huge hotel with a massive lobby and a lot of amenities contained within the hotel. Our rooms were standard with the highlights being the incredibly comfortable bed and the double-headed shower. A patch of restaurants and the World Trade Center were a 5 minute walk away. They have an underground parking lot (you pay per day). Overall, better than I expected considering we were staying at a convention center Westin. Just understand that you should stay in this hotel because you want to be close to this area of Boston. If this area of Boston is not what you're interested in, this hotel is probably inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a convention but not much else”
Reviews.Author: avetelino
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and have to applaud the helpfulness of the staff there. They were always helpful and aided me when I needed something. The hotel is pristine and the rooms are cozy. The food is way overpriced and the hotel's location is out of the way from the rest of downtown Boston. The worst thing about this hotel is the overly expensive parking fees ($33-$43).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff In Boston”
Reviews.Author: SightSee-ers
Reviews.Content: The Westin on the Waterfront is a relatively clean hotel connected to the Conference Center. I stayed here this January on business - and if business called me back again I would stay here. The hotel staff was phenomenal - friendly, willing to take the time to answer a question, and just overall welcoming. (Other than the restaurant staff - who were missing in action during most of the breakfast) The check in desks were interesting with spaces between the computer terminals. Some MBA must have decided that rather than having the guests walk up to an intimidating desk with the employees behind it - employees should step out from behind the desk and greet the guest directly. Kind of a neat idea - only it felt contrived. And frankly when I go to a hotel I know that I am going to a hotel - and dont need to pretend that the person behind the desk - or rather in front of it - is actually glad to see me... just check me in and let me get to my room. The room reeked of cleaning agents. The windows did not open - so I kept the fan on HIGH for the first day trying to get the smell out. But overall it was clean, and the housekeeping staff, room service and even the desk clerks were friendly and helpful. I would try a different place if I were coming back with my family --- but on my own, for work, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown hotel....”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: The Westin Waterfront is a clean, modern hotel near downtown Boston. It is less than a 10 minute ride to the airport and you can walk to downtown very easily. The room was clean and a good size. The bathroom was clean also and featured a cool double headed shower. We were on a floor they put SPG members on so we had a nice view also. The room was a decent price as well.

Reviews.Title: “As long as you're not hoping for room service for dinner”
Reviews.Author: Trueblonde03
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting in Boston and wanted to get down the night before so I could avoid driving in a snow storm the morning of. It is not often that I get any time to myself- being the mother of 2 young kids- so I was really looking forward to just ordering room service for dinner. When I was finally able to find a menu- I discovered there were only 5 entrees on the menu and nothing appealed to me! I called down and asked if that was really all they offered and was told "we have 2 whole pages for all day dining!" That is true but the other page consisted of appetizers, soups, and salads. I really did not want to venture out all by myself for dinner- and have stayed at many other Boston hotels where I could get a reasonable selection of entrees in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to enjoy all of Boston”
Reviews.Author: SouthEndGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Year's Eve. And even though the hotel was busy with revelers, this never disturbed our stay. I love that the hotel is easy to get to, has great parking, and access to several new hot spots on the waterfront. The room was just perfect - luxurious bed, comfortable furnishings, and just the right touch for bath items.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: Doc472
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September for 2 nights, lovely hotel, rooms comfortable and modern. Lobby area is very relaxed and spacious, check in fast and efficient! The gym and pool are great and shower in room was the best I've ever been in! You can really tell that this is a business hotel though and is very expensive. wifi is extra and to print 4 pages in business center cost $14?????? Overall a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: otgwk
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate on this hotel with a block of rooms for a wedding. It was nice, modern and clean. The check in was quick and friendly. The beds were comfortable, but I would have preferred queens over doubles. Staruck's in the lobby is convenient. We enjoyed the free shuttle and went to dinner in the North End. Finished off the night with the New Year's Eve fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you are at a conference there”
Reviews.Author: summerbeachmom
Reviews.Content: It is great if you are at a conference there or get a good rate. The room was fine-not great, and it was fairly clean. You could easily hear noise through the walls and the people next door stayed up late. We had a good breakfast in the restaurant and a good dinner at the Irish pub that is on site. Location is not ideal if you want to do sightseeing around Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice IF Going to be at the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum Level Starwood Preferred Guest, so you know I stay at lots of Westin and Sheraton hotels. This was my first stay at this hotel. It has a huge, comfortable lobby with lots of sofas and tables. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, a small convenience store, and a business center. The ground floor also has a hip bar and a traditional Irish bar. Simple restaurant serves breakfast and dinner. Front desk staff were efficient and friendly. Actually, all the staff I encountered were very friendly. Hotel room was large and had typical Westin touches. Very quiet even though only 5 floors about the main entrance. Valet parking was expensive. No club lounge in the hotel. Nearby restaurants (steak, fish, bars, etc.) outside the hotel were a 10 minute walk which is not bad except in the winter. Taxis are, however, plentiful. The Boston Convention Center is literally attached to the hotel so very convenient. If not doing anything at the BCC, then skip this hotel for finer ones at the same price in downtown Boston near Back Bay, Copley, Financial Center, Beacon Hill, etc. Breakfast of 2 eggs with toast and tomato for $14 is overpriced. So if the $6 glass of orange juice or $4 coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sjhfromatl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Waterfront in September 2011. Excellent stay! Hotel is really nice, rooms are great. Beds are comfortable. Bathrooms are very nice. Hotel staff was wonderful when asked about places to go and how to get there. Shuttle (free) provided by the hotel was a nice bonus. Starbucks in the hotel was nice too. Very easy to get to hotel from airport. And it is a very short walk from the bus station to the hotel. Would recommend and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for convention center - otherwise not best choice”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: Best feature of the hotel is that is attached to the convention center so if in Boston for a convention - it is a fine choice. However, I personally prefer other Boston locations & hotels. The rooms are standard Westin. Front desk staff was pleasant. I appreciate the in room coffee makers, beds are fine & the Starbucks in the lobby (even though long line). Had dinner at 2 different hotel restaurants & really bad experience at one & mediocre at the other -- however as pouring rain seemed logical to stay at hotel. Trying hard to not let the bad restaurant experience impact total experience - but it is hard.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but lonely”
Reviews.Author: ChiTravelGal
Reviews.Content: The Westin Boston Waterfront is a beautiful hotel, but it's a little lonely. Even though it's in the Seaport District, there isn't much life around it, but that's okay because it's only a short walk to the train station, which can take you anywhere. The Old Town trolley also picks up in front of the hotel, which goes all over Boston. It's worth the money and is a serious time saver. There is a restaurant/bar built into the hotel and a small bar facing the exterior as well as a Starbucks. The good thing about all these restaurants/bars is that they make the hotel convenient. The hotel store doesn't have much in it, but there is a CVS near South Station on Summer Street. The hotel is very clean as well as the gym. There were several Life Fitness elliptical machines, which is a plus imho and there is a small pool next to the gym. Walking or running down Summer Street in the morning is a serene experience and makes for an interesting way to see Boston, but it's a long walk/short jog, so just be aware before you venture across the bridge. Also, if you have kids, the Westin isn't very far from the Children's Museum. I would recommend the Westin Boston Waterfront because even though it's a little far from things, the train is pretty close taking you where ever you need or want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ditchchamp
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here. We travelled with a group of couples, some with children, and stayed in 5 rooms on different floors. I love that there is a Starbucks right in the lobby! We even had a treadmill in our room, which was unexpected but fun. We didn't use the pool and hot tub, but our friends did and said it was great. The Irish pub downstairs is terrible, but they told us they didn't belong to The Westin, so I won't reflect that in this review, just letting you know if you stay there. LTK (Legal Test Kitchen) is within walking distance and is SO FUN and delicious if you are looking for something late-night. (they serve food til 2 a.m.) Our concierge Matt was FABULOUS, when we asked where we could go for brunch the next morning, he gave us a few ideas, and in the morning he had slipped some printouts of menus and maps to nearby places, along with info on a lounge we wanted to visit that night. I have NEVER had that personal interest before! The bed was wonderful, really no complaints. The room wasn't huge (especially with a treadmill in it!) but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't not have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: Jane M
Reviews.Content: I just want to send a big thank out to the staff at the Westin Boston Waterfront for making our stay a most memorable, special experience. It was my husband's birthday and our 25th wedding anniversary. The staff made us feel special and treated us as if they were truly pleased for us. We were comfortable and felt welcome. We even stayed in the accommodating restaurant relaxing while nibbling on our buffet breakfast. We will remember our stay with fond memories and would just like to recognize the staff for making it so special.

Reviews.Title: “Character stops in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: There were no problems with this hotel, but it's basically a large convention hotel and that's all. It's got a beautiful lobby with some great stone work. The character, however, stops as soon as you step onto the guest room floors. They reminded me of a new-construction condo building: builder-grade cheap gray carpet, metal doors, gray paint, and nothing on the hallway walls. The room itself was similar -- while it was spacious and the typical Westin "heavenly bed" (very comfortable) and a large desk, it was completely bland and featured cheap fixtures and absolutely no character in the decor. I think the hotel was going for minimal, but it came across as just...boring and cheap. Location-wise, the hotel's convenience to the convention center can't be beat. However, if you're planning on exploring Boston beyond the convention center, there are far better hotels; this hotel is isolated and requires either a healthy walk or a cab to major Boston neighborhoods. There are not many restaurants/shops very close to the hotel. The room rate is pretty hefty. So, I'd say if being right next to the convention center is your top priority; pay that rate. If not, you'll get a better experience for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Conventions and Airport Access”
Reviews.Author: Tkyrnr
Reviews.Content: Check in was very smooth. Room upgrade to a suite is one of the perks of being a Starwood Preferred member. Restaurant was above average with ok food but friendly and efficient service. Bed was comfortable and heavenly shower was awesome. Only problem was catching a cab after a convention was over. Hotel could use a better way to attract cabs during a rush.

Reviews.Title: “Love the place”
Reviews.Author: nimy
Reviews.Content: Though I only stayed here for only a short time (left at 4am) to catch the flight, I love this hotel. Every staffs I met were very helpful. Lobby was nice and pretty. The room was spacious and the bathroom was sparkling clean and modern. What I like best was the bed. It was so comfortable with a nice sheet. First I thought the hotel would be pretty far from the city but it wasn't that bad. Pretty much half way between an airport and the city. Would love to stay here again next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: LunaJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when attending a convention. The rooms were clean, everything worked, and bed was comfortable. Service was good too. A few negatives: There was one day they forgot to replace my towels so I had no towels after getting out of the shower. Fortunately I was in a suite so I got towels from the other bathroom. From my room I could also hear other room doors closing- I think the doors close too strongly and therefore slam shut. The food at the buffet was ok for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Newsey1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tired. Lobby is worn out especially the furniture. On sat nite city bar is closed at 7 pm and there in no restaurant for a complete meal except the Irish pub. Hallway rugs are food stained, looks like a frat party happened here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel / great workout room”
Reviews.Author: stetson
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for a on overnight business trip so I did not get a chance to fully explore the hotel but I an say the rooms were very clean and large and the workout room was top notch. Valet parking was a bit expensive; there was self parking that I did not investigate.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities, great service”
Reviews.Author: Anneymomo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Westin Boston Waterfront from 10/22/11 through 10/26/11 to attend the conference. It was very convenient because the convention center was connected to the hotel. I could go back to my hotel room to drop off or pick up stuff anytime. Also, it was only a few subway (bus?) stops from the airport. The hotel was pretty new and clean - the room smelled good and no noisy water pipe sounds. I requested optional amenities a few times and they brought them to my room right away. The bed was comfortable with multiple types of pillows so that I could choose the most comfortable one to me. The only flaws that I can think of are 1) a housekeeping staff did not really do a great job at cleaning the room, 2) I could never watched one of the TV channels (no good connection), and 3) it is not in Downtown. But I will surely use this hotel again if I attend a conference at the convention center next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobGS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Westin due to a conference I was attending. It is attached to the covention center so is perfectly located if that is your purpose for being in Boston. The rooms were very nice and functional for business needs. It is about a $5 to $10 cab ride to the downtown area. There are restaurants at the hotel, but if you prefer to dine out you will probably need a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “good for convention patrons”
Reviews.Author: cuisinsky
Reviews.Content: This was our first experiment with Priceline. We paid about $100 extra for the experience. The hotel is truly first class except for a few minor items. The bathroom sink was engineered to save water so well that any sensible person would conclude that it didn't work correctly. On the other hand the shower had two showerheads and put out enough juice to do an elephant. Since the location is somewhat removed from the action, they advertize a shuttle to the main tourist area. The trouble with this is that they drastically restricted the hours and it was difficult to find. We used cabs instead. The concierge was very helpful and even suggested we not eat at the hotel. Instead she made reservations for us at Bricco in the North End. The osso buco was apparently cooked or reheated in plastic. The restaurant also didn't seem to be doing very well. That said, I would stay there again if I was in town for a convention.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Convention Center Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KC_travels08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2011 for a multi-day convention. It is the second time I've stayed at this hotel. Overall I would describe the hotel as your standard, convention center hotel. It is next door and connected to the Boston Convention Center, so if your event is in the CC it can't be beat. The decor in the lobby is modern. Rooms are standard size...well appointed with HD flat screen TV, great beds, nice sized desk, and a sitting chair. Bathrooms have a tub/shower combo with double shower head. In-room internet service is available at two prices depending upon chosen download speed (the new standard in hotels.) However, free internet with excellent service is available in the hotel lobby and throughout the Convention Center (easy access from the 2nd floor of the hotel.) There is also a good fitness center and indoor pool for working out. I didn't eat it the hotel as there are many options within a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. I did sample all the bars in the hotel, which can get crowded and slow if there is a big convention crowd descending at the same time. Staff is extremely professional, friendly and accommodating. We were always greeted warmly in hallways and the lobby by the hotel staff. This is a courtesy that I truly appreciate and I compliment the employees for making guests feel welcome and special. With regard to location, it is not in the center city...but it is an easy and safe 20 walk to Boston Common. For people who don't like to walk, a cab fare to the action is about $10-$12 one way. The hotel is also a block from the silver line of the T (public transportation). You will need to change lines at South Station to go most places, but it is an inexpensive alternative to taxis and walking. In summary, a great Westin hotel that is the very best option for a convention center gathering. If you want to be downtown you should choose elsewhere, but also realize downtown is easily accessible from here..

Reviews.Title: “B+ in Boston”
Reviews.Author: DelicateEssie
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this hotel. The meeting space is on the level below the lobby level and there is no direct access to the lower level from the elevator banks that service the sleeping rooms. It's inconvenient to have to go down to the lobby level and then take an escalator down to the meeting level, especially if you need to return to your room and go back to your meeting. The rooms were pretty small given the location, but this is a fine place to choose to host an event.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business Travel!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTaxidia
Reviews.Content: Just a few miles from the airport and attached to the Convention Center - this Westin was in the perfect location for my business trip. Food at Sauciety was very good (great lobster roll) and the lobby bar was pretty active every evening. Rooms were what you would expect of a Westin. Spacious with a comfortable bed, nice bathroom and comfy robes for relaxing. If you are traveling for business or attending a conference - this hotel can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “The concerige at desk on afternoon tour and Super Duck Tours”
Reviews.Author: LynetteAnthony
Reviews.Content: She was of great assistance and Super Duck Tours are awesome. Will recommend to friends and family visiting the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff and service”
Reviews.Author: liamsdad01007
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed with our 2 dogs at this hotel. We had been made temporarily homeless by an extended power outage in our community. The staff was fantastic - very accommodating and supportive. I travel quite a bit for business, and I was very pleased with the service we received during a challenging time for us. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Clean, Modern, Attached to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: TravelDeer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights. The hotel was large, clean, and modern. Pleasant scent throughout the hotel. Lobby was large with a nice lounge space. It was decorated with fake aspen trees, but done in a tasteful manner. The front desk staff was very friendly, accommodating, and professional. The room was not the largest, but it was clean and neat with simple decor. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was clean, and the shower had two showerheads. The water pressure in the shower and the sink was not the best, though; okay but not great. One problem was that there was no TV remote when we first got to the room. After calling the front desk, a maintenance person came to the room within 10 minutes. He was extremely professional and friendly, and took his time to test out a new remote (which didn't work), then look at the TV to make sure it worked. He returned soon afterwards with a functioning remote and all was well. On his way out, he also fixed the alarm clock. These were small issues in an otherwise very nice stay. The hotel is attached to the Convention Center and located within a 6-10 min walk to the waterfront and a multitude of restaurants. It's about a 17-21 minute walk to the casual and very good Yankee Lobster restaurant. I found the area around the hotel to be safe and clean, even at night. There are daytime activities and good nightlife along the waterfront near the hotel (i.e., restaurants and bars), but it's a bit out of the way from the historic area of Boston and the Freedom Trail. You could walk to the main tourist sites, but taking a cab is a very quick and easy roughly $12 cab ride. You could also take the metro, which has a couple of stops very close to the hotel. I think that the hotel is great if you are here for a convention/business, but I can see how it would be a bit out of the way to see other parts of Boston. But, it really is an easy trip to get to downtown Boston via cab or metro. Parking is available for a fee in the hotel parking lot. It was not difficult finding spots. The cost was $32 per day, though, which I think is a little steep. Con: It would have been nice to have free wifi in the room. If I remember correctly, there was a fee for this (I didn't use it because there was a fee, so I am unsure of the charge). Room tip: ask for a quiet room with a city view. Not sure if I got lucky, but I got a top floor room with a terrific view of Boston. I would stay here again if going to the Convention Center. I was very comfortable and happy with this hotel. If coming just for vacation, though, I would need to reevaluate this hotel in relation to others which may be more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Best for conventions”
Reviews.Author: Cottonwood
Reviews.Content: This Westin is a convention hotel by all accounts with the majority of patrons donning name badges as if they are lost and need to find their tour groups. The rooms are standard in nature with the prerequisite Westin amenities. I did like the "green" option to decline housekeeping and receive a $5 gift certificate or 500 SPG points/ night declined (except the morning of checkout). A lot of wear and tear to these rooms occurs due to the high convention traffic so the furniture in my room looked a little tired. There are limited dining options within walking distance to the hotel, but there is a "dining trolley" that makes stops at most of the nearby "tourist" restaurants. The hotel restaurant, Sauciety, is mediocre with a limited menu and over-priced fare. I'd skip it and venture out for more appetizing food. The hotel scores points for proximity to the convention center (it is attached) which makes it an attractive option for those who rank location relative to the convention center as their highest priority. Otherwise, I'd opt for a more interesting hotel in one of Boston's neighborhoods and take a meeting shuttle, taxi, or public transportation to the convention center as the Westin's surrounding area is not very exciting or appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: travelinjep
Reviews.Content: This hotel is attached to the new convention center in Boston which was convenient for us since we were attending a meeting. The hotel itself is lovely; very modern. Room was quite nice. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful throughout. It is not located in the most exciting area in Boston, but there are some interesting places along the South waterfront and the jogging map provided takes you by and on the fishing piers. It is not far to Back Bay and restaurants. There is an Irish bar type restaurant in the lobby which was good. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “not all i expected...”
Reviews.Author: triptaker2003
Reviews.Content: more $$ is not always better - not worth the money spent for a one nite stay. my room just seemed to be "incomplete". they did take care of the fact there was nothing for supplies in the bathroom & no robe after i called. there was trash left in the chair and hair on the bathroom floor. then the cable went out (i know this was not their fault) - just added to the late nite arrival and lack of relaxation time. also had to call to get a credit for 2 nites of parking on my bill for a one nite stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for touring Boston”
Reviews.Author: GaryH904
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and used "Old Town Trolley" which has a pick up in the front of hotel and never used anything other than them for traveling into downtown. Made staying here great and many food places within short walking down to waterfront area (7 min walk). Highly recommend Jerry Remy's sports bar. Used "Silver Line" bus from airport for $2.00 drops within 3 min walk to total. Great place to stay for business or tourist!

Reviews.Title: “A business hotel”
Reviews.Author: PierTom
Reviews.Content: If you are doing business at the large Boston Convention and Exhibition Center, this hotel is for you. It is a completely pleasant and adequate hotel for the business traveler. The lobby is welcoming, and there are bars aplenty. The restaurant scene is minimal, but that is probably what the business traveler wants since Boston is awash in good restaurants. The rooms are perfectly suited to business travel. They are clean, good-sized and have nice bathrooms. There is nothing of any particular character here. The hotel prices seem to be in line for big city hotels in the northeast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location for Conference Attendees”
Reviews.Author: IzzyEdmonton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a 10 min taxi ride from the international airport and is right across the street from the Boston Convention Center, connected on the 2nd floor by a pedway. This makes it extremely convenient if you are in Boston for a conference that's held at the convention center. Rain or snow, you don't need to bring an umbrella or coat to attend your meetings - which makes it extremely convenient. You can also leave your hotel room 5 min before your meeting starts and still make it there on time! It is close to TD Gardens where hockey and basketball actions are. The downside though, is that it is far from downtown. Therefore, it you are in Boston for pleasure, you may not want to stay here. The lobby is large and nicely decorated in contemporary style. It is clean and inviting. Even though the hotel was very busy as it was during our conference, it did not feel crowded in the lobby because of its size. Bell staff was very attentive. Check in was quick and easy. We were given a room on the top (16th) floor, reserved for SPG members. However, our room had a water pipe or something running across the ceiling and it made a hissing noise constantly. We asked to be moved to another room before we even settled in and the front desk promptly accommodated us. We were happy with the 2nd room and stayed for 4 nights. The room was spacious, with a large work desk, flat screen TV, 2 double beds - which were "heavenly" and extremely comfortable as you would expect from a Westin. The closet was small for the size of the room. Bathroom was a good size. Room was clean. In room coffee maker with Starbucks coffee was convenient. Workout area was a good size with 5 ellipticals, 5 stationary bikes & 6 treadmills as well as free weights. Starbucks in the lobby was welcomed as were all the nice restaurants in the hotel. Food was tasty and the Birch Bar made a great cosmopolitan! Nice place to unwind at the end of a long day of meetings. The concierge (Sharon Ash) was a great help - getting us reservations at local famous restaurants with very short notice - seemingly pulling off an impossible task as these places were usually fully booked. I would stay here again next time I'm in Boston for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but not luxe.”
Reviews.Author: suelhallmd
Reviews.Content: If you have a convention to attend at the new Boston Convention Center, this is the place for you. There's a bridge over the street from the hotel to the center which makes it easy in bad weather to get comfortably to where you need to go. Starbucks on site makes breakfast easy and cheap. Rooms are quiet and nice, but overall hotel is a bit utilitarian. One drawback is you have to take a taxi to get just about anywhere; hotel location is out of the way except for convention center...unless you are a major walker.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in boston”
Reviews.Author: harlemfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Boston Harbor while attending a conference in the convention center next door. Great place for a conference very close to airport - easy drive/cab ride. Hotel is very nice good food and service - nice clean rooms. All staff very professional. Nice beds and linens. But the coffee is awful...

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge”
Reviews.Author: MargoandJerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Waterfront at the end of our 2 week trip. The hotel is modern and bright, an easy walk into the city and a short cab ride to the airport. One of the highlights was the service of the conceirge Theresa Finnegan, she was helpful, polite and "run off her feet". Thanks for the great restaurant tip and reservation !

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean & Modern Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: SunKissed129
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a few days in September for a work related convention. The hotel dÃ©cor is modern and the rooms very clean. Donâ€™t be surprised if you see people in the lobby leeching the free Wi-Fi (me included) on laptops as in-room Wi-Fi is $15 per day. If you are a Starwood Preferred Guest (SPG), you can opt-in to either get 500 SPG points or $5 in hotel credit per day if you donâ€™t have your room cleaned. The credits are pretty useless as they arenâ€™t accepted at City Bar or Birch Bar & Grill. After one day of not having our room cleaned, we promptly opted-out! MJ Oâ€™Connorâ€™s is an over-priced pub that you can find in any American metropolis. Nothing Special. The burgers are good and they have a large selection of local beers. Pros: Walking distance to downtown and shopping Beds are really comfortable The showerhead is AMAZING! Cons: No free Wi-Fi in rooms, only in the bar No mini fridge, although the mini-bar looks like a fridgeâ€¦.itâ€™s not!

Reviews.Title: “Room nice but general experience just ok”
Reviews.Author: athtrasna
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on Priceline for an overnight transit through Boston, worked out cheaper than any of the "airport hotels". Arrived around 9pm...nice large bright lobby but SO noisy..there was some sort of reunion party going on in the main bar/restaurant and you could hardly hear yourself think in the lobby. Check in was efficient. Our room was large and airy, with lots of floor space but the usual problem of not enough electrical outlets to charge all the electronics for our next day of travel. Went down to the Irish bar for some dinner....food and service was just average...and not an Irish staff member to be found (I actually asked as there was some particular information I needed that would have been a word of mouth thing). Decided to try the concierge but the desk was unstaffed for the 5 minutes we stood at it. Went back to our room and dialled the number but it rang out and eventually went to voicemail, we opted to give up. There was free wifi in the lobby area and two levels of paid wifi in the room. As there was something we needed to see from home online we opted for the Gold service (which the info said was required for streaming) at $19.95. Signal was poor and unstable and crashed at least three times in the hour (the charge was refunded at checkout when we mentioned this) The bed was large and comfortable. En suite bathroom was also a decent size and had the all important magnifying mirror. Double shower head with a notice about Westin's famous dream showers...and information on how to get the second head working. Well it certainly wasn't the shower of my dreams, even with both, pressure was poor. The location is great if you're going to the convention centre and a relatively short cab ride from the airport. The location has little else going for it...I would stay there again only for transits such as this.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack T
Reviews.Content: great room, great prices, great location, great food & bar. Why go anywhere else. Had other nights in the Mandarin (who are full of snobs) and the Hilton (which was ok but a bit jaded) but this was the best. It might not be in the centre of town but an easy walk or bus ride and you are there.

Reviews.Title: “No restaurant except irish bar”
Reviews.Author: stangina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention-connected to the convention center so very convenient. Room very nice and comfortable - but internet charge on top of high hotel rates, over $250 with taxes. However, there is no restaurant in this hotel for dinner, except for the Irish Bar. There is a lunch and breakfast area, but it closes mid-afternoon and is much too expensive (Continental buffet was Ok at $15, which included all the juices, oatmeal, etc except for cooked items; lunch was close to $40 with tip - Dinner at legal test kitchen down the street was less incl wine). Renaissance down the street has very good restaurant and other restaurants are very close by the Renaissance so your choice is to stay at the Westin and walk to the restaurants or stay at nearby hotels and walk to the Convention Center. I would probably choose somewhere else next time, maybe downtown Boston rather than in the isolated convention area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Kingky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clearly geared to the business traveller as it's attached to the adjacent convention centre. What this essentially means is that they charge you for almost everything and some of these things aren't exactly cheap. The rooms are large so it's easy to share them to keep the price down. The dÃ©cor is bright and inoffensive and the bathroom well-appointed. The complementary toiletries are very nice. Additionally, the room includes everything you expect: mini-bar, safe and a coffee-maker that actually makes pretty decent coffee. The beds were extremely comfortable and the air conditioning worked well. Internet is available in the room at a (high) price (you can choose from two speeds) but it's free in the public areas (lobby, mezzanine etc.) Location-wise, the hotel is not central to Boston, but it's a comfortable 20-minute walk from the city centre. Alternatively you can take the silver line from World Trade Center station, which also provides a direct link to the airport. A taxi from/to the airport will set you back about $15 (excluding tip). I feel, considering the distance, the room rates should have been lower to reflect this. Note also that the room rate includes a copy of USA Today. If you don't want this, they will take the money off your bill. The staff in the hotel were all polite, helpful and attentive. Check-in was efficient, check out more so: they print your bill and take the payment from your card before you get up on the morning of your departure. Regarding eating, there's a branch of Starbucks integrated into the hotel. This is a cheaper breakfast option than the hotel's own offering, which is a highly-priced yet average breakfast buffet. I gave the Irish Pub a try for dinner, and that was fine but, again, the food was expensive for what you got. If you want to try somewhere outside the hotel, there are some options on the waterfront (past the World Trade Center) or along Summer Street. However, if you want a better selection you should go into the city centre (the Quincy Market, theatre district or Chinatown areas are good bets). The hotel also has a fitness centre and swimming pool but I didn't use those so cannot comment. Overall, this hotel is fine if you're on business (at the convention centre) but you are better off (and richer in some cases) staying in central Boston if you're a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - watch for extra charges”
Reviews.Author: CDDDDDD
Reviews.Content: Loved how the hotel seemed to include lots of eco features. Very comfortable beds, nice employees, nice linens/ bathrooms, modern - that's why I gave it 4 stars. The restaurant Sauciety was way too expensive! At breakfast they served each of us orange juice and charged us $8.00 a glass, left with a $100 + bill for us and the kids. The next morning I ordered from the kids in room dining and it was $35. - much better. You would think that for this price of a room you would get incredible internet access for free but you have to pay extra for that - there is a "silver' option and a "gold" option. The silver option is really bad and you end up cursing your computer and the hotel. It's torturous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravelerpdx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for four nights while attending the American Academy of Pediatrics National Conference at the adjoining Boston Convention and Exhibition Center. As many have said already, the Westin is perfect for one attending a conference at the BCEC. The hotel is spacious, airy, cool and contemporary in design. It's not warm or intimate. The Westin might be OK for a casual tourist since the World Trade Center T-stop is literally a 5 minute walk from the hotel; however, given convention business, it's unlikely that a "special" rate will be available to make the Westin Waterfront a better deal than other establishments closer to central Boston. I stayed in room 1308. Pluses: 1) The staff seems very prepared for large numbers of people passing through the lobby and/or checking in to the hotel. 2) Nice view of the Boston skyline from 1308. 3) Free internet in the public spaces. Wireless/wired access for a fee in the rooms (two speeds). 4) Very nice and spacious workout room with several Lifefitness treadmills, ellipticals, recumbent and upright bicycles. The indoor pool is just long enough to make laps possible. 5) The Westin is very close to restaurants in the Seaport area. The Seaport and Renaissance Hotels are the two other large establishments in this part of town, and both are only steps away from the Westin though they are technically closer to the waterfront. (The waterfront, incidentally, isn't a particular draw for any of these hotels including the Westin. None are actually on the waterfront). 6) Direct access to the BCEC (in a way both a plus and a minus depending on your point of view). 2) Rooms are typical Westin: contemporary, reasonably spacious, nice bath and amenities, and, of course, the Heavenly Bed. A little wear and tear is evident in some of the furnishings. Minuses: 1) Selection of dining establishments in the hotel is limited, especially for dinner. MJ O'Connors is an "Irish pub" that serves perfectly good food in a very casual environment. Prices are relatively modest. Sauciety is a breakfast and lunch venue that is actually more aligned with the open and contemporary design of the hotel. I had a very enjoyable lunch here. Too bad Sauciety isn't open for dinner! Other restaurants in Seaport are not far away even on foot, but good luck in getting in if convention activity is strong and the Seaport and Renaissance Hotels are full (which is highly likely). 2) While the Westin is theoretically within walking distance of central Boston, the environment isn't exactly "walking friendly." Overall, the Westin Boston Waterfront is a very nice business hotel. The Westin Copley Place would be a better Starwood alternative closer to central Boston.

Reviews.Title: “holiday”
Reviews.Author: barry m
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel, comfortable rooms and excellent concierge where nothing is too much trouble. A bit of a walk into town is the main drawback.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time at the Westin Boston Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Libby L
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent a wonderful weekend at this hotel, the property and the accommodations were excellent.. The room was beautiful with a view of the harbor, plus everything was very clean. It takes 6 or 7 minutes to walk from the hotel to the water from the hotel, but it is located in the financial district and not in area where everything seemed to be happening. The employees were wonderful help to us in every way, especially a concierge named Theresa Finnegan, who went out of her way to help us with the best tours, etc. We found her to be very pleasant and patient. The beds there were "heavenly" to say the least. We loved this hotel and loved Boston....we shall return.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: 2011WelshTraveller37
Reviews.Content: The room was a good size, good view, and really clean. we had a twin room and the beds we very comfortable and spacious. The hotel itself was huge and quite corporate, food was quite good, staff were very helpful. In a good location for conference centre but a taxi ride to nearest shops.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to say anything bad...”
Reviews.Author: tweakes
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel and the service at this hotel are superb. I loved the room, loved the bathrooms, loved the overall feel of the property. The only question is the location ... it's not unsafe by any means, but don't expect too many pedestrians in the area immediately surrounding the property so if you are single you might want to take that into consideration. At the same time, I never saw any homeless or vagrants in the area. I just don't think the location offers very much ... we walked down to the waterfront where there were some bars with long lines and some fancy restaurants, but not much in between for just someone wanting a regular dinner (though this was a Saturday night). We stayed there because we booked it last minute and so many other hotels were sold out or over $500 ... and I think we definitely got our money's worth and did not mind the $12-18 cab ride to where we wanted to go. Also, parking is $42 for valet / $32 for hotel guests ... which is also the same price for the public for up to 24 hours. It's a personal preference, but I don't like paying the same price as the general public when I'm giving them a heck of a lot more money, but that's neither here nor there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad spot although a bit off the beaten path for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: rosey1963Toronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with young teen girls who loved the pool! A bit far from the activities we had planned but clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Westin”
Reviews.Author: sergeik
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because it was connected to the Convention Center. Nice modern hotel, but a bit away from the core of Boston. So you will need either to hoof it about 1 mile plus or take a cab. Great, new, modern and clean hotel. So if you are going to a conference, I'd plan on staying at this place since its so convenient, but be forewarned that it books up pretty fast for conferences.

Reviews.Title: “On the pictures it looked quite different from...:) Save the money for something else..”
Reviews.Author: Businesspassenger
Reviews.Content: On the pictures it looked quite different from...:) Save the money for something else.. Was very disappointed with the room, for so much money would you expect a bit more, it is really a 4star hotel? And then the many hidden costs, 1 hour parking is 24-42 dollars! (3x more expensive as the renting!!!) If you want internet / WiFi, it costs again (about 20 U.S. if you want an acceptable speed), and you can only connect one device, for an example: if you have an iPhone and one Notebook, you need to pay the fee twice! Nearly in all hotels / restaurants / supermarkets etc. in the U.S. you can get WiFi for free, but not in the Westin Boston Waterfront 4*! If you want to have something from the view of Boston, you must be at least in the 10th floor, otherwise you see only a few ugly buildings... The swimming pool is difficult to reach and very small. TV is annoying: between each channel tedious hotel advertising. In the bathroom the floor is cold and it is fully air conditioned. To switch the lamps on in your room, you need almost to be a scout, the switches are hidded in the lamp and you get full blinded when you switch on (Please ask for sunglasses on the desk). The rooms are very ring of hearing, you can hear other guests talking in the hallway or walking steps from your bed. Every door bangs, as if it were your own roomdoor. On the morning from 7 clock, you wake up with infinite door knocking in all rooms, this can drive one quite mad. Conclusion: save the money for a good meal or anything else in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “So comfy....”
Reviews.Author: franci329
Reviews.Content: This hotel might not be located right smack in the midddle of the tourist area's but I have to say my stay was wonderful. The bed is super comfy and the size of the room is just big enough even for 4 of us. We were celebrating some birthday's at the new restaurant complex and the walk is probably not even 5 minutes. The staff checking in was great and so friendly. I never have my starwood number and I like the fact that they remind me and look it up. After dinner and drinks we came back and hung at the City Bar. Again, the staff was great and the drinks kept coming. I'm also addicted to Starbucks and it's pretty cool that you have one right down stairs. Great night sleep and I would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Boston Waterfront â€“ excellent hotel for families!”
Reviews.Author: christine s
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a perfect location, just off to the side of the hustle and bustle of Boston, but within walking distance to it. Itâ€™s a huge hotel and very family friendly. When we were checking in one of the hotel staff came out with a trolley full of toys and our children were kept busy while we were checking in. We were so impressed by this gesture. The rooms were very clean with great views and the beds were heavenly. There is an excellent morning buffet offered where kids eat free. On Sunday morning, they had a clown making balloons for the children in the lobby. The pool was great to relax and cool down after a day of touring. Concierge desk â€“ best service we have ever had! Teresa Finnegan was wonderful. We highly recommend booking with her. She has a family of her own and gave a lot of good tips and options that saved us money. She highly recommended the Upper Deck Trolley Tours. This was the perfect way to tour the city with young children. Itâ€™s a 2 day pass that allows you to hop on and off anytime. Parents get a very informative tour, while the children enjoy the bus ride or have a chance to take a nap. Itâ€™s a fantastic company with drivers that are very knowledgeable and very friendly. Included in the 2 day pass is a river or boat cruise. It was a deal! We stopped by her desk afterwards and thanked her for her help. We will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not convenient to tourist attractions, plan on driving alot”
Reviews.Author: KRISTA D
Reviews.Content: While the I would rate the hotel itself wonderful I would not rate the location good at all if you are looking to be in a touristy section of Boston. We quickly realized upon entering the area that this was mainly designated for people attending the nearby convention center or some sort of business conference at the hotel itself. I am detailing this in hopes this might help those planning a trip to Boston that might be looking for something that is more centrally located to touristy attractions, if that is what you are looking for then this hotel is DEFINITELY not it. Nothing is really in walking distance unless you are going to the aquariam, luckily we brought our car so we drove everywhere which wasn't as horrible as maybe NYC but still could be a slight pain when looking for parking. I would recommend Back Bay or Copley Square areas which are jumping with lots of shopping and restaurants and cafes. The hotel itself is very nice but if you are looking for a nearby restaurant you aren't going to find it!

Reviews.Title: “My first Westin experience :)”
Reviews.Author: TheRodgers4
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Westin and it was wonderful!! I had always heard about the comfortable beds. I have to say the bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in at a hotel. The room was very nice and clean, the bathroom was a good size - very comfortable. The concierge, Theresa Finnegan, was very informative and knowledgeable about the Boston area. She recommended a trolley tour and handled the purchase of our tickets. When we got back from the tour, we stopped by the concierge desk to thank her for the recommendation. I highly recommend this hotel if staying in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Nardiesally
Reviews.Content: I secured a rate on hotwire for $181/night. As a Starwood Gold member, I received an upgrade to a room with a city view. Exercise facilities were great and the room was clean and comfortable. There was a convention going on so the lobby was very crowded and the restaurant choices were limited. It was a good location for me, but a bit of a walk to the city. Great for conventions. The hotel is new and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Bed, indeed!”
Reviews.Author: SarahP1118
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with friends for a girls' getaway. We got a great deal through Hotwire and really enjoyed this property. The main selling point is the Heavenly bed and shower--both were outstanding. We had originally booked a room with two double beds but (as a convention was in town) were re-assigned a king room with a rollaway bed. The rollaway, to my delight, also features the Heavenly mattress and bedding, which was great and a nice surprise. We also liked the hotel's pool and whirlpool -- a nice way to unwind at the end of the day. On-site Starbucks was great in the morning, and there are plenty of other restaurants either on-property or a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: travelerjones
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with a friend in july 2011. Everything was immaculate.. Fresh, clean room, beautiful lobby with restaurants & bars, the front desk staff is quick, efficient & friendly. The valet staff are amazing! I forgot the gentleman's name, but he was so personable & helpful- he got us a great spot on a free shuttle into the part of the city we wanted to go that night. When we cam back to the hotel he was joking with us, remembered our names.. Just an excellent fellow with great customer service skills.. It makes your stay better :) South Boston is beautiful, I wish I could have stayed longer. Great hotel & staff!

Reviews.Title: “A clean, comfortable 'conference' hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jjamfactory
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable, modern hotel about a mile from the city right next to the Boston conference centre. We arrived on Labour day - so no conference - and the hotel was pleasantly tranquil - day 2 of our stay coincided with a Pharmaceutical Conference...so it became quite congested. no evening restaurant was no problem - there are lots of interesting harbour side restaurants close by. breakfast was good...but pricey; service was good if a bit impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable and super location”
Reviews.Author: Manue_and_JB
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston for Labor Day and stayed at this place. The location is perfect, very close to subway and buses, you can even come from the airport with the Silver Line direct! 10 minutes walk to South Station. Downtown is at walking distance, Starbuck Coffee for the morning in the hotel. Hotel is calm and clean with nice view on the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, comfiest bed, good to awesome location, depending”
Reviews.Author: nobo
Reviews.Content: I wish I had been going to an event at the BCEC, because this place is right next door - but alas, I wasn't. While the location might not be as ideal as some of the downtown hotels, it's a 10-15 minute walk from either the Broadway or South Station T stops, and I believe the Silver Line is even closer. Front desk staff was so thorough, friendly, and helpful. Room was clean and spacious. The bed was one of the most comfortable ever. It was also a great starting point for a jog down to the South Boston waterfront. I loved my stay here, and wish I could have stayed longer than one night.

Reviews.Title: “A Great time at this Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: calicocat_4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Westin Waterfront and enjoyed our stay. We are spg members and received an upgrade to a suite, which was a nice surprise. There were quite a few people taking care of check in, so we were quickly able to get to our room. We had a king bed, flat screen tv and the other part of the suite had a sofa with another tv (2 bathrooms were a plus). The room was very clean with modern furnishings. It was nice having a Starbucks in the lobby for tasty coffee treats. We ate breakfast in their restaurant and it was good, though expensive. The only negative we considered was that the hotel seemed isolated from other parts of the city. We took taxis to Quincy Market & to the harbor for a dinner cruise. I know there's a "t" station down the road, but I have difficulty walking, so opted for the taxi. This is a really nice urban- looking hotel that has a great staff, and we'd stay here again. There's a new Legal's Harborside Seafood Restaurant a few blocks away, and it was a fun place to go. It seems that this south side of Boston is starting to be developed for tourists. We hope that will happen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a so so location”
Reviews.Author: rua17
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel and the staff are breathtaking. It was the best hotel of our entire trip. The only problem was that we were traveling with a 65 year old lady so walking was not at option and all the restaurants are at least 3/4 mile away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean n Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: swiftfireman
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at The Westin Boston Waterfront in July 2011. I've stayed here a few times in the past and it's still looks new and clean. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, some with a partial nice view or no view at all just of the side of the convention center. The property is well kept and has a nice indoor pool. My only complaints are every time I've been at the Westin Waterfront my room never seems to be ready on time. I always have to wait till 5-6 pm to get a room. It seems like that is the norm due to other individuals complaining about the same problem. The staff was polite but really didn't do much, just said I had to wait. I guess it must be due to manpower or understaffing, who knows! Anyway just like last time they try to keep you happy or quiet by giving us a credit to Starbucks. A nice gesture but when you have three hungry kids $5 is not much. The property is close to Logan just a quick ride on the bus +

Reviews.Title: “There are no words......!”
Reviews.Author: SeekingForExcellence
Reviews.Content: To start off technically I only checked in with my friends, while waiting to get to my own hotel. BUT i cannot not comment on this hotel. upon arrival outside it is breathtaking and the interior keeps you going too. there are many people at front desk so there isnt much waiting for the check in. you have bellmen helping you with the luggage - although we didnt need any help. room was huge with two beds. Bathroom......i have no words, amenities of all sorts and the shower to DIE FOR! i probably will get that shower for my own bathroom at home! it's called the heavenly shower and it even has the logo of the hotel on it! room is so clean. we stayed on the 10th floor and view was beautiful - you can see planes landing as if it was right outside your window. the hotel is spotless, coffee delicious! plasma tv the whole lot. we called concierge for mouth wash, the only drawback is the lady had no clue if they supply it and you could hear her on the phone asking other staff members. maybe a little more training since she works at the concierge? but apart from that she was very nice - the gentleman delivered it in like 3 mins? i didnt even get a chance to brush my teeth yet! The only thing the iron was broken and the water was leaking everywhere - but i mean you cant check that in every room (i know from experience). it took a little while to deliver the iron, but the hotel was very busy so cant blame them for that. Thing that amazed me the most is the gentleman outside! one word: FABULOUS. they know EVERYTHING and when i say everything i mean everything!! cabs in like 30 seconds, they pack your bags and tell the driver where to go. they are what make your experience great right from the start!! boys used the gym they said it was good, although a little small. I mean top notch - will definitely stay there when i have a chance & try out the bed!! Job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizcee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights sightseeing on way to the coast. Only one clerk on reception when we were checking in so had to wait. He seemed a bit stressed so no warm welcome. Very nice room on 12th floor with views across the city and the bay. Starbucks coffee shop in the lobby, excellant idea. City bar, food, drink and service very good. We tried to book in for a return night before our flight out of Logan in 10 days time, there was limited space available but they wanted over Â£300 for a smaller room and we had only paid half that price booking through a travel agent in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TravelForever58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over a weekend in Boston. * This hotel is modern, comfortable and clean- the Westin Hotel scent is fresh and pleasing. Check-in is fast and efficient. * It is conveniently located next to the convention center. * If you can, avoid arriving during rush hour-- car traffic getting onto Summer Street can be gnarly. * Wi-fi is $12.95 for regular service, $18.95 for "hi-speed" service. (Although there is a Starbucks in the lobby, it is owned by the hotel and there is no complimentary wi-fi there.) Parking is $35 per day. * Breakfast at Sauciety is pretty much a standard business buffet and costs about $22 per person; we found the service to be somewhat less than attentive. * MJ O'Connors' Irish pub is a gem. The bartenders are very friendly and knowledgeable about their beer selections. Try the curry mussels-- they come with toasted bread slices which you'll want to use to soak up every drop of sauce. Our bartender even ordered extra slices of bread for us. I would return to MJ O'Connors again! * Cab fare to Logan Airport is about $15- $16 without tip. * I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Courteous and knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: Tanay B
Reviews.Content: Spent labor day weekend at the Westin Boston Waterfront hotel. The room was immaculate and the service very good. The concierge was very knowledgeable about local attractions. The hotel staff was very accommodating and provided excellent service throughout the stay. Definitely one of the best Westin properties and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jtkJakarta
Reviews.Content: Stayed there while in Boston for sightseeing. The hotel opened about one year ago, so everything is modern and new. As SPG Platinum, we got upgraded to a suite, and we greatly appreciated the extra space. Small drawback: The hotel has no club lounge. Hotel staff was professional, friendly and helpful. The location is somewhat off the beaten track, next to the convention center. If you enjoy to walk (which we do), its a 15 minutes walk to the city center, with a nice view of the Boston skyline. The alternative is the subway, which is across the street about 300 meters away. Both train station (Boston South) and the airport are a short taxi ride away. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay there and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nutravelsawait
Reviews.Content: Stayed in town for one night but the hotel was beautiful, nice lobby lounge, comfortable rooms and great location. View fromf our room was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and right next to convention center”
Reviews.Author: Magsy
Reviews.Content: Had a great welcome experience at the Westin. Loved the high ceilings and how open the whole lobby is. It's a really busy, happening hotel. I appreciated that there was wall to ceiling window in the room, made the room look much bigger than it was. Otherwise, it's a typical Westin room, with the usual amenities, minus the bath gel. I noticed that hotels don't provide that anymore. I had to call housekeeping to get it. I appreciated that they had a refrigerator in the room. I agree with the other posts parking and service for all the ancillary services were up there. If I wasn't traveling for business, I would not be spending much money at the hotel. I must commend the quality of the food and beverage offerings and quality at their various restaurants. Boston has wonderful restaurants and normally, I'm not crazy about hotel food. Their lobster roll, salads, soups and dessert were right up there with some culinary restaurants in Boston. All in all... a nice clean, modern hotel... nothing to brag about.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant modern timeless”
Reviews.Author: anett73
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, a stone's throw from the airport=- directly across from the best seafood shacks, Overall just a great place. A nice feeling of spaciousness pervades the whole complex. The lobby is especially appealing, bright airy , serene- with fresh coffee at the shop in the hotel lobby. The rooms are nice, clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “A business hotel....”
Reviews.Author: neum
Reviews.Content: Not really a family hotel, although they try. There were plenty of families staying there though. Easy to get to destinations. But it is a longer walk than it looks to get to Quincy Market or Aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great Place! But one big issue.”
Reviews.Author: brad d
Reviews.Content: This is wonderful place to stay for the most part. Away from the hectic big city by about a mile it was a great place to stay after a long day of work. Over all the staff was very helpful especially he front desk, bar staff, and 2/3 of the concierge. This is where the one big issue comes in. I had my fiancÃ© fly up for the weekend while I was on business and had booked her a trolley tour on Friday. When she went down to the concierge desk that morning to find out where to go she was met with a very rude concierge named Deb. She gave her very little info on where to find the trolley nor the next approximate time of the trolley arriving. This was very upsetting to us as she was alone for the day and this did not exactly start off the day on the right foot. Unfortunately this really tarnished the my opinion of what was otherwise a great 10 day stay. The only reason I gave it four stars is due to the service and helpfulness of the other employees.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern and Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: Mediaite
