Reviews.Content: This Westin has everything I count on during a hotel stay: Clean rooms, modern, well kept furniture and nicely appointed fabrications, a workout room and pool and a great location. The beds? Deliciously comfortable. The pillows? Most excellent choices of two densities (soft or firm) for each person. There's nothing not to like about this Westin. It's gorgeous and well thought out. Our encounters with hotel staff were positive. I really liked the bank of six elevators. No waiting! It was a good 20 minute walk to downtown, but the walk is picturesque. However, families with young children may want to think whether they want to schlep that much. Of course, there are buses and taxis queued outside. We took a taxi from the hotel to Boston Garden and it cost $12-15. A taxi to South Station subway was $5. There are other sites within a ten minute walk including Boston Harbor, Seaport Blvd. with it's varied restaurant offerings, Black Falcon Cruise Terminal (check out the cruise ships.) and the Bank of America Pavilion where we took in a concert on evening spur of the moment. The views of downtown are quite impressive from the hotel. This was a great hotel experience for us and I'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but snobby”
Reviews.Author: LolitaPA
Reviews.Content: This was a nice business hotel but the staff is like robots. No warm and fuzzy feeling here! We had 2 free nights here with our credit card points. We would not have paid the high price if we were paying. They also charge $32 per day parking and $12 per day WiFi. If you keep your car in parking lot more than 24 hour the last day, they charge you extra. It was an easy and safe walk to Fanueil Hall and restaurants. I felt safe even at night. We had a fire alarm at 1:30 a.m. Woke up to loud beep and then announcement to stay in room with door closed. No mention of fire, bomb, gunman. We had no idea what was up. I don't like not having a choice in my destiny. I need more info. Found out the next a.m. that a drunk pulled the fire alarm. We didn't get any kind of satisfaction from the desk at check out.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to saty”
Reviews.Author: Jfrcusson
Reviews.Content: We spend a week in this hotel. The T (metro) is a 5 min walk so it's easy to go downtown. What about those heavenly beds? There is nothing to write your mother about... The hotel Starbuck is a good place to have your breakfast. The pool is pretty small and was very noisy. Not a place to relax. When you book with this hotel, do not forget that you have to pay for the parking (30$ a day). Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Seaport area”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTourist10
Reviews.Content: Excellent 4 diamond property right next to the convention center, great city and harbor views, well maintained, very good food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, rooms etc. Location not great. TV poor.”
Reviews.Author: everthecritic
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights here and found it very comfotable and beautifully clean, I was very impressed by all the staff members I had contact with. The location is not the best: a 20 minute walk into town or 10 minutes to a metro station and Boston's metro is not the greatest by any means. If you are sight seeing a different hotel might be better. If you are relaxing by using the hotel's facilities or if you drive places then this is first class. One slightly humorous thing happened: there was a lot going on in the world when I was there and only CNN for good news coverage on TV in the room. I asked why BBC World was not available and asked if there was a comments card I could complete to say I thought this was rather an omission. The lovely reception lady said they do not have such cards but she told me the managers always read the Trip Advisor reviewers!

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: pat c
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Westin Boston, Waterfront. We just dropped our son off at college and did not want to go home directly to the â€œempty nestâ€� I was up early the next day without my wallet. I wanted to get a cup of coffee outside the hotel, but I did not have a dime. I did not want to go back to the room, I would have woken my wife up. I asked Orlando Ortiz, a guest service agent at the Westin, if I could take an advance against my room. He said no, but reached into his p ocket and gave me his own money so I could have that coffee. Thank you Orlando Ortiz for going above and beyond

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTE RIP OFF. PLEASE AVOID.”
Reviews.Author: Jon H
Reviews.Content: This place looks nice but CHARGES FOR PARKING AT AN EXORBITANT RATE. I was told i'd have my ticket validated and instead was charged TWENTY SIX DOLLARS FOR TWO HOURS PARKING. On querying this I was treated rudely and told "better get back to your car or it'll be 32 dollars". I live in NY and have travelled the world and never seen anything like it. DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND AVOID THIS PLACE. IT'S DISHONEST.

Reviews.Title: “special mention to an associate”
Reviews.Author: wayne c
Reviews.Content: was treated and helped with the utmost professionalism by the consierge Theresa Finnegan. she helped me get to a meeting off site with great proficiency and knowledge. Thank You Theresa

Reviews.Title: “Great location for conference hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Annie in Iowa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to Boston Logan Airport, within walking distance of several eating places at Seaharbor and is connected to the Boston Convention Center. Excellent location if you are here for a conference. I was hesitant about staying here because of some of the reviews on Trip Advisor, but chose to because of the convenience it would offer. I'm glad I did. I do not have one negative thing to say about the Westin, only positive. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Morning Run!”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: In addition to the clean, modern facilities, the Westin set itself apart for me via the fabulous 6:30AM running tour of the city that Bridget and Paul offered while I was there. I had a great time, got to know a little about the city, and got my morning run in all at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Like8s
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, convenient and within walking distance to some great seafood restaurants. Concierge extremely helpful. It's right on the route of the hop on and off sightseeing tours. It may be convention hotel but guest rooms quiet and customer service is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the running trail map”
Reviews.Author: neverhomeTX
Reviews.Content: This was everything you would expect from a Westin. Beautiful hotel, good food, good service, and great proximity to the Convention Center, which is why I was there. If you like to run, be sure to ask the concierge for a trail map. They had a credit card sized map that you could follow so you weren't stuck in the gym or worried about getting lost on a run. This was a true differentiator for me!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Drakarula
Reviews.Content: I came up to Boston to see a Yankees vs Red Sox game and stayed at this Hotel. I got a good deal by paying in full up front to get a 10% discount. The hotel was very big, clean, modern and comfortable. The only downside was that it was not walking distance to Quincy Market, but only a 5 min cab ride. They had underground parking that was safe and close. It is a convention center hotel but suited my needs being that my stay was only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: debjgraham
Reviews.Content: I was recently at the Westin Waterfront for a business conference. The front desk check in was swift and pleasant. We arrived early (way before the 3pm check in time) and the room was ready for us! We unloaded the luggage and then proceeded in to Boston by Silver Line (which is VERY convenient to the hotel) and subway, had lunch, shopped, and just walked around Boston. The room was large enough for two adults. There were two beds (as requested) and a nice HDTV, and a computer desk with high-speed (wired) internet in the room (included in the price of the convention rate). When we came back, I asked for a refrigerator to be brought to the room. I was told it would be "right up", if they had any left. Within 15 minutes of getting back to the room, I had a refrigerator! The toiletries were plentiful, and there is a safe in the room (big enough for a 15 inch laptop, but not much room left). There is a single-cup coffee/tea maker and that was perfect for me. The beds were big enough, and there were definitely enough covers. The only complaint would be for the pillows. I was there for two nights and I didn't find a pillow that was perfect for me. One wasn't enough but two were too much. Maybe with another couple of nights, I might have found the right one (there were a lot to choose from). Everyone I encountered was pleasant and seemed to like working there. The location was convenient, as I take public transportation (other people at the convention were mentioning walking a mile from the "cheaper" parking and that the hotel wasn't close to downtown Boston). I enjoyed the stay. I did wonder about the option to forgo housekeeping in exchange for $50 credit for another stay (or some SPG points), but I needed new towels (and shampoo, conditioner, and body lotion, of course!) and wanted someone to empty the trash each day. The front desk/check-in area is not well marked. We took a guess since a couple of people were in line with luggage. Also, the luggage check area was a guess and the concierge had a very small sign on the desk next to the pamphlets for area attractions. The biggest sign we saw was for the company the conference was for! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We slept like babies in those comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: saraalison
Reviews.Content: I scored a deal on a discount website for a 2 night stay for a fraction of the rack rate. Although I booked a room with 2 beds, when I called to confirm with the hotel I was told they didn't have any double rooms available and was given a room with 1 king bed. Since there were 3 of us I wasn't too excited about that. They said it wouldn't be a problem to get a roll away upon check-in. On the day of check-in the other 2 in my party got there a couple hours before I did due to flight complications. Since the reservation was in my name they were not able to get in the room but the hotel did hold their luggage for them. I called to see if I could check-in over the phone and they wouldn't let me do that. Once I did finally arrive check-in was very quick and they were even able to accomodate my request for 2 beds. I should add that I did take the T (silver line / bus) from the airport. However, once I got dropped off at the closest station (World Trade Center) I had NO idea which direction to go. Here's what you do ... go into the building and get to the 2nd floor. There are 2 bridges. Take the bridge that would be on top of the building you were just in. Once you cross the bridge the convention center is to your right and the Westin is to your left. Not a big deal as long as your luggage has wheels! Both the hotel lobby and room were very modern and clean. There is a Starbuck's right off the lobby as well as a convenience store. One morning we ate at Sauciety which is also connected to the lobby. They offer a buffet which didn't cost much more than ordering ala carte. I think it was $23 for the buffet which included coffee and juice. Our room was spotless. The bathroom mirror had incredible lighting. The double headed shower was wonderful! The vanity was in the bathroom so getting ready in the morning for us 3 ladies took awhile. There was a good size flat screen TV as well as a long desk with an office chair in addition to a stuffed chair. The beds ... oh, the beds ... were probably one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. In fact, one of the ladies that was with us is trying to find out what bedding they use so she can buy some for her home. We LOVED the beds! If you plan on taking a guided tour of the city, Old Town Trolley has a stop directly in front of the hotel. Good way to get to downtown without having to make a bunch of transfers. You can buy tickets at the concierge desk. The lady at the desk was very helpful with other stuff like finding good restaurants, etc. Legal Test Kitchen is also within a short walk. We also walked from the Barking Crab one evening. We discovered a few other spots to grab food/drinks. Like others have noted, if you want to be in the middle of all the action then this probably isn't the place for you. However, we didn't mind being away from it and found enough to see/do from this hotel. And the cleanliness and comfort that this placed offered more than made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return there”
Reviews.Author: FrenchCactus
Reviews.Content: Pros - Business: Very close to the Convention Center. We rented a meeting room to hold a seminar and the hotel was very generous with food and drinks. - Very modern and clean - The room was very big: huge bed with tons of pillows, seating area, desk. Well equiped: you can make tea and there's an ironing board + iron in the closet - Eating: there's a Starbucks downstairs, a restaurant from which you can order takeaways and good (albeit expensive) room service Cons - The walls of the room must be paper thin because I could here my next-door neighbour snoring. (The staff was gracious enough to have someone give me earplugs at 2am.) The electronic equipment in the room has very bright lights and they sometimes flash so if you're sensitive to that like me, be sure to bring a night mask. So in all, the room wasn't comfortable for sleeping despite the good bed. - Internet: you have to pay more than $10 for 24 hours of Wifi. I can't believe it wasn't free. - I had to leave in a hurry and forgot part of my belongings in my room. The staff sent me what they found but a valuable and large item was missing in the package. It wasn't in my bag either and I couldn't have lost it on the way home, so I'm 100% sure I left it in the room. The staff did not apologize. Because of that I wouldn't trust them with my belongings anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boston, Wonderful People! Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: JoAnnBruns
Reviews.Content: Amazing! Thanks to the service of the staff at the Westin, I had an incredible time in Boston. I was treated like royalty and like a friend at the Westin. During the day, I was on my own so Deb the Head Concierge made sure I had a pack schedule of things to do and see. Otto, the bell hop, made sure I made all of my connections and was in good hands. Darwin drove me around the city and gave me his number so was assured I could catch the van. And Nicholas, our Guest Service Agent, paid extra attention to all the details for our room. Even when we got home late w/ desserts, he promptly got us plates, silverware and napkins. I truly miss my friends back at the Westin Boston Waterfront. Make sure you say HI to Nicholas, Deb and Otto. Tell them JoAnn sent you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a little bit off the beatin' path.”
Reviews.Author: wilbur24795
Reviews.Content: The Westin Boston Waterfront is a wonderful hotel. I was there for a conference at the Boston Convention Center and the hotel was connected to the convention center which was excellent and very convenient. The hotel, as with almost every Westin, was immaculate, smelled fresh and was beautifully decorated. The rooms were great with nice flat screens, wonderful beds and again, with all Westins, great bathroom ammenities. The shower heads, the towels and the complimentary toiletries are top notch. The hotel is not in the heart of the city. A good 2 mile walk can get you to the city, maybe a mile and a half. There is a subway stop a couple of blocks from the hotel which was not a bad walk to get to the subway and then it is a couple of transfers to get to the stop at the Old State House downtown. A cab ride downtown was about $8-$12. The hotel is situated close to the waterfront with Legal Seafoods, Yankee Lobster Company, Legal Test Kitchen, and several other nice restaurants and upscale sports bars. The Bank of America Pavillion is within walking distance too. It's a great place! But, if you desire to walk out of your hotel door and be in the heart of the action, you might want to stay more in the center of town. But, if you don't mind being off the beatin' path a little, you can't go wrong with the Westin Boston Waterfront. It is an awesome hotel. By the way, WIFI is $12 a night. The Workout center is very well appointed. The indoor pool is great with a hot tub there too. OH, can't believe I forgot this...there is a Starbucks right there in the hotel lobby...great! There is an Irish Pub, a lounge, and another restaurant all right there in the hotel. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a snouty manager”
Reviews.Author: Anthony S
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel for the most part. The location was great for some of the attractions I wanted to enjoy. The bar in the lobby was a nice time. Now the night bar I believe could be if the bartender isn't having a bad night. She wasn't the nicest of people. So than I spoke to Caitlyn Weller when I was checking out. Well I was wrong to ask for her. What a Snouty person that is. She really wasn't too helpful. So my return to this hotel would a hard choice next time.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Boston Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: CrashClark
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival my wife & I were greeted with a courteous staff, friendly smiles and a warm charm not always found up north. The Concierge Theresa Finnegan assisted me before we even arrived with rental car info, parking, destinations and answered every question I had with patience and a smile. The hotel was beautiful, clean and very professionally run and so convenient to everything in Boston. I highly recommend the Weston Boston Waterfront and can only hope the next time we're there that Theresa is still part of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Luxury Hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Sholom P
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as part of our honeymoon that would eventually take us to Maine. I must say from the customer service too the quality of the rooms the Westin Boston Waterfront will be well remembered for its style, well appointed rooms, and a feeling of comfort and service that goes beyond the call of duty. In today's day and age with so many choices of hotels it is very difficult to search though the good and the bad. I can tell you that i am a very fussy guest and I was very pleased with it all, so if your travels bring you to Boston you will be very pleased to stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jaxfl32224
Reviews.Content: This is a great new luxurious hotel. The hotel is very convenient to the subway and to old town trolley. The star bucks in the hotel is convenient as well. The room is luxurious and had a great view of the harbor. Overall this is a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: profriars
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is great....very clean and modern. Great if you are going to the convention center. If you are doing anything downtown you feel like you are in Siberia with the location. Not a whole lot around the hotel and you feel far removed from anything interesting. But you should know that going in. One annoying thing I found was daily voicemail messages promoting services in the hotel. I don't know about you but when I get a voicemail blinking in my hotel room, I think something important has happened that someone had to track me down for.....not that there is a morning jazzercise class in the lobby. Found the walls thin as well - heard my neighbors phone conversation all night. My view was looking over an industrial neighborhood. I'll never understand why $400 a night hotels have to charge 12.95 for internet, yet $100 a night places don't. Sounds like a lot of complaints - but overall this is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Ran into a few service issues though.”
Reviews.Author: BrianDuddy
Reviews.Content: Check in was fine. When we got to our two room suite about 9:30pm we were settling in when I made my way over to the other room and found that the door was open. The lock was in the door jamb and had been intentionally propping the door open. As if that wasnt strange enough, there was a piece of paper towel jammed into the peephole on the same door. I checked the rest of the room to make sure nobody was inside and called the front desk. There was not very much concern on the other end of the phone. Security never showed up to the room. I gave up on the unsecured room problem, as my wife was trying to take a bath. Only too find the tub would not drain at all. Luckily the other room in the suite had another bathroom and she was able to rinse off in the tub/shower there with no problems. I decided not to call back down to the desk about the tub. It was getting late and we were tired. Since they didnt seem concerned about an unsecured guestroom, Im sure an issue with the tub wouldnt matter. Other than that, the hotel is beautiful and the rooms are what you would expect from a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Comfy!”
Reviews.Author: Akuragrl
Reviews.Content: I could not have picked a better hotel for my first time in Boston. Upon arrival the staff was incredible. From the receptionist to the concierge, everyone was helpful, whether it pertained to information or assistance regarding my room, or pointing out places to eat and sightsee. The lobby floor has a restaurant called City Bar and also a starbucks (very helpul for New Yorkers!) There is also a souvenir store right next to the starbucks. I stayed in a double bed room with friends and it could comfortably fit three or even four people. The rooms are incredibly clean and the beds are amazing! This hotel also offers late night in room dining. This hotel charges for parking (the only downside). Taxis are the easiest way to get around and super easy to get one outside the hotel. Average ride to points of interest like Fanueil Hall was around 10 minutes. Bottom Line: Great Hotel, I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Boston for an anniversary weekend because the site of our wedding reception (the Seaport) was booked and we are so glad we did! Our weekend begin at check-in where we met guest services agent Nick Cintas who could not have been more kind and gracious. Upon hearing it was our anniversary he upgraded our room giving us an amazing view of the city! We had cocktails at MJ O'Connors (on site) and the staff there could not have been more attentive and fun. Upon returning to our room after dinner, there was a complimentary bottle of champagne waiting for us. Simply a wonderful weekend at a beautiful hotel where clearly service and attentiveness is their first priority. I highly recommend the Westin Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect retreat from frenetic conferences”
Reviews.Author: Greenie_Christina
Reviews.Content: Conference hotels can be perfunctory pit stops or the highlight of the trip. The roomy, clean and beautiful room I had was an oasis. The bed was fantastically comfortable, as I've come to expect at westins. Great products, sheets, robe, lighting- loved it. Rate was fair for a conference rate, and I was actually surprised that it wasn't more. Bistro in lobby was only food experience- service was slow and food was super salty. Hotel service express, however, was responsive and got an a+ from me, so that's why I gave 4 stars for service instead of 5. What a nice break from the tired business hotels I'm often stuck in. Particularly loved the new Westin blue channel with continuous, gorgeous, simple nature videography. Super engaging and relaxing. Location is perfect if attending a conference, but there doesn't seem to much around for someone who might be using this as a base for a Boston visit, a possible minus for others. It's not far from the historic center and is close to waterfront and my room had view out to harbor, plusses.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rami1963
Reviews.Content: great hotel. it's not in the center of Boston - but it's only five minutes and 7-8$ in with a taxi ride from the center. They also have a shuttle service every half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: fintan12410
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Waterfront Westin while in town for the Cubs/Red Sox game. This happened to be in May when there were many graduations taking place and the city was extremely busy. The staff at the Westin provided us with an early check-in and late check-out with out a question asked. The bed was fabulous, the view was wonderful, and we found the room to be spacious, clean, and comfortable. It was also easy to get to from Logan on the T. I would say the only downside is there isn't much happening in the immediate area for tourists, but the South Station (which is a short walk) can get you hooked up with pretty much any public transportation system you need. We utilized the green line, red line, silver line, as well as Amtrak, all from South Station. I would definitely stay at this hotel if I returned to Boston, which I plan on!

Reviews.Title: “Always a nice room at the Westin Waterfront.”
Reviews.Author: efpub
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Westin Waterfront once or twice a year for several years now. The hotel is only a few years old, and is in-line with other Westins in offering a pleasing environment both in the lobby and in the rooms, without trying for outright5-star luxury that would demand a higher price. We've never had an issue with the rooms -- they've always been clean and large enough. We even took a cue from the interesting lights built into the frames around the mirrors in the bath to inspire something in our own house. Higher floors can look out on the Boston skyline (we also have), or theoretically out on the harbor. The hotel is connected to the BCEC convention center, so if you're going to a convention there, this can't be beat for location. It also has in-house event space on two different sides of the hotel. Some things to keep in mind: 1) Both valet and self parking in an attached garage are available, but can get expensive. 2) It's in the Waterfront area, which I think of more as a driving neighborhood than a walking one. 3) There is an MBTA silver line (bus lines that run mostly underground in dedicated tunnels!) stop close to the front of the hotel, so you do have access to the T network if you're headed somewhere and don't want to take the car. 4) It's close to the airport, but there's not a complimentary shuttle there. However, if you can wheel any luggage across the street to the silver line, you can take that, or just grab a cab for the short ride. 5) As far as dining, there's an MJ O'Connors Irish pub, Sauciety (a slightly off-beat restaurant usually serving breakfast and lunch only), but there's also a couple bars and it does have a Starbucks, so at least it has the bases covered. The staff has always been nice, although since we haven't had any issues, we haven't needed to rely on them too much other than check-in, etc, so that's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean room but I did not get the Harbor View as promised during booking”
Reviews.Author: Richardctchan
Reviews.Content: The stay was fair. I have booked a Harbor view room during the booking for extra money. I only get a city view room in the lower floor. It was too late to deal with it on the check in day since we did not arrive until 10:30 at night after 10 hours of drive. Complained to the front desk the second day. I have to ask for a rate reduce. The room was very clean and quiet but just not what I was promised. The hotel is a distance from all the downtown activities but I still have to pay for the expansive parking and the extra "Convention fee" since it is connected to the Convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay if you get at discount”
Reviews.Author: Steeeeeeeeeeve
Reviews.Content: Glad to hear others had a good experience but our fridge didn't work and they told us they didn't have any to replace it and $12 to $18 night for wi-fi and $32/night for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler222Irvine
Reviews.Content: Great new hotel. Adjacent to convention center and in the new Seaport Area. New development with restaurants but will need to drive into historic North End. Tour bus stops at hotel if interested - this is a great place. I'm a Westin fan and this one doesn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: basketballtraveler11
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay on the waterfront. We had previously stayed at the Renaissance that is down there and the Westin didn't dissapoint. The room was spacious and located near the silver line. Excellent value as well!

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: JeddaCath
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business as our conference was in the same hotel and the group rate at 209/night was reasonable. However there are hidden costs. As others have mentioned $32 /night parking for hotel guests is ludicrous. Internet is another 12.99/day. There is lobby free Wifi however some smart phones can't log on (like my Blackberry) and had to pay for Westin-PDA WiFi. The rooms are good, the bed comfortable and the bathroom is small. Your view depends on the room you get. Some people had beautiful harbor views, I got the DHL warehouse view. It didn't matter to me. As others have mentioned there is a problem with housekeeping at this hotel. There are days I got shampoo and other days I got the body wash. Never both. The Bathrobe was removed and never returned until called them. This is the only hotel connected to the new Convention center. The hotel has a free shuttle to Fanuel hall / financial district but it is not advertised anywhere so I didn't use it. The T stations are the WTC on Silver line (5 min walk) and South Station on the Red line (10 min walk). The financial district and most of the downtown is within 20 minute walking distance. IF it was not for the expensive parking and internet I would have rated this hotel higher. Stay here if you are here for convention center.

Reviews.Title: “nice new clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: donckd
Reviews.Content: we stayed as a family and had the most amazing view ever. the room was nice clean and the hotel was very helpful . one of our boys got sick so they got us fresh sheet and towels in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, okay room”
Reviews.Author: meleetyme
Reviews.Content: The Westin is in Boston's up and coming Waterfront area hence you will see a lot of young professional types and a relatively lively lobby scene. The hotel is new and the lobby area is beautiful. I found the room to be disappointing though. It had an apartment complex look to it. There was a large grey metal panel cover in the room, like a circuit breaker type that distracted from what could have been a lovely room. The wall paper did not look high end enough, it honestly looks like a chain apartment builder did the rooms. The bed was not as heavingly as I have experienced with the Westin and the bathroom was just okay. It was a girls trip for my birthday and I was a bit dissapointed with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Luxury”
Reviews.Author: traveler124_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two other families while we were in Boston for a Red Sox game. The hotel was very nice, classic Westin quality. There is a Starbucks right in the hotel and a short walk to a Dunkins. Nice Pool and workout room. This hotel is off the beaten path near the World Trade Center. The hotel has a shuttle but it only goes to Faniel Hall. Short walk to a T stop.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, open, & spot on!”
Reviews.Author: love2ski1974
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. I was here on business during the hottest week in Boston. It was such a relief to come back to this hotel as it was slightly away from the city near the waterfront. There was a slight breeze - that was quite nice. What I really like was that you could get an excellent cocktail and sit outside on the patio, which is very uncommon at a Boston hotel. You were not confined as you could be in a downtown Boston hotel. The lobby was expansive and lovely. The room was decent - nothing too fancy but clean. I highly recommend any of the waterfront hotels in Boston - The Seaport, The Westin, & The Renaissance. They are outside of the city but you can still walk to the North End, Government Center, & Fan. Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely atmosphere ....poor service”
Reviews.Author: rfinnegan
Reviews.Content: We arrived Friday night ..went to Fenway, came home and ordered room service. Room was nice, hotel beautiful...we never saw anyone from Housekeeping! We were out of the room all day on Saturday--from 9:30 a.m. until 5:00--bed was still not made, no fresh towels..dirty dishes still on tray. The most annoying thing was having to go to the Concierge for every question!! I stood on line for a half hour waiting to get a Sunday Mass schedule--all that it took was for the Concierge to hand me a card with the times on it!! No information in the rooms....no phone book..nothing! and paying $32 night to park a car when you are a guest in the hotel is also lame. I overheard other guests complaining of the slow service or lack of it.

Reviews.Title: “we as a familly loved it”
Reviews.Author: alex1322
Reviews.Content: After 6 hours driving from MONTREAL.PQ we were tired but arriving in hotel we been nicely recieved and by help of the manager mr kamal we been checked in earlier which make us very happy with our 2 children. it is nice hotel clean comfortable beds (i wish to have one like that at home). hip hop turist bus just in front of hotel is much appreciated i recommend this hotel.ALI GHADBAN FAMILLY

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WilliamTheSilent
Reviews.Content: I was not sure at first as somebody told me that the walls were super thin and noise would be a problem. That was not our experience. The beds were VERY comfortable and the service very friendly. We walked around quite a bit and just discovered Boston on foot. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very well done”
Reviews.Author: spchiro
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the weekend of July 15-18 on business. The room was clean, well maintained, and comfortable. Staff in all positions were attentive, polite, and friendly. The food for our conference was very good. I never had to wait more than a minute for an elevator, probably because there are 6 of them (or is that 8). The hotel is not situated in the heart of the tourist district (Fanueil Hall/North end), but close enough to walk to or take the free hotel shuttle to or get to the subway to get to anywhere in Boston. I was disappointed when I found out that our conference was not downtown, but after staying at the Westin Waterfront, I found it not to matter at all. I would stay here again gladly.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh”
Reviews.Author: holly83rn
Reviews.Content: You walk into this hotel and it feels open, modern, earthy, and fresh. Rooms are clean, simple, and modern. Staff is helpful and courteous. Veiws are fantastic. Public transportation is easily accessible. In house bar and restaurant are fantastic. Room service was quite tasty. Starwood preffered customer is free and worth it!!!!! Wonderful workout center I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to relax!”
Reviews.Author: mrsdavis2267
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our trip to Boston staying at the Westin Boston Waterfront. After reading all the reviews, I was a little worried at how far away it would be, but found that the World Trade Center area seems to be a newer area and a 5 minute walk to the silver line subway. We rode the subway for all our destinations, getting a 7 day link pass for $15 and walking around the city. We had a great time, and definitely recommend comfortable shoes. In retrospect, we would probably recommend checking out the Trolley hop-on hop-off tours that drop you off at the different landmarks throughout Boston, however, we enjoyed seeing the city from the Bostonions eyes too. You can walk 5 minutes to catch the Silver line, or walk a mile into boston to the South Station (red line). To get from the airport to the hotel, we rode a taxi, because at that point we would have been too overwhelmed to ride the subway, however, once you know about it, it's a very easy ride to the silver line World Trade Center to get off and walk 5 minutes to the hotel. If you would prefer not to walk, get a taxi. There are four food places in the hotel: Starbucks (open daily, but not late at night), Saucity (very expensive Breakfast only), an Irish pub restaurant (good food and drinks - recommend the steak tips), the Birch Bar (didn't try this) and the city bar (open at night). You can also walk about 10-15 minutes down to the Seaport harbor area where there are numerous restaurants including a deli, Legal Harborside (seafood), Legal Test Kitchen, a mexican restaurant, a great Italian restaurant (Salvatores), and others. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel because the breakfast restaurant was very expensive and the room service was ridiculously expensive! We ate a few things from Starbucks one morning, and otherwise walked/rode subway to the areas that we were seeing that day to find a restaurant. There are starbucks and Dunkin Donuts everywhere around Boston! We did take the recommendations of others since it was our 5 year anniversary and told them. Joseph was at the counter and SO nice! I specifically asked for a Harbor view up high and he got us a room on the top floor (presidential suites), harborside, and a bottle of champagne with a personally written card from Joseph! The hotel room had everything we needed, including a VERY comfortable bed. We slept in every day because it was so comfortable. We were given 2 water bottles in our room every day, and signed up for the green program in which we did not have room service change our bedding or towels, which earned us $5 each day for food in the hotel (which we spent at Starbucks). We enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden costs are an absolute killer”
Reviews.Author: duffduffmcduff
Reviews.Content: We booked through hotwire to save money whilst travelling around the US, but as soon as we got there the money we had saved went straight back into the hotel. $32 a day to park your car, and $12.95 a day for internet unless you fancy sitting in the lobby. The hotel itself was very nice, brilliant rooms and positioning was good in relation to the harbour. Needless to say eight travelling twenty-one year olds looked slightly out of place checking in!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: dm713
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin over 3 nights for a convention that was right next door. It was great to be so close...didn't even have to leave the building, it's connected to the convention center. Also thrilled to have a Starbucks in the lobby :-) Hotel room was comfy and on par with other Westins - gotta love that shower! No mini bar though so byo drinks & snacks if that's important. Very nice pool and workout area. For vacationers to Boston, it's a bit removed from center of the city but just a short cab ride to Fanueil Hall and the waterfront. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: HK200519
Reviews.Content: I didnt like the location of the hotel. The hospitality was great and food within the area was perfect but a little expensive. I took Boston tour on a trolly. The trolly tour was great and like it alot. I wished I had more time to explore the city. This is historical city. The hotel has a conceige where they sell USD30.00 ticket for all city tour for 2 days. The hotel room was ok but the first room they assigned, the next door neighbor was smoking in the room. Then, I told the front desk about the it and they gave me a suite room. The bed was very comfortable and awesome view of the Boston. This hotel has a small indoor pool. Everything within the hotel was clean and neat. There are couple restaurants and a Starbucks in the hotel. This make it convenient for Starbuck fans!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: bosses5
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I go to Boston every summer, usually stay in the Back Bay section. Tried Westin Waterfront this time. The views are amazing. The staff are friendly and very accommodating. Rooms are very clean and spacious. Food in restaurants are affordable and delicious. Pool and gym areas are spotless. What more can I say, other than we are never going to stay anywhere else! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Odd mix of good bad and ugly”
Reviews.Author: abcorixyz
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, bed comfortable, big flat screen TV, but there were problems,too. There is this stupid marble step in and out of the room and if you are not perpetually aware it is easy to wrench a knee or ankle. (I think it's there to keep luggage carts out and not bang the walls, but that seems odd, too). The bathtub was slick, and no matt in site, it is a specialty item to be requested from housekeeping. Whatever they clean with leaves a residue and I'll never forget the blood curdling yell as my spouse went down. The staff was generally nice but we never got a call back from the head of security (ourdesignated contact person for the fall) when we asked about a medical evaluation when my spouse's back seemed no better after three days. Staff was generally nice, but oddly and I think cruely, the concierge must stand his or her entire shift (8-12 hours). I liked the hot tub open 24 hours but its too small for a hotel this size. The pool area was clean, but there was enough hair in the bathroom drains in the pool area to make a mastiff. There were no suit spinners or plastic bags for suits. Lockers were provided in the workout/pool area which was nice...no unsightly work out clothes except in the appropriate areas. Also no report of spouse's fall. I wanted to check for accuracy, hotel staff mentioned legal concerns. Oh, and I rented a car through the hotel for the week end. Despite assurances it would be an affordable w/e rate, I paid top dollar. No written confirmation was ever given, I was told not to worry a week before the trip, but had to rebook after we arrived. Timing was fine. No waits. Turn down service was optional (Call if you want it, $5 off if you don't,) but we didn't ask and didn't receive service or money. That's it. Location is great for T, waterfront, chinatown, south station and The Common, but I'd look for an alternative for personal travel. This was a cororate trip. The luch room felt like a high school cafeteria (public) and was a long way from the meeting room which was a boiler plate OK room. Food was fine. Well, that's it. A strange mix.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, luxurious and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: brittpwalker
Reviews.Content: * Free shuttle to downtown Boston * Beautiful rooms * Friendly and attentive staff * Restaurant was just OK, I recommend eating out * Starbucks inside the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in every way!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennylo80
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for my birthday last week and couldn't have been happier with this hotel and the staff here. Opon check in our Front Desk attendant, Arthur Lormil went over and above great service to us!!! Was friendly, took time to recommend the best of Boston, upgraded our room since it was my b-day :) and when we returned to our room later that evening, he had sent us up a bottle of wine, and a platter of cakes! )which I completely didn't need but ate anyway of course) Our view from the room was amazing, both of the harbor and the city skyline. The room was immaculate, bed was so comfortable and even the complimentary toiletries were above par! The location really couldn't be better if you want to be close to the downtown/harbor area. The walk to the harbor is only about 20 minutes, and there is a lot to look at along the way... definitely not a boring walk. The hotel has 2 pretty nice bars, free wi-fi in the lobby and a starbucks :) Parking was fairly reasonable for DT Boston at approx $35 a day. 5 Stars from us!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnBrockington
Reviews.Content: We had a family vacation in Boston over the 4th of July weekend. I will share some thoughts of our experience at the Weston. â€¢ The room had a great view of the harbor. If I were going there again, I would ask for a room on the harbor side and I would get another room on a floor that was high. It was really beautiful at night. â€¢ I would shop around for a good price. We got our tickets in a package with airfare. â€¢ The location was okay. You get what you pay for. For people who are doing a convention there it is great. If not, the bus stop is right across the street and it is about a 15 minute walk to the subway. The subway system works fine and is easy to use. It does pays to familiarize yourself with the public transportation before you get there. I was really glad I was not driving in the city. The subway station (South) also is the commuter line stop. It would be easy to do a day trip to another city as well. â€¢ The rooms overall were nice. Great beds. I wasnâ€™t too happy to see some ants and a spider in the room though. â€¢ We found the concierge during our stay to be very indifferent to us. The answers to our questions were always short and incomplete. I am not sure if she was just busy but I gave up asking her questions and just figured out things for myself. I wish she was a little more helpful because it would have saved us some time. The rest of the staff (bell hops etc) were very friendly. â€¢ The bottom line is I would stay there again if the price was right. .

Reviews.Title: “PRISTINE ROOM AND HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Pat L
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we were impressed. Maybe it had to do with the wagon full of goodies they rolled out for our kids to choose a toy. Or, ya know how at almost any hotel you stay, the room has a smell? Not always bad...but one that lingers none-the-less. I noticed after about an hour in the Westin Boston Waterfront room...something was missing...a smell. The room had none whatsoever! But everywhere else in the hotel? They were sure to make their scent known! Their "Signature scent," that is. Throughout the public areas of the Westin, small inconspicuous fans blow a pleasant scent. Our room was sparkling clean and the air was quiet and efficient. Also, the pool was upscale, although the water was pretty cold for an indoor pool. We loved our stay, and although it is a bit off the beaten path...we would recommend it to anyone attending an event at the Convention Center, Children's Museum, or doesn't mind riding the T to get to and from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “be aware”
Reviews.Author: city4ever44
Reviews.Content: The westin is lovely hotel but its a good walk from the centre of Boston around 25 minutes and we are fast walkers.The hotel shuttle is not regular and difficult to get a space we only used it once in 5 days.The subway you need to change to get to the centre and taxis are expensive.However the staff and the hotel are great but if you want to be in the centre use another hotel.It is 6 dollars to use internet for 15 minutes unless you bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with spacious bedrooms good bedlinen and towels”
Reviews.Author: MelmicCork
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated as its name suggests in the Waterfront area and the "sightseeing shuttle" bus comes right to the door of the hotel every 20 minutes approx and goes the city area which is a great advantage. We did'nt realise this for a few days and it would have been helpful if, on registration, we had been told this as we thought it was only available if you were going to use the sightseeing bus. There is a selection of eating places in the hotel, the breakfast is excellent in the Sauciety restaurant. We found for evenings O Connors Irish bar was good value and good choice of menu.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy to stay there”
Reviews.Author: JohnCambridgeshire
Reviews.Content: A large modern comfortable hotel which seemed to be geared mainly for conventions. Located a little way from centre of city. The bedroom was very spacious, clean and comfortable. We particularly liked the extremely comfortable beds. The dining room was not open for dinner in the evening although there was an Irish bar which served food.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with rooms WITHOUT a view”
Reviews.Author: MM545
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the July 4th weekend. I was impressed by the quality of the facilities, the ambience and the value for the price paid. The main downside for me is that even though they call it the Westin Waterfront, most of the rooms do not have a great view. The surrounding area is very much oriented to an office environment, so this does not make it the ideal place to stay for tourists. There is nothing really within a 5 minute walking distance and at night it gets pretty lonely. That said it is right next to the T stop but it takes three changes to get to Quincy Market and the Aquarium. Not good! However, they do offer great weekend deals about $150-200. That is great price in my opinion for a 4 Star hotel in a nice city. I recommend a stay if you want luxury but willing to compromise the locality you stay in.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Clifffleet
Reviews.Content: Theresa Finnegan did a wonderful job helping us with a mini vacation. She was the finest conciege that we have dealt with in a long time. Her patience and suggestions were invaluable to our wonderful time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: atlas4711
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a convention. While the hotel looks impressive from the lobby, it seemed very average and not any better than a Four Points hotel. I live about 50 miles away and it's very difficult to justify spending $180/night after taxes and what not solely for the convenience of not having to commute for a couple days. I expected more than just a bed and a key card.

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Murdocki
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was fine with helpful front desk staff and knowledgeable front desk clerk to help with tours and restaurants. Hotel is in business district and several blocks from restaurants. Took cabs and buses to get to historic district. The Westin staff were very friendly. The Westin's only restaurant is open for breakfast, but the prices were far too steep, even for Boston. If you're traveling on business and can expense your meals, then I guess it's OK. Otherwise, it's only other offering is a Starbucks (yuck). My wife & I walked a couple of blocks to a Dunkin Donuts, which was on our way to South Station. Nice pool & jacuzzi, workout room has cardio machines and some free weights. Our room was always clean, easy to control temperature. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of skyline and harbor; great staff assistance.”
Reviews.Author: lynnkendrick
Reviews.Content: We choose the Westin over the Memorial Day holiday for brief trip to move our daughter to Boston for her first job. We knew the beds were amazingly comfortable from a previous trip to Las Vegas and needed that assurance since we were driving 10 hours each way over the weekend and my husband had shoulder problems. We also thought it would be nice to have a view since this was the first time we would be in Boston to stay the night. The Westin was a perfect choice. I had asked for a good view and we were given the top floor with a gorgeous view of the Boston skyline and the harbor in the distance (the hotel is several streets from the water). With the floor to ceiling windows, I don't see how it could have been better. The room itself was OK but the bed was extremely comfortable and we slept better there than at home. Was asked for a roll-away bed for our daughter, and were given a regular twin bed, which was very comfortable.The hotel restaurant was good as well. There was an issue with how the booking was done with the room rate but Guest Service Agent Arthur Lormil was exceptionally responsive to our needs, handling the problem quickly to our full satisfaction. When we return to Boston The Westin will be at the top of our list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, decent location, would definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: binghott
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and beautiful, with very friendly staff! The room was quiet and comfortable. We really appreciated the concierge, Theresa's help with trying to book bus tours, bike rentals, and transportation to Fenway Park. We didn't get to drink at any of the three bars in the hotel, but they looked very nice. The location could be a problem for some because it's a long walk from most places you'd want to see. Fortunately the Silver Line T is a block away, and there's also a pick-up/drop-off for the Boston Upper Deck Trolley Tours. If you prefer cabs, they can add up, but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Conventions, clean, hard to get to Boston Attractions”
Reviews.Author: cjg2901
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a convention hotel, which is the main reason we stayed here. It was clean and had a decent pub type restaurant. The main coffee shop/restaurant was not open in the early evening for dinner (5:30pm). However, the Pub and the bar were. The bar was very busy and service was slow. I asked the concierge for help twice. Each time, the person handed me a brochure and told me to call the company. When I asked for directions, both people handed me a map. Not helpful at all. Boston is a city that is easy to walk,although walking from this hotel is quite a distance. I got a cab one time, but realized I could walk faster than the cab. The workout room is nice. Overall, if you are going to a convention next door to the hotel, this is a good choice. Otherwise, I would choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Just OK Location”
Reviews.Author: bkl0irnnk
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice. Very modern, clean. Restaurant/Bar/Starbucks on-site. We pricelined the hotel last minute and got a room for $125 - can't beat it in Boston where the average for a 4-star is $250+. If you don't mind staying a little outside the center of downtown Boston, it's a very good hotel. There is a train that goes directly into downtown. Also, Boston is quite small so the walk from downtown crossing is maybe 20 mins. The only real negative I have is that the parking was expensive, but that is to be expected everywhere in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Hated the Staff...”
Reviews.Author: qtbunnie
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel but it was a bit far from everything. You definitely need a car or taxi to get around! I bid this from priceline and it was $140/night which is okay but I'm pretty sure you can get better deals close to the city center. I don't recommend this hotel because of the location was a bit too far and if you drive the hotel provides a parking lot but it costs $32/day to park there. Pros: The rooms were spacious and the beds were really comfy. The swimming pool was clean & jacuzzi was a nice touch. Cons: The staff - when I first checked in, there were a bunch of staff members around but apparently only one working the desk. The others were just chatting away. Finally when someone came to help me - I asked for a roll away bed because we had three people in one room and they only had a kings size bed available. The reception said he will send roll away beds upstairs. When I got upstairs there were none there. Okay, fine- I waited an hour or so.. and it still has not arrived. So, I finally decided to call the reception. No one picks up, so I called the Service Express and they finally told me there are NONE available. I'm pretty annoyed because they should have told me that from the gecko instead of making me wait. When I complained to them they told me they will see if they can take one from another room.. ... UM, okay? ... well in the end our beds finally arrived but it took them awhile. Another Con is the walls are so thin - you will definitely hear people from the halls.

Reviews.Title: “Another great hotel by Westin”
Reviews.Author: happyworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Boston is a very expensive city in terms of accomodations in and around the downtown area. The Westin was approximately $225 a night which was the average rate for hotels in the area. Very clean with modern bathroom and guest rooms. The lobby has a starbucks and is quite nice. The location is a bit far away from the action, however it is a short cab ride away to anywhere in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Rude rude rude”
Reviews.Author: Rannynm
Reviews.Content: We just checked in to this hotel this afternoon. I called the "service express" line twice to get information about the hotel and its services. The woman who was on call was absolutely rude, rude, rude! What more can I say. She was so unwelcoming that I am seriously considering checking out early and moving to someplace more friendly. We are SPG preferred guest members yet still have to pay a fee for internet service which I am adamantly opposed to and most Starwood Hotels waive if you request it. There is no information in the room about what services they have so I called to see if they have a pool, workout room, or spa. Curt answers, no chance to ask anything more. I have just come from DC and NYC where we stayed at the Westin and they couldn't have been more helpful whenever we asked for aid. In today's environment, there is just no need to be rude, particularly when there are lots of other people who would be happy to have your job. Enough of that. Beyond that, the location is great. Easy to get to the airport and harbor. We love Westin's Heavenly bed! Great night's sleep. This is a convention hotel and there is a convention going on now so the lobby is very very busy. We were very disappointing that there is no restaurant or bar area with a view to sit, have a cocktail and/or a bit to eat. Won't be dining here. There is a Starbucks downstairs which makes it nice for morning quick cup of coffee. The rooms are spacious, again with views of parking lots and pretty run down area of town. I certainly wouldn't consider taking a run in this neighborhood. I would not consider staying here again unless I needed a place to stay before an early flight out.

Reviews.Title: “What a convention hotel should be (with a couple of drawbacks)”
Reviews.Author: highway_song
Reviews.Content: Immediately adjacent to the Boston Convention Center, and a short walk by skybridge from the Seaport World Trade Center (where our event was held). Large, comfortable lobby dominated by tables and chairs - table service (beverages, snacks) available but not pushy. Easy check-in. Reasonable-sized standard rooms. Very good and reasonably priced breakfast buffet in Saucity restaurant. Branch of popular MJ Connor's pub chain in the building. Competent and well-located business center, convenient Starbucks. Easy walk to much of what matters in the convention zone, including terrific new Legal (Seafoods) Harborfront location with open-air bar, outdoor deck seating, and the good quality Legal is known for. Hotel drawbacks: limited outdoor space (a small group of metal tables and chairs on terrace immediately adjacent to driveway), expensive parking, expensive wi-fi ($13/day!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, great location for conventions”
Reviews.Author: Icarus922
Reviews.Content: I always have high expectations for Westins, and I wasn't disappointed, particularly as this is a convention center hotel. The room was comfortable but felt a little more cookie-cutter than usual, and the restaurants were surprisingly good. One off moment was the guestroom corridors: they were oddly dark and depressing which made coming and going a little depressing. Service was great, however, and check-in and out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied the pickiest people”
Reviews.Author: dean3818
Reviews.Content: I went to Boston with my family and as much as I love them, my parents will always find something to nit-pick. Well, they LOVED this hotel. It was spacious, modern, and clean. They were able to use the pool and jacuzzi at night. Boston isn't a big city so even cabbing it to and from the hotel was not a big deal. We will definitely return. The food is excellent, the employees were very helpful and the lobby bars were a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jean_Central_MA
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a last minute place to stay at the waterfront in Boston. I used price line to bid on a 4 star hotel. My husband and I got the Westin Boston Waterfront as our winning bid! It was absolutely wonderful! Front desk was very helpful! We visited both hotel Bars and they were both great! Highly Recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and sparkling, for the most part”
Reviews.Author: Juli Z
Reviews.Content: The Westin lobby is impressive. The high atrium filled is bright and tastefully decorated with stone and birch trees (too bad they're not real). When we arrived, it was bustling with people, most of whom were at the hotel for conferences and meetings. Besides a restaurant and lobby bar, there is a Starbucks and gift shop tucked in the lobby. Our room was on an SPG floor (Starwood Preferred Guests). It was large with bright windows facing a commercial/industrial area, not an eye-sore, but not a vista either. We had a great night of sleep: peaceful and comfortable. We went for a dip in the pool in the morning and used the gym facilities. Both were fairly empty for such a large hotel, and well maintained. The hotel has an interesting conservation policy: they will give you SPG points for not having your sheets changed every day and you can save water by not turning on the second shower head?!? I see how the first is a valuable initiative, the second is a little bogus; why does the shower have 2 heads in the first place? In fact, both are situated a little low, at 5'10 I had to crouch. The staff was courteous. The bell man made us laugh. Always nice to feel like you are being served by real people rather than robots. We may not have chosen this hotel ourselves, but we booked through priceline and were not disappointed. We got the room for $150 on a weekend when everything else in the same category was going for $300+. The parking was $32-self and $42-valet. The internet was an additional $16/day: market standards in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stop over”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: Flew transcontinental and wanted a layover in Boston, but near airport. This hotel fit the bill, and came up at $139 on Priceline. Got a great room - which to me means quiet and clean. Front desk staff were helpful and competent. The irish pub and the hotel's lobby restaurant were both ok (not great) but reasonably priced (pub) and convenient (lobby cafe). Highly recommended all round.

Reviews.Title: “very nice westin with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: Schlockette
Reviews.Content: this was a very nice westin. our room was very nice. bathroom was good though i would have liked a shelf to put my stuff on. very easy to work there. great long desk to spread out on. great internet connection in the room with the easiest hookup to the netowrk that i have used in a hotel. also a very clever way to print documents and pick up at the front desk. staff was very nice and helpful. gym was very nice with good equipment and hours. did not eat any meals so cannot comment on that. i am a walker so though downtown was a mile or so awy, it was an easy walk. also i took the silverline fromt he airport and it was really easy to get to the hotel for only 2 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Shanklin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great - spacious room very clean and comfortable and straight across the road there is the silverline bus which takes you to South Station to connect with the rest of the metro system. Also this hotel has a shuttle into town on an hourly basis - we didnt use this as the metro called the T is so cheap and runs a brilliant service.

Reviews.Title: “I came for a conference, family joined and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: newlyweds223
Reviews.Content: I had a conference here and invited my husband and 1 1/2 year old son to tag along. My husband and son had a blast swimming in the pool and walking/taking public transportation to downtown. They have developed the area since I last visited with new restaurants (we loved LTK and Papguayo) and had kid-friendly options at the hotel too. The front desk staff was wonderful and welcoming. The spaces available for the conference were nice as well. My only hang-up was that we had spotty internet access in conference sessions despite paying for internet use. Overall a good trip for business and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: picklesmcd
Reviews.Content: My wife and two children stayed here for a night prior to going to Los Angeles. This is a great hotel that is close to the airport. For us it worked out well because we had a very early morning flight and the hotel is literally 5 minutes from the airport. The room was clean and spacious and we had a great view of the waterfront and airport. The hotel has a nice gym and pool area with extended hours. We had dinner at MJ OConnors which is off the lobby. I had the Sheppards Pie which was prettyt bland but my wife liked the fish and chips and the kids loved the Mac and cheese. Lastly we requested to have extra water brought up to the room. I called down and was greeted on the phone by a very pleasant gentleman named Steve. Steve took care of the request and the water was in the room in minutes. Each staff member that I encountered during our stay had that very professional but pleasant attitude that Steve had. Again this was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: peitraveller21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Boston Waterfront because it was attached to the Convention centre. Our Convention had a negotioated rate of $200.00 and when I booked the best rate they could give me was $410.00 PER NIGHT as our block was full....a difference of $210.00 a night. I own and operate a hotel and was shocked at the price difference it was a very busy weeeknd in Boston w Harvard and other school graduations but think the price increase was ridiculous. We stayed 5 nights and I am a memeber of their loyalty program and they would not offer any discount. The rooms are nothing special, not very clean and tiny. Exepcted alot more for the price. Had to pay for interent in the rm but could get it free in the lobby?? Then only good feature was the bed and bedding. Our iron was so old all the marking were worn off couldn't use it. Asked for a new one waited as we had to iron dress pants before our mtng. Called for the second time someone dropped it off but did not knock so we were sitting there waiting for nothing wasted half an hr. Came in a new box never opened plastic and all.... Was told at night the store in the hotel opened at 7am so instead of leaving that night to get a few neccesities we waited till the morning for the store to open. The person was half an hr late as I waited outside more and more pp stopped looking for items but it took them hald an hr to open maing us late for our mtngs again. The rooms were not inuslated very well could hear everything in the rooms next to us and the hallways got woken up the first night by pp returning to their rm late at night and at 5am the next morning by somone getting a shower next to us. Expect this in a lower end hotel but not when you are spending $400.00 a night. The front desk staff and conceirge desk was not helpful or friendly. Is that not we were payign extra for the service and extras at the hotel?? We asked the lady at he conceirge desk to reccomend a place to eat after a long day of travelling informing her we were not looking to get dresed up just go as we are and get a quick meal. She sent us to Mortos an expensive and very formal restaurant in which we felt very undressed. She called to make our reservation as I am sure she got a kick back for every referral. Come to find out the nest day their is a pub in the hotel that we could have eaten at ans not taken a cab as it was raining to the other restaraunt. Also asked her what to do and see as we only had one day that was not invloved w convention plans just told us the basics found out two days in from the bellman that there is a free shuttle that goes to the downtown every hr and a subway across the street.... The doorman and bellman were great super helpful and friendly always going above and beyond. Would never stay at this hotel again no value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel near Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: imranpali
Reviews.Content: Hotel was wonderful for my stay at a convention we were having next door at the BECE. Up to date accomodations with nice comfortable rooms. Great restaurants inside hotel (M.J. O'Conners) and also have a starbucks! Staff was great and friendly and were always there to assist me and my fiance. Bill (The Doorman) was outstanding in recommending where to visit in Boston for sight seeing, where to eat, where to shop, and most of all very caring. My fiance had forgotten her cell phone in one of the taxis and Bill was willing to assist us and helping locate the phone down and recommending who and where to contact to find out about it once we left back home. Indiviuals like Bill, make this a great hotel to stay at! Go Bill!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: jbuhlman
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this stay, my first in a Westin. I typically stay in a Hilton (Garden Inn) or Marriot brand hotel. The lobby area was beautiful and well laid out, but service was a little slow. The room was modern and tastefully decorated but I was surprised by little details missed by the cleaning staff like hairs in the tub, dirty walls etc. The bed was nice but I had trouble finding a pillow that worked for me. This didn't matter too much becasue the guys in the room next to me were partying and i could hear every word they said through one of the vents in my ceiling and also in the bathroom. If that wasn't enough the adjoining room (not the partiers) (interior door that joins two rooms) was not well sealed. I could see light under the door and hear everything they said as well. I was a very surprised to find that even at well in excess of $200/night that internet is not included in the price, you must pay to connect. Not so at the less expensive but equal in quality brands I mentioned above. Day two while getting ready I was surprised to find no iron in the room. A brand new one still packaged in a box was brought to me in about 10 minutes. This made me late for my first meeting and I was a little surprised I had to unbox and unpack the thing. It also being new smelled pretty bad leaving me to wonder if I should have also stopped to read the directions about what do do before using. On the Maintenace side my door deadbolt liked to pop out causing the door to not latch but remain ajar. As one who freqents hotels and knows doors generally close loudly i didn't realize it didn't actually shut until an hour after I entered the room the 1st time. It also had this issue when leaving requiring me to insert my key card to unlock it from the outside in order to close the door. When I reported this to the front desk they simply told me to pull down on both inside and outside handles at the same time and it shoudl fix itself. Well, it didn't. I'd rate the front desk staff as not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The staff and guest experience at Saucity are truly remarkable...”
Reviews.Author: Eagledad11
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston attending our son's graduation from Boston College. We also co-celebrated my 80-year-old parents' 60th wedding anniversary. A hotel attendant overheard my parents mention that it was their 60th and the next day a note was slipped under their door offering them a complimentary breakfast at Saucity restaurant. The thought was touching, the restaurant food was very good but our very gracious waiter, Marian Dobrev, made my parents' breakfast experience very memorable and genuinely personal. Because of people like Marian, the staff and guest experience are truly remarkable. I recommend this hotel and be sure to ask to be seated at Marian's table.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a good stay.”
Reviews.Author: mwdarby
Reviews.Content: My wife and son shared a room with me on this trip to attend a business conference. There were only two wash cloths for 3 of us and no guest directory. We notified guest services and requested the missing items. For the remainder of our stay (3 more nights), we had no wash cloths and no guest directory. That, added to the typical large hotel's annoying charge for wifi and the room hvac not cooling the room adequately, and it resulted in a less than enjoyable stay. It is really too bad because most of the hotel staff we interacted with were quite pleasant and helpful and the rest of the hotel is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at the Westin (Boston)”
Reviews.Author: MMcC88
Reviews.Content: Update: Turns out that the room charges WERE applied to the WRONG card in spite of all assurances to the contrary. We're still sorting out this mess. Note: Westin did award additional points (not enough to get a room for a night though) to the Starwood Preferred Guest account upon receipt of a letter to the General Manager. Complaint: While "livid" is too strong a term, I am furious about the conditions and experience of my recent stay at the Westin Waterfront in Boston. Never before have I paid so much for so little in return. Traveled with family. Due to flight delays the payer was late to arrive and we had to provide a credit card to swipe at check-in. Despite assurances that the original card would be billed for the stay all the fees were applied to the wrong credit card. We were advised that the room was an upgrade, it reminded me of a dorm room. We requested another room and were given a new room on the Starwood Preferred Guest floor. That room needs to be refurbished. The room was noisy and that became evident at night when it sounded as if an industrial vent rang along the ceiling. This may be a problem in several rooms since the lobby store had sold out of earplugs. Also in the light of day, we realized that the room had not been dusted, the table lamp was damaged and the only guest chair in the room was stained to the point that we didn't want to sit on it. Other notable details of my stay include: â€¢ It wasn't until too late that I realized there was no shampoo provided by the hotel. There was body wash, soap and conditioner. â€¢ The ice bucket and glasses were pushed so far to the back of a shelf, they were undetectable when we looked for them. â€¢ The refrigerator was empty and there was nothing to indicate that it was un-stocked and we would not be charged for consuming any contents. Each incidence was disruptive and required either a call or visit to the front desk. Also uncharacteristic, was the noticeable absence of the easy-check-out survey and customer comments card. I was uncomfortable in the hotel and embarrassed to have my family see these accommodations. What on earth happened here?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucian83
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Adjacent to convention center. I wish all their beds were queen size instead of doubles. Internet free in lobby only!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Room Service”
Reviews.Author: JaneEMorgan
Reviews.Content: I had to write this review to rave about the fantastic room service dining that this hotel offers. Last night I ordered the house salad and an apetizer crabcake. The salad was fresh and delicious with a fantastic champagne vinaigrette and the crabcake was amazing. It was one of the best room service meals I have ever had. This morning I had granola pancakes with fruit -- equally scrumtious. The hotel itself is nice and very functional for business. Excellent gym, indoor pool, very good lighting in the room with nice desk space. Comfy bed and fast wireless. The hallways look a bit old and drab and the room decor is not very memorable, but comfortable. Nice bath products and the shower had two Speakman showerheads with decent water pressure. The printing cost at the business center was outrageous -- $1.25/page. That's not very business friendly, I have to say, but the room service and good lighting in the room made up for it. A very good business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: natrat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night. Reached the hotel easily by water taxi from Logan($10 per person) as well as Silver Line 1. I was given the special Priceline view facing the back of the hotel. Priceline price was >50% off the regular website price. Room was clean. Staff was courteous. Room was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A bad mistake made worse by a horrible response”
Reviews.Author: liverpool85
Reviews.Content: This is a convention hotel, I get it. It's a bit loud, you can hear people in the hallways, and if you don't have anything making noise you can hear the other rooms' tv. I can live with that because of the convenience of being close to the convention center. What I can't live with is having a cocktail in the bar that is off the lobby and having the bartender ask me - from a distance - what my room number and my name is. As a woman traveling alone I was shocked that he would do so...and the more I thought about it, I decided management should know. Well, after the disclaimer that the bar was run by "other management" and the grilling of "were you signing the check to your room" and "are you sharing a room" (no, but what does that matter?), the manager on duty went off to "let someone know". It's simple, folks, if someone wanted to follow me or even turn around and walk to another outlet and charge to my room...they had all the information they needed. This is an unacceptable breach of security and it doesn't matter if the hotel runs the outlet or if they are independent...if they are under your roof they need to provide the same standards of security. Tomorrow I stay at their competition....hopefully that will be a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay close to Boston's sights”
Reviews.Author: zurmaid
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend at the Westin Boston Waterfront with my 1 1/2 year old daughter. The hotel was clean and felt very safe. We got great service from check-in to check-out: the valets, the desk clerks and the baristas at Starbucks all had smiles on their faces all the time.
