I had called ahead to request a crib and they brought it to the room within 5 mins of arrival. My only "complaint" might be the beds - they were fine, but not the "heavenly" sleep I was hoping for. There are other reviews that have complained about the location - look on the map before you book! No, the hotel is not in the middle of downtown, but there is excellent public transportation within a 5min walk, plus the hotel runs a shuttle into the heart of the city. We spent our time at the Aquarium, Quincy Market and the Children's Museum, so it was a great location for us. The times I didn't feel like bothering with the "T" I grabbed a cab - the most expensive ride was $7.80. I would stay here again, especially if I was catching an early flight out of Logan. We could see the control tower from our window!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, terrible location”
Reviews.Author: danigal525
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiance for the Boston Marathon. We must have spent over $60 on cabs to and from the downtown area of Boston (also note that we stood in line outside of the hotel for 15 minutes waiting for a cab to come). It is not a place to stay if you want to dine and go out in the downtown area of Boston. The hotel itself is very beautiful and rooms are spacious and clean. I would not stay here again solely for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Westin standard upheld-a find during the Boston marathon weekend”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked via PL for 180$ for one night (Boston marathon weekend oblige)...and overall, it was a good deal. Early check-in was possible, and we managed to get a room with 2 beds...we were relieved! The room itself was quite nice and roomy, with 2 very comfortable queen beds, LCD TV, work station, 12.95 $ for low grade wifi (hi speed is 18$...a bit of a rip off in this day and age), good sized bathroom with toiletries and bathrobe (only one, which we did not use), and a rather unspectacular view (well, its a PL booking). The hotel is a bit out of the way, but close to World Trade Centre Silver line station (a bit more than 5 minutes walk) which connects to South Station and red line. We did walk to the Park Plaza and other locations, on a gorgeous day. Warning, Silver Line to airport is rather crowded during the day, and expect delays...count at least an hour. Did not use the restaurant, nor the Starbucks, because of the marathon crowd. The gym is very well equipped but was very crowded, the pool was OK (I guess marathoners don't use pools cause it was me and another person swimming), but looking like a cheaper house version, with vinyl cloth lining...bizarre metallic Jacuzzi which did not work. Overall, a pleasant stay...would come back with right price.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel for those who want a quieter part of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Zaihera
Reviews.Content: The Westin Boston Waterfront is a nice hotel away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Boston. I imagine if you are there for a conference at the center across the street the hotel is perfect location for you and probably will have lots going on. If you aren't attending a conference and are looking fora relaxing, modern hotel for a quiet night...the Westin is it. The room we had was nice, the bed super comfortable, and the room spotless. The staff was nice, the pool ok a bit shallow for adults, and the gym was awesome. Parking is $32/per night. At night, I recommend venturing out to the other side of the waterfront for dinner and nightlife. Overall, a cool spot. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: JCanzo
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Westin, along with excellent service from hotel staff, we arrived mid day and had to get our dress shirts pressed for a dinner. We had missed the laundry service pick up by 1 hr however we called the front desk to see if anything could be done. Shiela Lang came to our room and picked up our shirts and took them down to have them serviced right in the hotel. She brought them back a few hours later perfectly pressed just as we had requested. Thank you Sheila for going above and beyond and taking care of the customers needs....We truly appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy, not expensive, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Silver line bus from the airport stops 2 minutes from the hotel. Very new, very classy. Upgraded our room for a higher floor with big windows for free. Starbucks coffee in the room. Nice, new, designed rooms. Very good gym with treadmills and pool for free. Downtown is in 15 minutes walking distance but the bus is at the corner. The staff is helpful and polite. Try the Barking crab near the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: travelhbCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great pool for kids, spacious rooms and pretty close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “So Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: SmallTownGirl0224
Reviews.Content: I had really high hopes for my stay at the Westin Waterfront this past weekend. I previously had stayed at the Westin in Fort Lauderdale and was blown away by the service, the location, the fabulous smell and cleanliness, the valet staff was so nice and we didn't even have a car! I actually didn't have any intention on staying at the Westin in Boston because I wanted a hotel a little closer to the heart of the city. It was a hard find though due to Bruins playoff game 2, Red Sox game, Marathon Monday, and a Celtics game as well. When I came across staying at the Westin I thought, "I should have thought of them to begin with." I wish I didn't excpet so much. After booking online and looking at their website, I wanted to call and inquire about the "in room spa treatment." Bad idea.. the first woman who answered said they don't have a spa. I already knew that, I told her I was talking about the "In room spa treatment" that is mentioned on their website. Apparently she didn't know what I was talking about because she just hung up on me. I then decided to call a little later, hopefully after her shift. The second guy said that the concierge wasn't at their desk after trying to transfer me 2 times and that he would give me a call back. No call back after 2 days. I called again to try to get massages and the woman said the concierge wasn't at their desk and she would give me a call back, again. I asked to speak to a manager who then told me she would call me back as soon as she gets some rates from the outside company. She didn't call me back, some rude lady called back who said "good luck with trying to get an appointment, it's the busiest weekend of the year." I asked if I could call her back directly when I wanted to schedule them. "I guess so.." she said. Fabulous. After giving up on the whole in room massage deal, we arrive at the hotel a few days later. The lobby smelled just as I rememberd, soo good. After checking in we got to the room which smelled like stale cigarettes and had stains all over the beside chair. We then tried to take a nap which could have been fine if we could drown out all of the people talking in the room next to us or in the hallway. When the "valet" got my car, she came cruising around to the front, and had to lay on the horn because a taxi and her almost collided. I couldn't believe my eyes. I think that she could have been a little more cautious with my car. I understand she beeped the horn, but maybe she shouldn't have been flying around to the front. I am highly disapointed with my stay at the Westin Waterfront. I did not ask to speak to a manager while I was there due to the fact of it taking 20 minutes to even check out. There were only 2 people working at the desk on "the busiest weekend of the year". I didn't even want to waste my time talking to someone who wouldn't have done anything for me. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of a bad thing to say...”
Reviews.Author: bigbadbruins
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Hotwire, 2 rooms for 2 nights for 600$ (150$/night). Took the T to get around town. Because the station next door is on the silver line, you'll need to change line once or twice, depending on where you're going but it's not that bad. The room was great. There's a Starbucks in the lobby. Not sure I would pay 300$/night, but for the price I got, I can't complain...

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: AZRAD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nearly 300/night and they charged $18 for high speed internet. The room was comfortable and clean with a high def LCD flat screen TV. Unfortunately they only provided analog cable service. After I paid for the high speed internet with better TV service, I had to ask myself , why couldn't they put in digital TV for all the money I am paying for the room? They had a concierge desk staffed by a very helpful woman, but most times I went there, the line was 3 or 4 people deep. Why didn't they pull another employee over--couldn't they cross train a front desk person to help out? They charged $1.50 a minute for local calls. Why? The fitness center was clean and had ample space.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT,GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: janiel
Reviews.Content: We took the silver line from the Airport,. It was really convenient. When we got off the Bus and walked over to the Hotel the Receptionist was so friendly and helpful. Our room was fabulous, the beds were so comfortable and what a super shower. We took the shuttle into Faneuil hall it's such a great service. The bar is very nice, warm and friendly. All the staff we dealt with was very friendly and professional. We walked into the Aquarium in the morning. Thank you for making our stay in Boston so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Takes Care of Guests”
Reviews.Author: Franko24
Reviews.Content: We stay every year for the Boston Seafood show at the Westin Waterfront. They take care of all of us. Maria Amore and her team have always been top notch and we can always count on our meeting rooms to be ready and exactly how we asked. Debra the concierge....is the best I have dealt with. It is really comforting to know we are covered and taken care of .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tammynnc
Reviews.Content: I took my sister and niece up to Boston for a long weekend and we stayed at this hotel. We arrived at Logan about 7 pm and decided to take the silverline to the hotel. Took us a 45 minutes from arriving at ground transport to getting to the hotel. We took a taxi $15, on the return, got there in less than 10 minutes and felt that it was money well spent. The entire hotel is absolutely beautiful, and we had great service. We both got rooms on the top floor 1(6th) with stunning water/city views, I am SPG-Gold so this may have been considered my upgrade.... hmmm Anyway, the rooms themselves were gorgeous and the beds wonderfully comfortable. The dual showerheads are great. My 8 year old niece loved the indoor pools and spa and most especially loved riding the hotels escalator's up and down, up and down.... The location of the hotel is not the greatest, but my sister wanted to eat at a couple of the seafood restaurants, including legal test kitchen, so this location worked out ok. We did buy a 2 day old town trolley pass which picked us up and dropped us off right at the front door of the hotel and was great for seeing the city. I ordered room service 4 different times in 3 days and each time it came in about 20 mintutes and the food was excellent. An excellent angus burger, serving of fries and a soda will run you about $28, pretty typical in a 4* hotel. Parking was $42/day. what else can I say but.... Ouch!! My only problem with this hotel was the business center. $24 for 1 hour in internet use. I never once saw anyone in there using the computers yet they had someone manning the office. Why not just have a few computers for free use? I really think when paying $200+ for a room you should have free wifi or either free use of computers in the business center. I know this is pretty standard in the more upscale hotels but they need to rethink this policy. I would have given this hotel 5*'s without hesitation except for this. Still, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel if you don't mind being removed from the city for a bit. Public transportation is only about a 5 minute walk away and the service is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic housekeeping service”
Reviews.Author: tmitchjr
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the room service provided by Juvina Pires. She worked around my schedule and the room was made showroom clean and presentable.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal”
Reviews.Author: RuthLo
Reviews.Content: The rooms were pleasant although not quite the same quality as some other five star hotels in Boston. The best part was the views from the rooms over the city of Boston. Unfortunately, while the hotel was great for travelling to and from the airport, it was a quite a walk into the main part of Boston. The lobby area was impersonal - with lots going on. The service from the front desk was okay but not exceptional - again, not what you expect from a five star hotel. Probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Southernbelle441
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Waterfront and the staff were incredible! From the door men to the waiters.. everyone was very welcoming. Deborah the concierge went out of her way numerous times to make our stay unforgettable. She could not have been sweeter. The rooms were very nice and there was so much to do in Boston even in the cold weather!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, could use a guestroom face lift”
Reviews.Author: StacMeeting
Reviews.Content: Great Service and can't beat the location. I was in for 2 days on a conference and enjoyed my stay. If I had to note something, it would be the slippery floors in the bath...Overall though....I was happy with my stay. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place! Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Hic7003
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 15 days at the Westin Waterfront in Boston. I had such a pleasurable experience. The staff was so courteous and helpful. They made me feel at home and welcome. Tobe' at the front desk was great she did everything she could to help me with any issues that arose during my stay! Andrea at the lobby Bar was the smiling face and great company I needed after a tough day working, her service and attitude was second to none! I would definitely recommend staying here! Thank you Westin Waterfront!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Dianathate
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write and let you know what a wonderful stay I had last week. Not only have I never been to the east coast but I have never had the opportunity to stay at a Westin. It was absolutely fabulous. You have a very beautiful property (not to mention incredibly clean.) I wanted to thank you for the â€œover the topâ€� sincerity when my hair brush was broken by the housekeeping department. I must tell you that I was surprised by the promptness and the apologetics. The amenity and personally signed card was a wonderful way of service recovery. I must admit that I was not angry at all over the incident and was a little embarrassed that you went to such lengths in making it right. It shows that I have some work to do at my property as far as customer service. Thank you, again for everything and please pass this on to others as the entire experience was unforgettable; from Andrea in the bar to Debra in Concierge. Thank you for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Staff is fantastic, especially Bill Currie (doorman) and bell staff”
Reviews.Author: auntiearwen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pricey. Very pricey. But it's very near to the Legal Seafood Test Kitchen, and the beds are awesomely comfy. The staff bends over backwards to make your stay as comfortable as humanly possible, and they have some real stars on aforesaid staff. The Irish restaurant, I think it's called O'Donnells, is expensive and wasn't prepared for a large convention; wait times for dinner were easily a half hour or more. Usually more. But they do have Guinness. My vote for the brightest star is Bill Currie, the doorman, who was awesomely helpful the two times I stayed there (Jan. and Feb.); he even remembered my name!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cvrkar
Reviews.Content: great stay staff is onthe ball...moved are very large crew of TS reps...around with ease..great service...great rooms, great beds..only draw back the rooms are a bit dated...needs a face lift...but all an all a+ oh and the prices are a lil steep!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: crimsontide12345
Reviews.Content: Recently in Boston for the Yankee Dental Conference. Attended an alumni event. Great food and drink. Tom Carter was extremely friendly and hospitable. I would recomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: bonsue90
Reviews.Content: This is a luxury hotel with a spectacular lobby. Snacks/drinks are served directly in the open, comfortable lobby. There is also a Starbucks available. The only main dinner restaurant appears to be an Irish Pub which is run independently from the hotel. Food here is good and in a fun atmosphere. This is a clean ,immaculate hotel with superb service. If you are attending an event at the conference center, this should be your only choice...even if it means paying a little more. If you are not with a meeting , location could be an issue. You are removed from the main hub of the city and require at least a 10 min cab ride. Cabs are always available. If money is an issue, give up a meal , and splurge for an upgraded suite with harbor views. This is worth a trip to Boston alone!

Reviews.Title: “solid business hotel”
Reviews.Author: palmer77
Reviews.Content: This is your modern business hotel with updated amenities. Staff is sharp and on the ball, rooms are clean with comfortable beds and showers. It is not within easy walking of attractions but get in a taxi and you are five minutes from many great historical attractions and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: IwaRuggerBuggerIowa
Reviews.Content: If you're travelling to Boston and have to attend a conference or any event taking place in the Convention Center, you can't beat this place. In fact, I would put this place up against any hotel in Boston. Everything exceeded my expectations. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are ultra professional. The only true downfall to this hotel is its location. Because I was attending a conference at the Convention Center the location really didn't bother me. But, if you are travelling to Boston and want to experience the night life, you are going to have to take a five to ten minute cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: sfbartit
Reviews.Content: During a company function, Tom Carter provided excellent service. He went above and beyond!!!

Reviews.Title: “below average Westin - next to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: anhei
Reviews.Content: I spent almost 2 weeks there in January to attend a company event. While the hotel is close to the Convention Center, it is also too far away from ANYthing else. Basically you will have to take a cab or drive. Rooms were standard and nothing to write home about - Westin Heavenly bed is good but in my opinion does not come close to the Marriott beds. Bathroom is doing its job, nice amenities with bad gel, shampoo, body lotion, etc. Good bar and restaurant, there's also a irish pub which does not belong to the hotel but is in the same building - pretty decent food and good beers/wines. Internet is for free in the lobby area and a whopping $15-$18 (depending on speed) in the rooms per day. The place to stay if you have to attend a conference at the Convention Center, not if you want to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Custoemr Service-The Best-Tom Carter”
Reviews.Author: bdevalk
Reviews.Content: I attended the JH annual kick off a couple weeks back. Tom Carter was the best. I travel a great deal for my job and seldom do we find someone that goes way above and beyond. A job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible...the best hotel in the city!”
Reviews.Author: klq
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels, and I have to say this one is top notch. I can not say one negative thing about this hotel. Our holiday party was awesome! The room, the food, the service were all A+. Tom Carter was an awesome bartender, so outgoing, friendly, and efficient! Thank you for such a great job. We will defininitely be having our holiday party here next year, and want Tom to be our bartender again! Thanks again for such a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: shmcneal
Reviews.Content: This is a hip and happening hotel. The decor is modern and elegant. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The best part about it is the staff and their level of service, everyone from the people who greet you at the front desk, to the banquet staff was fantastic. Our bartender, Tom Carter, did a great job taking care of a large group and making everyone feel right at home!

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Boston Waterfront...An Oasis For Work AND Play”
Reviews.Author: Adguy68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Boston Waterfront for a conference and an in-town birthday celebration. The staff is always hospitable, with nice touches like dessert and champagne for my wife's birthday. The views of the city are truly unique, as this hotel really lets you see the special relationship between the city and harbor. I stay at Westins all over the US and all three times I've stayed here for a conference/birthday, the hotel room, staff and ambiance has always been at the top. I let the GM know what a fine job his team does, and I received a kind note back...not typical for many hotel GMs. There are nice bar/restaurant options and great food/entertainment is an $8 cab away at nearby neighborhoods. I'd recommend this hotel if you'd like a great view, great room and superb staff.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kellyosheevents
Reviews.Content: We attended a holiday party a couple weeks back and I just wanted to tell you what a great job Tom Carter did at this event. He was personable and friendly and we all had a blast. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve to remember”
Reviews.Author: SarahDJohnston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for New Year's Eve and were very pleased with the quality of this hotel. Check in was very easy... we were greeted and taken care of immediately. The hotel was very crowded, but they still gave us very individualized attention. We stayed on the 10th floor and had an incredible view of the city. The room was clean, felt very new and had the best amenities (i.e.Starbucks coffee in the rooms) The gym and pool area were very clean and the lobby was beautifully decorated. We enjoyed a drink in the bar with the personable bartender. The two downsides of the hotel: Parking was $32 a night. I feel like that's the most expensive parking in the city. The location was not as ideal. We were away from a lot of the "action". The good thing about Boston in the "T" is so easy to use so we ended up taking that everywhere. There is a T-station about two blocks away from the hotel. Overall,great experience.I would recommend this to any friends traveling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel that takes personalized service to new limits”
Reviews.Author: midnightflyer01
Reviews.Content: The intent of my trip was to spend time with my nephew after his father/my brother passed away last December. We intended to ring in the New Year and Celebrate my birthday. Pulling up to the Hotel in the taxi, The Westin Boston Waterfront is first class in a quiet part of town where one would feel very safe walking alone at night - trust me, I did and quite a lot. Arthur Lamele had checked me in, very friendly. he noticed from my driver license my birthday was coming and wished me a Happy Birthday. The room, bay view, 15th floor - exquisite with lavish furnishings, spacious and the huge King bed - one could melt into it for days. The bathroom is quite large and the heavenly shower - very nice touch although I chose to use only one of the dual shower heads. The following night I spent in and out of Boston Commons, Downtown, Fanueil Hall and North End. On my return I found a Cheese Platter, a Bottle of Wine, Crackers and a Birthday card from Arthur himself and thanking me for choosing the Westin to stay! That was aside from ringing in New Year perhaps the 2nd best part of the trip!!! Very classy and nice touch. Transportation to and From Logan Airport to the The Westin Boston Waterfront is simple via the Silver line to World Trade Center and walking across a bridge and Summer street straight to the main entrance of the hotel. Vs. a $21 taxi ride the $9/fare for a 24 hour pass on the "T" allows you to take the Silver/Blue/Red/Orange/Green lines - well worth it. Dining - MJ O'Connor's serves fabulous food, spirits and deserts. The Haddock Tacos are really good and the Choco-Moulten cake - awesome, just watch your shirt sleeves, it's messy. City Bar - fabulous place to meet clients and friends/family after hours to wind down for a drink or meet new people. Lindsay is the finest bartender I've ever met, polite and very intelligent & makes a mean Appletini with Chopan Vodka! The Westin Workout - Not only am I a Global Sales Manager for an Electronics firm, I'm also a fitness instructor after hours and the westin workout room was a very nice complement to the hotel. State of the art LifeFitness Equipment with Virtual trainers along with a pool and jacuzzi worked well with my needs and open late hours. It would be a complement if Westin offered a hot sauna, however, I was very happy with what they had. Most motels or Hotels don't come near close or take such good care of their equipment. All said, I'd stay at Westin Boston Waterfront again as for the value your dollar and for the peace and quiet it's well woth every dollar. The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to make certain you're comfortable and happy during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “If I had asked for more, my last name would be Madoff...”
Reviews.Author: KJrulz
Reviews.Content: The room was great, very clean - no issues. Great location, tons of things nearby. Caitlyn W. was fantastic, super helpful and kind. I travel a lot and the value, location and customer service was a superb combination here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Big Hotel - Location could be better”
Reviews.Author: zuidpool
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel. Very spacious lobby and attached to convention center. Breakfast is good but overpriced like in most hotels, however there is a Starbucks in the hotel, make sure you try the lemon glaced pound cake. Restaurant is nothing special but prices are ok. Do NOT have packages delivered to the business center, they charge an outrageous fee for that. Rooms are spacious, good beds and good TV. Location is really not within walking distance (15 mins) from anything. Too far from city center or subway. Ok for business only but if you are here for leisure, pick a hotel closer to the subway or city,

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a short break in Boston”
Reviews.Author: DisneyNorwich_UK
Reviews.Content: Arrived in beatuiful autumnal weather for a 3 night stay, close to and cheap and easy to get to from Logan Airport and was walking distance to historic sites. Breakfast expensive in hotel, usual for a Westin, so only ate there one day and found a lovely art cafe 5 mins away on walk to downtown but it wasn't open at weekends! Irsih Pub on premises OK for food. A good 20 mins walk to Little Italy for great restaurants! Couldn't decide between this and the downtowm Westin but glad we chose this one. On quiet South Waterfront where there is going to be further developments once the economy picks up and right next door to the huge convention centre but none on when we were there so very quiet. Staff generally good, did have a wait on check out as only 2 desks open and no priority for SPG guests, in fact when we went up to the SPG desk we were told very rudely by another guest to get back in line, and the staff ignored it. On the whole just what we wanted, a comfortable room and bed for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Bellman ruins good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: emilsun
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new, clean, and modern. It is spacious. Service is exceptional compared to other Westins and Sheraton except for a rude bellman who was castigated by his bell captain for making clients wait and abandoning luggages. Other bellmans are great. Restaurant has great service but average quality.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice for Business”
Reviews.Author: MrJoelB
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here on two separate occasions. There is a walkway to the Convention Center; very convenient if you are attending a convention. Rooms are well above average with excellent beds and ample electrical outlets. All staff members I encountered were both professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wait staff for events is FAB”
Reviews.Author: MarsRD
Reviews.Content: We had an event at the Westin. Part of our bar order was a miscommunication. However, the staff did everything to make it go smoothly. Our server, Cathy Carter, was fantastic. She took care of everything and made the whole thing fun. The AV people were on the spot getting us extension cords. A perfect event usually doesn't happen. What is important is what the staff does to fix an issue. The Westin was worth the money

Reviews.Title: “This was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Mizzodog
Reviews.Content: Rooms amazingly clean...best staff I've encountered in a long time. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay - still FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: PacoandLupe
Reviews.Content: There are so many things I LOVE about this hotel. It's very clean. The room cleaning service people are friendly. The reception people are courteous, efficient and helpful. Parking is affordable. Location is conviniently close to MassPike, which we used many times. Yes, it isn't as central but it's a 10-15mins taxi ride and you spare yourself the parking hassle. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next visit to Boston. There's no other alternative. Really!

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent Service that ruins the ambiance”
Reviews.Author: 345thelifestyle
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very acceptable amenities and facilities, but the staff is very inconsistent with their customer service. The "Service Express" is particularly atrocious at solving problems or getting your room service order correct. They have completely forgotten some simple requests. There is clearly not enough accountability with the service staff and it bleeds into the entire hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: norriecarol
Reviews.Content: We were due to spend 3 nights at the hotel (pre booked). We travelled to Boston by train from New York. The train was over 5 hours late which effectively reduced our time to explore Boston by a day. In asking if we could have another night we were immediately told this was all right and we could keep the same room. However the price of that room for that one night had increased by 60%. At the end of our touring holiday we were pre booked for another night at the hotel. In the lobby there is a screen showing flight details. In my innocence I politely asked a member of staff if he was able to get details of our flight from Newark to which he rudely responded that he did not work for the airline. The hotel was made aware of these concerns. The hotel is well appointed. It should not have "Waterfront " in its title as it is nowhere near the waterfront. Boston is a lovely city which, for tourists, is easy to walk round. However it is a good 10/15 minute walk from the hotel. I see the hotel was rated 45th. out of 73 from customer reviews but I am sure it has a much higher position when it comes to cost. I am certain there must be other hotels which are better value for money with a more convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for cruise terminal and convention hall”
Reviews.Author: quequedub
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Boston Waterfront for one night, before departing on a cruise from the nearby passenger cruise terminal, so we didnâ€™t need much. We arrived by train, which is about a $6 taxi ride away, or about a mile, for those without baggage. The hotel lobby is impressive and elegantly simple. The room was small-ish, though nicely decorated. Views from the room (facing downtown) were panoramic. If there were any elite amenities for top-tier status, I couldnâ€™t tell it (including any consideration for a late checkout). If youâ€™re sailing from the cruise terminal, you canâ€™t pick a better location; if you want to see anything in Boston other than the convention center, youâ€™ll find this place out of the way and not well-situated. Finding restaurants within a couple of blocks was impossible, so plan on eating on-property if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Retirement Luncheon”
Reviews.Author: davidgovernment
Reviews.Content: We held a retirement luncheon in Sauciety Restaurant on Oct 26, 2010. The food was delicious and plentiful. The service orchestrated by Outlet Manager, Aleksandar Bogdanic, was phenomenal. He and his team paid every attention to detail; the entire staff under his direction was warm, friendly, and professional. Sales Managers John Sadek and Kelly Anderson were extremely accommodating in planning this event and meeting our price point. Catering Manager Katie Butler was instrumental in working a special, customized menu with the Restaurant Chef. Extraordinary customer service by all the associates. Very Government friendly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service from David Sarofeen”
Reviews.Author: smileyz787
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Westin Waterfront hotel, and David Sarofeen was working the bar at a dinner event. He gave us fantastic service with great drink recommendations, and makes the most delicious cosmo I've ever had. Thanks for a great night David!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for convention attendees”
Reviews.Author: akiraoz
Reviews.Content: I was attending the convention at the next door and this hotel was extremely convenient to the exhibition hall. The room was nice and clean but the view from my room was terrible... Also I found it a bit annoying that in the morning I checked out the cleaning crew kept knocking my door asking what time I was leaving the room. I recommend this hotel if you are attending the convention.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that keeps us coming back”
Reviews.Author: STaylor82
Reviews.Content: Every year my fiancee and I get a hotel room at the Westin Waterfront so we don't have to drive after a work holiday party at the nearby Exchange Conference Center. 2009 was the third or fourth year we stayed there (cannot remember when they opened, but whenever that was, that is when we started going there). The beds are super comfortable, the black out shades are great, and despite the closeness to a 4-6 lane road outside, never woken up by traffic. There is consistently functions at the hotel when we are staying whether it be a wedding or business function and we never have long lines at check in and never hear anything in the halls, although we don't arrive back to the room till after midnight. The Birch Bar offers great martinis and although I forget the bartender's name, we always recognize him when we sit down and order up. Excellent appetizers that aren't your typical bar food too! Recommend to anyone staying in Boston especially those with business in the area conference center or the Seaport. If your interests are more "downtown", Boston is small so you aren't far away from wherever you are going

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service great location excellent room”
Reviews.Author: Bergreenwood
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days at end of September Excellent hotel quick check in room great size on the ninth floor staff very friendly and helpful .Will recomend and stay here again Bernard Dunnne Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Houskeeping”
Reviews.Author: aplamieniak
Reviews.Content: I needed a houshold item, a spoon to, to measure my medication and a refridgerator to store my meds. MARIA FIGUREOA was on duty when I arrived . (ROOM 1423) I asked for her help and without skipping a beat, she came to my assistance. She deserves '' Employee of the MONTH '' Sincerely, Mark Plamieniak Guest from OCTOBER 8 - 11.

Reviews.Title: “Official Gov Business”
Reviews.Author: misterlatin
Reviews.Content: Overall accommodation and experience was excellent. Would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “awful smell of cigar/cigarette smoke, don't they train housekeeping to advise management”
Reviews.Author: stretchhollywood
Reviews.Content: I was at the Westin Oct 6-10.2010 upon check in we asked if we could have a higher floor but they told us they were all booked. Upon entering room 1056 the pungent odor of cigar/cigarette smoke was awful. but since they told us they were all booked I then unpacked and we went out. Upon returning I was very dissatisfied so I then again went to the front desk and told them that the smell was overwhelming and could they move us, please. Funny, but now they had a room avail (same day they said they did not) Moved to room 1330 and asked the front desk to change the light bulb in magnification mirror, needless to say that also did not happen. You would think after all the trouble they could at least give us a credit????

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Bostonlover2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent three nights at the Westin. The service was excellent and the room was just right. However, the real reason for this review is to recognize James, the doorman whom you meet upon arrival. We believe a smiling face on your initial contact means everything, and this gentleman is hands-down #1 - no competition. James was worth the price of admission, always there to to anything and everything needed as you either left to go out or returned after a long day. And what a wonderful, wonderful attitude! James, you are the face of the Westin Waterfront, and we hope that you're running the entire show one day. Many thanks to you and to the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: WanttoGetoutMore
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this hotel and found the concierge, check in staff, housekeeping, bartenders and all personnel easy and fun to deal with. I did have some lost items of which half were recovered. The hotel sent them to me at my expense in a very, timely manner.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for meetings!”
Reviews.Author: DRisselman
Reviews.Content: I organize meetings twice a year at various locations throughout the US. I work with all hotel chains, and select the hotels based off of customer service and value. While the meeting attendees are not demanding, they have a high level of expectation that must be met. I chose the Westin Boston Waterfront to host two concurrent meetings held over the course of 3-days, with a total of 60 attendees. We catered 2 breakfasts, 1 sit down lunch, 1 brown bag lunch, 1 break, and a cocktail reception with appetizers. The meals were exceptional and they quickly replenished items as the stock was depleted. The clam chowder was so delicious that they had to replenish it three times, and many opted to enjoy en extra bowl in lieu eating the beautiful and tasty desserts. The meeting rooms were setup as promised, including specific AV requirements. The meeting spaces were easily to access, quiet, and the lighting and HVAC were easily adjusted. While the cost of the minimal AV needs ended up being much more than expected, the service was prompt and our needs were met. Maria Amore, the Catering Sales Manager, was always available and met with me the day before our event. She reassured me that she would check in throughout the meetings to make sure that everything was up to our satisfaction. She delivered on her promise and really made hosting the meetings effortless. The lobby is beautiful and very grand. It made the perfect spot for some of our groups â€œbreakoutâ€� sessions. While they arenâ€™t on the waterfront per se, they are a short walk to several nice restaurants. They also provide a free shuttle to Faneuil Hall and many nearby restaurants, just ask the driver to drop you off. The business center is very convenient and the staff was very helpful. It seems that there are always last minute requests for photocopying and they were always willing to quickly get the job done. I would recommend the Westin Boston Waterfront for anyone looking for a good value, beautiful location, lovely meeting space, and delicious food. Of all the meetings Iâ€™ve hosted, this is the first review Iâ€™ve written. It was easily one of the most effortless and successful meetings Iâ€™ve been responsible for hosting.

Reviews.Title: “Love You Westin Boston Waterfront!!”
Reviews.Author: oseaghan
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and always stay here when in Boston. Although it is part of a large national chain I find that the staff goes above and beyond to personalize my visits. In particular kudos to John Sadek and Kelly Anderson who have hosted 2 hour events for our group a few times, which is terrific. It gives us a chance to socialize after hours in such a pleasant environment. It is also such a delight to arrive in my room after an all day cross country flight and find special little amenities. A terrific new addition is the free shuttle service to Faneuil Hall, a nice central location for getting to various spots like the North End for dinner. They make me feel like I'm coming back to visit friends. Love you Westin Boston Waterfront!

Reviews.Title: “Unless you want to stay at the hotel, the location is a taxi ride from all the sights.”
Reviews.Author: jkaym43
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because the meetings were here but it out of the area for sightseeing. They charged for everything, internet, incoming faxes, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Conventions”
Reviews.Author: SugarCreek
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights for a conference, which is the only reason to stay here. There is not much within walking distance and thus a taxi ride to much of what you want in Boston. The room was fine. We could see the waterfront in the far distance. I have to make the same comment as many reviewers about the charge for Internet access. In 2010 isn't asking if you want Internet sort of like asking if you want hot water, a private bath, etc? On the plus side, the fitness center was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not again!”
Reviews.Author: jphillips12
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this hotel with my husband. Room was average hotel room size. It was clean and bright. View of city was good. For the cost of the room internet access should be included. Location is good but need taxi to get to most points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “restaurant was great”
Reviews.Author: jerrythomp
Reviews.Content: The restaurant staff, Antonio, Merry, and Touria were by far the best that I have encountered in awhile. I travel regularly and usually am disappointed in the service I get, but these people wer fantastic and should be commended. Dr. Jerome Thompson MD, MBA Chief Surgery Le Bonheur CHildrens Hospital Memphis

Reviews.Title: “SPG Platinum Member Review”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumPete
Reviews.Content: Hello I am an SPG Platinum member. I have stayed at this hotel about 7-8 times. The hotel is located in the Seaport District of South Boston right next to the Boston Convention Center. The Hotel is an easy walk to the Seaport District such as as the World Trade Center Boston where I work. You would want to take a cab to Downtown Boston if you are dressed in heals or in a suit on a hot summer day. The lobby is very spacious and modern. There is a Starbucks, O'conners Pub/Rest, and the more formal rest called Sauceity. The Pub I have eaten at is good standard pub grub, burgers,fish and chips etc.. Have not been to the other rest. There is a seperate line for SPG Gold and Platinum checkin which is nice. As I have stayed here 7-8 times I have been upgraded to a very spacious and nice suite everytime except once. The suites are usually 2 rooms, 2 entrances with a queen bed and 2 full bathrooms. One room has the bed,bathroom, table and TV while the other room has the living room with TV sofa, dining table and other bathroom. The suites have a view of Downtown Boston and Boston Harbor. The rooms are modern, clean, spacious and very nice. The beds are the "heavenly" beds and are great. (we have one in our house). I usually stay with my wife and we love the rooms and the hotel. The Hotel has a parking garage which is $42 day. If you dont have a car there are plenty of taxis and the "t" is a short walk away. if you are looking for a hotel right in downtown Boston Proper their are 2 other starwood hotels located in the backbay the Westin and Sheraton and both hotels are a very short walk to Newbury Street and Boylston streets. However really like this hotel because it is new, clean modern and I like the upgrades. Please let me know if you have any questions

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: re_doyle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for one night before heading further on our travels. The rooms are very nice and clean. We dinned at the Irish pub in the hotel. The food was really good and service from Ricardo was excellent. I was traveling to the west coast after Boston and wanted a place to leave my bags. Kamal at the Front Desk was very nice and let us leave our bag there for a week so we wouldnt have to carry it all over the country. Overall the place is great, very nice staff, near the airport and in walking distance to faneuil hall and the rest of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for the convention...”
Reviews.Author: pickybiz
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for the convention center, but otherwise not very convenient for the rest of the city. Rooms are modern and spacious. Limited food choices within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not satisfied”
Reviews.Author: genomesolutions
Reviews.Content: Its a convention hotel, so can get away with poor service. I am starwood Gold, but no Gold amenties offered at this hotel (yes, 1 bottle of water - come on - that is the gold benefit ata Westin - no lounge, no upgrade - unacceptable). Front desk is non chalant and the Starbucks is outright rude. The staff at the starbucks behaved in an unacceptable manner. The management tried to make up with a bottle of wine, but that is not the point. The point is that well trained staff should NEVER behave in such a manner with guests. The gym is a joke with basic ameneties and all this for an exhorbitant conference rate plus $40 in parking. Better choices abound in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, was misconceived on parking charges”
Reviews.Author: Spike8710
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled to have a free hotel stay via a friend, but was given a misconception about parking. I was told that I had to have a credit card on file for the hotel and that charges would be taken out and then put back in. I didn't know this was for parking. I was told by the hotel weeks later that the charge were for parking and they do not comp parking because it is seperate. This was not what I was told by the front desk. I realize that parking is going to cost money, but was under the impression by the man that checked us in that the charge would be reimbursed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel -- Very good amenities and location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPenguin
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a four-night stay at the Boston Westin Waterfront. We enjoyed the hotel and were very pleased with our stay. Overall: This is definitely a business hotel, and we reaped the benefits of the expanded services offered by a business hotel, even though we were on a leisure trip. We took a red-eye flight so arrived at the hotel around 7:00 am, but they were able to check us in! I know this depends on availability, but I've been to hotels where they won't even check to see if they have openings that early in the day. The front desk and concierge staff was universally friendly and helpful, even sharing some restaurant recommendations and making change. Here's one feature I loved: The hotel lobby has two computer stations where you can log in, check on your flight, and print out your boarding pass. They also have a screen in the lobby (as well as a station on the in-room TV) with what I call the "departure channel," which lists upcoming airplane departure times. Location: I saw some complaints about the location of this hotel, but we liked it a lot and found public transportation options very easy. We were a 30-minute walk to most of the popular locations in Boston. The T stop is right across the way, and we could be at South Station in minutes. I recommend the $15 one-week LinkPass. Also very convenient to/from the airport (just hop on the Silver Line, which is a bus, to the World Trade Center Stop, go upstairs, and walk over the pedestrian bridge to the hotel). The Old Town Trolley Tour picks up and drops off right at the hotel's lobby. We didn't use a single taxi for the whole trip. There aren't restaurants, liquor/grocery stores nearby, though, so plan accordingly. (Try MJ O'Connor's at the hotel, maybe!) Room: Our room had a great view of Boston and a bit of the harbor. We put down the see-through shade but didn't close the black-out curtains, so we woke up every day to the lovely view. The bed was very comfortable. We had all the standard in-room amenities, like single-serve coffee maker, glasses, ice bucket, bottle opener, etc. The bathroom was comfortable and equipped with lotion, shampoo, conditioner, blow dryer, robe, etc. (no fan, though -- boo!). Everything functioned well, and we had enough room to spread out. The room was mostly very quiet, but we could hear people/housekeeping walking by sometimes. Everything was clean, and housekeeping was inobtrusive. Dining: The in-room dining was very standard, but it's available 24 hours, which is nice. We ate twice at MJ O'Connor's and were very pleased with it. The food and drink were tasty (we had Dark 'n' Stormy cocktails and Harpoon beer for drinks and fish 'n' chips, chicken salad, pizza, and the fabulous hot dog platter for food), and the service was friendly and attentive. Highly recommended! We tried City Bar once, and the food was good (I think it shares a kitchen with MJ O'Connor's), but the service was pretty poor. We had breakfast one day at Sauciety. The food was pretty tasty, and the service was passable but not great. I'd call the food and drink prices very high, but it's a hotel, and it's in Boston, so we weren't surprised or put off. I call this hotel a very good value in a very good location. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, roomy & work paid the bills”
Reviews.Author: soccer-tom-69
Reviews.Content: I arrived almost 5 hours before check-in and without any wait or fuss was provided a very large king size room with a wonderful view of the city skyline. Bed was very comfortable, great restful nights of sleep. At any off hours, they provided an immediate courtesy shuttle to take us to different parts of the city, dinner in the north end (Italian), Fenway tour, The Barking Crab restaraunt, Copley Square etc. I would also recommend the Urban AdvenTours which was a guided bike tour, it rocked! EVERYTHING is within a walk of the hotel, including the harbour-walk which is a great way to get your body & mind going.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Property....”
Reviews.Author: ktpc2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a conference. Overall the proprty is ok, but I would never pay the prices for myself. Upgraded room was nice. The two major problems I had were that it took 50 minutes to check-in from the time I got in the line until I received my keys and rude service agent on the phone. I did not see any SPG Gold/Plat line at the time of check-in and the employees I asked had no idea what I was talking about. The second was that I never received my paper any morning I was there. When I called down to get one a rude female agent yelled at me saying they were already passed out. After an hour the paper showed up. If my company paid for it, I would stay there again but on my own dime I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: joeyjo99
Reviews.Content: Hotel is attached to the convention centre in South Boston so perfect if you are attending an event there, if you are a tourist then be warned that it is a good 20-30 min walk into the city centre. The staff were excellent and the rooms very modern and light, the pool tiny but gym looked better and changing rooms immaculate. If you are at the "World Trade Centre" convention centre also in South Boston then it is a good 10 min walk, try the Renaissance instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: quarks77
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at this hotel. Hotel is less than 5 minutes walk to the nearest T (subway) station. It is a peaceful place to get some rest. The room is very spacious and the bed is wonderfully comfortable to sleep in. The swimming pool is a bit small though. Free wifi only in the lobby. Hotel is beside the Boston Convention Centre, which is very convenient if you are attending a conference/function there. There is nothing exciting around the hotel and you will definitely need to use the T (subway) to explore (downtown) Boston.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - BUT NOT TO BE CONFUSED WITH WESTIN, COPLEY PLACE”
Reviews.Author: seriousguy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a two week stat=y in various locations in USA. When I told someone I was staying in The Westin, Boston they deleriously advised us we had chosen wisely and we would be staying right in the heart of things. Unfortunately I discovered we had chosen the one at the Waterfront which is slightly removed from the heart of things. Everywhere you go oretty much require a taxi, although they are easy to get. The hotel itself had excellent facilities. Staff were good, but the restaurant where you had to go for breakfast was overpriced. Room on 10th floor has great views. One comment: bit of a pain having to pay for wifi in your room when it was free in the lobby area. And why did you have to pay for wifi in the business centre which were told was not part of the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Location was terrible. VERY Remote...”
Reviews.Author: Diverstj
Reviews.Content: Location was terrible. VERY Remote INDUSTRIAL / COMMERCIAL area!!! No good unless you're there for a convention and it is NOT waterfront as the name would lead you to believe.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in comfort at the Westin Boston Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: crispysqu
Reviews.Content: When I travel, I prefer four star hotels, but I love to shop around for a two or three star price (sounds like an ad for a booking site) . It's the thrill of the hunt! I happened upon a fantastic promotion for Westin's Boston Waterfront Hotel. I won't name the specific promo, as it may not be in effect when this is posted, but it is definitely worth looking at the Hotel Special Offers section if you are booking directly through Westin's site. It is also noteworthy that when I needed human assistance with my reservation, the Westin Worldwide Reservations line provided a very friendly, well-spoken, patient, and incredibly helpful representative on multiple occasions. Now to get down to brass tacks... The first thing I want to address is getting to and from this hotel. I have read in some of the other reviews that the hotel is not close to a T Stop and is difficult to get to via rapid transit. Well, five years ago that may have been true. However, with the addition of the MBTA's SL1 Silver Line service, there is now a T stop (World Trade Center) that is a <5 minute walk from this hotel. On the other hand, unless you want to go way out to the airport, this segment of the Silver Line only connects to the Red Line (South Station), so I did find that getting to major attractions often required changing trains. But personally, that doesn't bother me if I'm not in a big hurry. Secondly, it is indeed true that this hotel is not close enough to the water to grab a snorkel and jump right in. But it's not really that far away. I had a beautiful view of the harbor and a large chunk of the Boston skyline from my standard room. Furthermore, a quick check of Google Maps revealed this fact before I read a couple of the nasty reviews about it. I won't disagree, though, that the word "Waterfront" in the name might give some the wrong idea. Front desk staff at the Westin Boston Waterfront were friendly and helpful, but few and far between. There were ~six computer terminals at the front desk, but only two were occupied by staff. This should not have been the case at a large hotel, especially on a weekend. I did get quick service when checking in, but had to wait to check out. This brings me to another issue. No automated checkout system. At least not an obvious one. Personal touch is nice, but when I'm ready to go, I would much rather speak to a computer than wait in a line. My room was very nice! I could not get over how clean it was. I expect a clean room, but it looked as though I was the first person to stay in this one. As I mentioned above, I had a wonderful view in this standard room. It was also quite spacious, and included a flat screen TV, a desk, an easy chair, floor to ceiling windows, and of course, Westin's signature Heavenly Bed. And trust me, the name is very appropriate. The bathroom was also very clean and included a beautiful black marble vanity, Kohler fixtures and the Heavenly Bath (basically just a dual shower head and tea scented shampoo). One last thing I would like to note. And this really erks me. Westin is one of the few hotel chains that still charge for internet access. And it is NOT cheap. I had to rack out nearly $26 for two days of access. I wish that Starwood (the parent company) would step out of the time warp on this one and realize that internet access is as essential in a hotel today as a bed. This is doubly true for a business traveler. Overall, my experience at the Westin Boston Waterfront Hotel was great. I would definitely stay again and I would recommend it to friends and family staying in the area. 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Westin Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Julacco
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to let you know that our stay at the Westin was awesome and everyone and everything was awesome.......we were there for the APWA Convention......Amy Driscoll was more than accomodating and quick to reply when we needed to amend our reservations.... We wanted to let you know of the special attention we received from James the Doorman â€“ he was so personable and we had such a good time every time he greeted us â€“ not sure if he only works the night shift as that was when we were greeted by himâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦just wanted to put in a good wordâ€¦â€¦â€¦..if you do speak to him just remind him that I called him â€œPeachesâ€�â€¦â€¦â€¦he is sure to remember me!!! We would certainly recommend this hotel for the ambience and service from the staff thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Two Great Bartenders”
Reviews.Author: afrosik99
Reviews.Content: I planned three receptions at the Westin and they were all handled excellently by the staff and bartenders. John Mulligan and David Sarofeen were execellent to my reception attendees.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek & Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: Isabeldad
Reviews.Content: Ultra sleek hotel this Westin has great city and waterviews of Boston. Only stayed one night but it was thoroughly restful. Pulled up right in front of the hotel our bags were unloaded quickly.Upon entering the lobby could smell the signature scent of the Westin Hotel toiletries. Clean and refreshing. Greeted courteously by the front desk staff. As we walked to the elevator were given a quick tour of where things were, the pool, gym, starbucks etc.We were given a corner room on the 8th floor.Upon entering our room we were informed of whats what and asked if we needed anything else. Needed a few more towels, another robe as we were 3 travelers. They arrived shortly after. The hotel is located next door to the modern convention center it was a bit isolated from the downtown areas.There are taxis and the Trolley tour bus were waiting right outside the lobby.Ordered room service for dinner and breakfast delicious and beautifully presented on a nice rolling table by the room service staff. Orders arrive in less than 30 minutes. My daughter ordered chocolate ice cream and it turned out to be a pint of Hagen Dasz. What a treat! It was reminiscent of our fantastic stay at the Westin Hollywood Diplomat in Florida.Highly recommend a stay at this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonYerf
Reviews.Content: When I booked my reservation I requested adjoining rooms so that our group could be together. I was notified a few days before I arrived that it was set up as requested. My flight arrived early, yet the hotel had no problem with me checking into both rooms early, nor did they have a problem when we split up the room charges later. Employees were plesant and willing to help with any questions. As always, the beds were heavenly. Location from the airport is super convienent - just a $2.00 ride on the Silver line and across a foot bridge. While it's not in the heart of the city there are plenty of options within walking distance (including two very nice bakeries).

Reviews.Title: “Not waterfront”
Reviews.Author: itraveltons
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not on the water!!! It is a 15 minute walk to the water. It is not in the center of anything!!! The location was so bad that it over shadowed the vacation. To get into Boston and get the train or metro was a 30 minute walk, to get into town and see any sites that you may want to see is 45 minute to an hour. Most of the trolleys donâ€™t go out that far, there is nothing close. When I called the starwood costumer service number I was told that they could see why I had thought that it was â€œwaterfrontâ€� since the site for the hotel showed water out the windows of the rooms, but that that was just the name and it was in the waterfront area. I was so disappointed that I donâ€™t know if I will use Westin at all anymore. I am a gold member at starwood (this got me a free bottle of water in my room). They where deceptive in their ads and I was and am very unhappy with the way it was handled.

Reviews.Title: “This was the most luxurious place I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: judiesmile
Reviews.Content: Everyone was so helpful and courteous. Our stay was absolutely delightful and far exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Boston”
Reviews.Author: HelloSunshine85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Westin and had an enjoyable stay. Our flight arrived early morning and check in wasn't until 3:00 that afternoon. We proceeded to the hotel upon arrival to have the concierge store our luggage while we began our tour of the city, but to our wonderful surprise, they had our room ready and we were allowed to check in and freshen up in our room! The room was very spacious and looked neat and crisp with the beautiful white comforter. The bed was comfortable and the rooms were quiet. It's just a quick walk from the Silver Line T station. The area is very quiet with little traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: sianib
Reviews.Content: As this was my first time in America, my husband wanted to make sure that we had a great hotel and it was! We have paid the similiar prices for rooms in the UK and have not always had such clean and lovely rooms. Although our break was for leisure, the hotel always had a nice vibe of people coming in and having meetings etc. The concierges were brilliant, especially Andy, couldn't do enough for you! I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel and would stay here again. The only dislike, is that they advertised some things in their brochure that they didn't have such as travel wash. Also the room service charges are expensive and you can eat much cheaper in the town than in the hotel bars. All in all, thank you for a lovely holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. We stayed for one night...”
Reviews.Author: Alexob04
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. We stayed for one night and got a great deal on expedia. Should be a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “fun and different area”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelalot29
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Boston with friends over the weekend...a little skeptical about the waterfront location when we arrived but after walking around it all changed. Boston is definitely a historic city, but what sets to waterfront apart is the openness. At the suggestion of the front desk staff we walked across the footbridge and saw the hustle and bustle. On one side you had an OAR concert at the Pavilion (a little too young for us) and then we ran into the folks walking to the OVO show under a giant blue and yellow big top. We walked along the harbor and stumbled upon an open area bar lounge type area...we say and sipped wine as the sun was setting. As for the hotel we had some beverages at the Birch Bar - a little different but again very open and airy. The beds are to die for!!!!!!! I wanted to pack it up...the bartender was telling us you can actually buy the bed online. The hotel is on the larger side but is definitely worth a visit on your next time in Boston...check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Andy Chen is Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: CitationJetcaptain
Reviews.Content: Andy's recomendation and reservation for our group of 4 at Abe & Louie's Steakhouse was just what we were looking for. Seated right away, excellent service, great food and all in a great area of (West) Boston. He steared us away from the areas he knew would be packed with tourists or that he had sent lots of people to already. Can't recommend enough the expertise we received!! He made it a great evening!

Reviews.Title: “James the doorman”
Reviews.Author: Docteeth
Reviews.Content: Our family had a wonderful stay at this wonderful hotel. Everything and everyone was top notch especially the doorman, James. He always smiled and spent loads of time screwing around with my kids all despite recently losing his wife.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...Beautiful Hotel....but a little isolated...”
Reviews.Author: BarrieTripper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Boston Waterfront for three nights during our visit to Boston on the July 9th weekend. First off let me say that the hotel is beautiful. The staff are amazing....a special thank you goes out to one of their concierges, Andy. This gentleman could not have been more accomodating. I'm sure answering peoples' questions all day long must become quite mundane. Andy always greeted us with a big smile and patiently answered all of our questions, made dinner reservations for us, arranged a city tour and even checked the weather forcast for us so we were able to make the most of our visit to Boston. I can't say enough able the hotel service. The hotel is a little isolated in the newly redeveloped Seaport area of the city, although not on the actual waterfront. There is a Starbucks in the lobby of the hotel for the first coffee of the day, and a nice, reasonably priced Irish pub on site. We ate in the pub twice during our stay and were very pleased with the service, quality and quantity of the meal and the reasonable price. Access to the hotel is easy...a 5 or 7 dollar cab ride from Boston South Station or a 5 minute walk from the SilverLine transit station directly across the street. Complimentary internet and an airport shuttle would be the only recommended improvements I would ask of the hotel management. $12.95 for 24 hours of internet seemed a little steep considering the room rate of $200 per night. (We did get a discounted rate for night 2 and 3 of our stay) The cab ride to the airport which is a mere 3 or 4 miles away was $12. Not too bad. All in all we had a fantastic stay and will seriously consider staying at the Westin Boston Waterfront on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but missing a LOT”
Reviews.Author: thinkinSO
Reviews.Content: First off, I have to say that the Westin is a beautiful hotel. There is a classy yet comfortable vibe, and the staff is very friendly and welcoming. Unfortunately, that is where the perks end. The rooms are very expensive, and for this price I do not expect to pay premiums for every service. The hotel has no airport shuttle (which shocked me considering that the local Marriotts DO), charges $13 per day for internet use (that constantly cuts out), and $1.50 for local calls. Further, the self parking is over $30 per day, which is outrageous. Also, there was an error in my reservation, and rather than extend the contracted conference rate, I was charged the full hotel rate of $269 plus taxes. That was simply bad business. The next time I have reason to be in Boston, I will stay elsewhere. I do enjoy Westin hotels in general, but at least the Marriott makes me feel like they WANT my business.

Reviews.Title: “Merely Adequate”
Reviews.Author: pokeymom
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here so little choice in where I could stay, however, after a VERY pleasant stay at the Jersey City, NJ Westin last month, had HIGH hopes and expectations for this location. Alas, that was not the case. PROS: nice bedding, flat screen TV, large lobby with plenty of seating and meeting space, and pleasant servers in the Irish Pub. CONS: No phone book in rooms, over-priced food (both in restaurants and on room service menu), no airport shuttle, excessive parking fee of $32/day, business center charges $6 for 15 minutes on the computer, and inconsistent housekeeping -- forgot to replace soap, shampoo, mouth wash one day (so I helped myself from the cart in the hallway). I enjoyed the hotel's location best in the early morning hours, as there was little-to-no traffic ... ran a few miles around the waterfront along the warfs and found not one, but TWO Dunkin Donuts within a quarter-mile! So much better than the hotel's Starbucks! Walked to the train station for lunch one day - it's on the same side of Summer Street as the hotel, so just stay on the side walk and you'll find it. The food court had plenty of choices: Pizzeria Reggina, McDonald's, Chinese, salads, bakery, etc. On the way back, I passed a shopette and was able to buy a bottle of wine and snacks for my room - again, same side of the street. Gas station is easy to find if you turn right out of hotel - it's about a half-mile further down Summer Street. Hotel's hallways are as long as they are in Las Vegas, but elevators are quick and plentiful. Be sure to ask for a room with a view because there are plenty that merely look out onto the AC/heating units. Probably would not stay again unless changes were made -- an airport shuttle and free internet goes a long way, especially when you consider there are other choices in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but far from the action”
Reviews.Author: Planner73
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite nice. Great beds, quite rooms, and very clean. The staff was very helpful. The hotel is situated to support conventions, but sadly, it is a good $20 round trip taxi trip (with tip) to most of the places to visit in the city. This is not the place to stay if you are with your family and want to see Boston. It is the place to stay if you are a businessman and have no desire to leave the hotel. The Irish pub on site will serve your needs quite well. The pool was closed for some form of work during my three day stay, but their fitness room was pretty good. As usual, they charged for internet in the room, but free wifi in the lobby. Parking is expensive ($32 a night), but pretty typical for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Slept Well in a Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: kitchenchemist
Reviews.Content: Pros - Great bed, clean room, good TV selections. Silver Line World Trade Center stop within walking distance. Always manned concierge desk, free wifi in huge lobby. Large vanity magnification mirror, modern shower head, peaceful decor, good AC. Old Town Trolley service right outside the front door Cons - Returned to my room on my third day at 3 PM and my room hadn't been cleaned (it was a Monday after a very slow Sunday night.) View in room 441 non-existent. Indicated I wanted a higher floor but was put in a low floor. The bun on my hamburger from the pub was BURNED and the hamburger itself was like shoe leather. (I got it to go so couldn't take it back.) Hotel is NOT on the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs some improvement in customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sasher08
Reviews.Content: 1) This is misleading - it's not on the waterfront. 2) We not only didn't get clean towels after coming back from a full day of sweating but then when we called for towels and someone was to have delivered them, they didn't show. They had taken our dirty towels so we were left without. 3) The dining room shut down because of the economy? How about because your prices are unreal, i.e. average breakfast is $25.00?! 4) When asking the concierge for help in locating where exactly was the location of the fireworks, she said with a snotty tone and look on her face "The esplanade" and just stared at me. Like I actually knew what the heck that was or where it was located?! She, above anyone in that hotel, should have been the friendliest face and most helpful. Sooo not the case!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and elegant”
Reviews.Author: ladyfitch
Reviews.Content: I've always liked Westin hotels and this one is no exception. Although it is not on the waterfront, it is nearby, so the name is a little misleading if anything. The receiption area is very large and modern, quite a busy hall. I called ahead and booked there based on the fact that I could get a room now, however when arriving I was told by a rather rude woman that the check in was 3pm. I told her I understood that, but was there any rooms available? Not right now she tells me. I waited a few minutes and approached another guest agent who was able to give me a room with a different bedding situation, but upgraded. Lovely. The rooms are very modern and typical of the Westin style. Large enough rooms, lots of natural light (bit too bright for my liking actually). The linens are all white, high quality furnishings, lots of dark wood, sleep bathrooms. There are sufficient bathroom amenities and you can call down for additional things you may require. The minibars are not stocked, but you can order items and place them in the fresh centre (like a fridge, but not as cold?). LCD tvs and a good coffee maker in the room with starfbucks sachets (there is also a starbucks in the lobby). The water pressure is great due to the dual shower heads, the bathroom lighting amazing for make up and there is a bath also. The bathroom is very pleasant and has a velour robe also. Extensive dining and room service menus in addition to restaurants available. Nice gym and indoor poor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, expensive parking and not that convenient to downtown”
Reviews.Author: aplnet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short 4 night trip. The hotel was nice, the room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. Check-in was easy and the staff very pleasant. Swimming pool was indoor and fairly small, and my kids not particularly enjoy their time in it. Did not like the fact that wi-fi was not free in the room nor that the self parking was $32 per night, which seemed way out of line given its distance from downtown. We got a good price for the room, and the only real complaint is that the subway was not too convenient. Yes, the silver line is only a couple of blocks away, but to get around in Boston it required additional transfers at the South Station and sometimes multiple transfers were required for a simple trip, since the silver line goes nowhere but to the South Station. Lack of restaurants in the area was a little problematic, but there were a few goods options close to the waterfront (which by the way, this hotel is not on the waterfront, despite its name).

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms and Nice Views but not actually on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: wegoaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference at a nearby hotel that's actually on the waterfront. The hotel is adjacent to the new convention center but that is the only thing convenient about the location of the hotel for a business traveler. Restaurants require a bit of a hike to get to - as those restaurants are actually on the waterfront. As others mentioned - no shuttle to the airport is a real drawback (as most business travelers seem to go to and from the airport from this hotel). The hotel itself had very nice rooms - very comfortable bed, clean sheets, showers with dual shower heads, climate control, and a nice touch with the semi-transparent pull down shades. However, it's missing the finer touches I'd expect with a 4-star at the rate that I paid. Was not able to find the concierge from time to time, limited staffing at the check-in desk (I saw two people manning the desk even though there were a multitude of people waiting), and just did not get the personal and feel that I would have expected - but I will give them the benefit of doubt as the hotel was at full capacity the whole time I was there and multiple conferences were being hosted simultaneously. For those that utilize the gym, the gym was very nice (updated equipment) and there was adequate room in the gym for calistenics (sp?) and a nice indoor pool. I'd like to add, internet is a bit pricey compared to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Lost Soul”
Reviews.Author: worldlyCanada
Reviews.Content: The Westin Waterfront in Boston is all icing but little cake. You can tell that the hotel desperately wants it all work, but it simply doesnâ€™t. From its non-existent mini bar, to its room service that offers fluff, to its paid wireless internet that cuts in and out, to it front desk computers that seemed down all the times, to its lack of airport shuttle, somebody in this hotel just doesnâ€™t get it. Great potential but so off the mark that itâ€™s laughable. On the other hand, I just stayed at a 3 star European Novotel in downtown Toronto, and the opposite was true. It was not all about flowery descriptions and so-called heavenly mattresses; it was about the core elements: service, value, meeting intuitive needs, and not nickle and diming the customer. I understand that a 5 star chain must charge for its service, but while someone at Westin built a 5 star facility for a 5 star hotel, whomever is managing this hotel is seriously dropping the ball. The soul of this hotel is missing. The intuitive needs of the customer have been lost in a sea of affectation and pseudo political correctness and a quasi commitment to the environment,

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: mhatahet
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful stay, clean, top service, spacious rooms, comfortable beds. Rooms are connected together through a door, which is not ideal if you have loud neighbours.
