The hotel is not in the city centre but commuting is fairly easy, 5 min walk to underground station, 2 bus stops from airport. Price quality ratio is totally acceptable

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, convenient location by subway.”
Reviews.Author: liketravel101
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed 4 nights here and were happy with everything. At first we were a bit concerned about the hotel's location as some online comments say it is a bit remote. However I find the location was not bad at all if you take the transit. It is just 2-minute walk to the Silver line station and then you can transfer to other lines which can take you anywhere in Boston. The subway system in Boston is really good. Tthe weekly pass is only $15 and can be used for subway, bus and ferry. The hotel is new and our room was spacious, very clean, and quiet. The mattress was neither too firm nor soft and my sleelp was great. The only problem we had was the 10-minute computer downtime right beifore our check-in, but this could happen to any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to anything”
Reviews.Author: muellerdm
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at night and was disappointed to find out there was no airport shuttle to the Westin. We had to take a taxi for $22. The lobby is beautiful, the staff were very friendly and the room was very nice. It is not located very close to anything so make sure you have a car or are prepared for the cost of a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more than average.”
Reviews.Author: seekingtomorrow
Reviews.Content: This is an average Westin hotel. Although calling itself a "waterfront" hotel, it's really blocks away from the waterfront. There's not a ton to do in the surrounding area, but if you don't mind walking 20 minutes you can be in the main areas of interest. Rooms are a typical westin hotel room. Nothing fancy. My view overlooked a parking lot filled with circus trailers / motor homes. It wasn't the best view. Westin beds were nice as usual. Probably the highlight of staying in a Westin! The fitness centre was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “No better place to stay if going to the convention center”
Reviews.Author: phuinha
Reviews.Content: So I spent 5 nights at this place, which is "THE" only hotel adjacent to the convention center, and we all know how convenient that can be. From the mezzanine level, walk across the skywalk and you're inside the convention center, not before stopping at the Starbucks at the Lobby level. Keep in mind that the Starbucks isn't part of the regular chain, so no benefits honored from being a member. Internet is free in the lobby and the convention center, but they do charge for access from the room. As expected, the room I was in was quiet and clean, with a 32" LCD screen. If you'd like to go to a restaurant however, then hop on a cab and for about $10 you'll be in the middle of everything. There's also a very nice gym, with modern and working equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Not much in the area but nice amenities and good service”
Reviews.Author: jbrindamour
Reviews.Content: We booked the Westin Waterfront for Boston Marathon weekend. My primary reason was it was one of the only hotels accepting Starwood Points during that period. I opted for the Cash + points option and was able to get two adjoining rooms for $60/night plus 4000 Starwood points each. I had heard that parking was $32 night ($42 for valet). I disagree with this on principle and found out about a nearby lot on Necco (Off A St.) where I could park for $11 day. I still was not crazy about this, but it was very close by. I parked at a meter on the bridge across the street on Friday night and the next morning drove over to the lot, (maybe 3/4 of a mile walk). I discovered by accident that the street bordering the lot to the South (Binford) had parking spaces with no meters and no signs. I ended up parking there for the entire trip for free as there happened to be an open space. This is not a very populated area, mostly small offices and some warehouse space. If you get there on a weekend, should be able to get a spot there. Since we were taking the T mostly, we did not need the car for transport while we were there. There is also an excellent diner just a bit further South on A street from Binford @ Second St called My Diner which has cheap delicious diner food. Perfect for carbo loading the day before the marathon and also for breakfast on our way out of town. The hotel restaurant, MJ OConnors is actually quite good. We ate there twice. For 3 adults, two teens and a ten year old it came to about $100 with tip, including two beers. Not cheap but a good option if you don't want to go out. We iordered Dominos twice via the internet from a nearby location, which was a cheap quick dinner but couldn't get the thin crust for some reason. Not sure if that was an internet glitch or a local limitation. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The heavenly bed is just that, extremely comfortable and nice to sleep on. The firdge looks like it was once used as a mini-bar in both of our rooms but neither was cold so we did not use them. Not sure if they were just unplugged or not working. The lobby is very nice with a bar and free wireless internet access. Plenty of comfy couches to sit down and hang out, plan an excursion etc. But I find it cheap and petty to charge $12.95 for wireless internet access in rooms. For a hotel where room rates are generally in the $250 range, wireless internet, which is ridiculously cheap to provide is not something a hotel like Westin should be nickel and diming people for. This is absurd and the primary reason I did not give the hotel 5 stars. I shouldn't have to pay $13 a day to occasionally check e-mail in my room. Many other chains, including quite a few more affordable ones provide free wireless in rooms. Its almost an industry standard at this point. I would think that being a gold member would at least by me that courtesy. In fact I have no idea what additional benefits I was supposed to be enjoying over regular guests, because I detected none. Checkin was fairly quick and simple and we were headed to our rooms just minutes after arriving. There is a Starbucks in the lobby if you like that. Unfortunately, being a newer area, there is not a lot in the area for restaurants and bars unless you are willing to walk at least half a mile or so. There is a bus stop across the street that is supposed to be on the silver line to the T station but we could never figure out when it came. We stood waiting one day for about half hour before moving on. There is a station a little further walk from the hotel where we were able to get the bus but its almost less hassle to just walk 3/4 of a mile down Summer st to the South Station and from there you can go pretty much anywhere. Hotel pool was very nice and a big hit with my kids. There is also a jacuzzi there for adults. No diving though, pool is fairly short and not deep, less than 5 feet I believe. Overall I would rate our stay at the hotel fairly high. Pros: spacious comfortable rooms, nice HD TV, quiet AC system and decent city view, polite service. Cons: $$$ to park on site, $13/day for in room internet, restaurant a bit pricey, not much to do in immediate area. Also walls are a bit thin. I would expect better sound dampening in a chain like the Westin. I could hear every door slam on the floor. Fortunately there were not many of them. I might be inclined to stay at the Westin more often if they would just build some of these bogus charges into the room rate and stop hacking people (especially gold members) for things like parking and internet. Why they don't just build these into the room rate I don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel,little bit away from centre”
Reviews.Author: traveller33Ireland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean but a little away from Boston city center. The T train is right beside the hotel and you can be in Copely square in 15 minutes.If you can live with this it's a great hotel. The hotel is located beside the world trade center and is more of a business hotel. It has a nice bar and a nice restaurant for breakfast. Good leasure facilities too.

Reviews.Title: “Uh-oh, this is not really a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrueCanucks
Reviews.Content: Hi. My friend and I stayed at the Westin Waterfront, Boston to attend a conference in March. At first blush, this hotel looks like a 4-5 start, just by the design and ambiance of the lobby/reception area. It's not. Let's start with the good.... We had a comfortable room with 2 queen sized beds on the 15th floor. Long, long way from the elevators. Odd design that there are not 2 banks of elevators because of this. Our room was comfortable, but somehwat old and tired looking. The drapes are increadibly drab as are the lighting fixtures. Honestly, it looked like they came out of a hotel auction or liquidation somewhere else and were brought here. Tsk. The 'heavenly bed' was indeed, heavenly. I love that about Westin Hotels. The Lobby area was comfortable and bar service there was adequate. They were run off their feet with a couple of different conferences, so sometimes it was necessary to go to the Bar directly just to get a glass of wine. However, the staff there were very friendly. The Concierge staff. For the most part these people were helpful. We wanted to take a Trolley tour of Boston. My friend had a specific company's brochure in hand (which she got from a concierge) and asked where we could catch the trolley. On a cold, cold and blowy morning, we were directed by this woman (with a Hawaiin sounding name) out onto the street infront of the hotel, to wait for it. It didn't come and didn't come and didn't come.... As the hour was nearing end, one of these trolleys appeared and instead of coming to where we were told to stand, it swung up into the curved driveway of the hotel to pick up at the lobby! Yikes! We ran for it and caught it. The Trolley driver says this is the regular pickup point. And yes, when we returned back to the hotel, this indeed was where he dropped us off. Hmmmm...... Services and amenities. Finding out about what the hotel had to offer was almost impossible. We had expected a brochure or book in the room to give us the overview. There was a standardized booklet (similar in all Westins) that served as a room service menu and very, very brief overview of the hotel services. It was more like a directory. And, the binding was broken. We searched every nook and cranny but couldn't find anything else. There was nothing big or bold to encourage us to go to any restaurants (and no mention of where these were even located in the hotel), shops or even the pool. The only reason I knew there was a pool at all is because the Westin Waterfront's website showed one! Couldn't see any signage anywhere in the hotel, and a lady on the elevator told us where it was. She said it was small and since there were alot of people in the hotel, crowded. We skipped it. My friend had breakfast once in the lobby restaurant. She found the staff incredibly pleasant, courteous and helpful. Her Eggs Benedict "were perfect". We checked out the Room Service menu. Wow, the prices were really, really over-inflated. Take a look at the fine print for tip included, room service tax and everything else on top of the bad prices. Housekeeping: now this is an issue. While our rooms were tidied every day (we were there for 3), there was no real evidence of cleaning. A reviewer of this hotel commented that he had all of the amenties such as mouthwash and shampoo restocked daily. We did not. WE didn't even see a little mouthwash bottle. We had 1 bottle of shampoo and 1 of conditioner for our entire visit. I wonder what else there is supposed to be? (Remember, I've stayed in other Westins and I did expect more of many things besides this than I found at this hotel) . I did find the housekeeping staff in the hall one morning and asked if I could have a couple of packets of decaffinated tea put in the room. She said the Westin doesn't have decaff tea. I pointed out there was 1 pack in the room right at that moment and she said 'oh', shed' look into it. She did not. No other packets appeared. I am attaching some photos of our sidetable between the beds and the bathroom floor under the sink. Never cleaned. Notice the thick dust on the bedside table and desk. Notice the abundance of hair under the sink. I called around 3:30 on our second day to get this remedied and specifically asked that someone sweep the bathroom floor. When we returned 4 hours later, dusting in the bedroom area had been done. The bathroom floor had not been swept. I called again at 7:30 pm and was told 'we'll have someone from housekeeping right up." We went to bed around 10 and no one had shown up! (please see attached). The lack of service was significant and by the 3rd day, we stopped leaving a tip! A reviewer in January 2010 noted that the hotel had a free shuttle downtown and back. Never heard of it. Never saw it. We did catch a shuttle once, along with some other hotel guests. A large crowd of guests was standing outside the lobby, in line for taxis when a shuttle driver came and asked us if we'd like a lift into town. About 7 of us took him up on it. $5.00 per person. No mention of his being part of the hotel No uniform, either. Hmmm..... Location: good. EAsy access to the heart of Boston. Not much around the area of the hotel, though. There's a lot of development going on nearby, so this may change. We wanted to do a lot of sightseeing between conference sessions and had expected a number of sightseeing books/guides to be in our hotel room. No such thing. We had to go to the lobby to find this. I wonder why? Other hotels, including other Westins have these 'What to do in this city'-type books in their rooms. Why not this one? Just a last comment: I tried to call this hotel to inform them of a late arrival. This was the most frustrating process! I called the 1-800 number and got reservations for ALL WEstin hotels. Then they put me through to another number of the same type. It was like pulling teeth to get anyone to give me a direct number for the Westin Waterfront in Boston. I even tried their listed numbers on the internet. Somehow someone would answer and switch me to the 'main' Westin numbers. UGH! I hope Westin Waterfront can fix this hassle. All in all, great bed, lovely lobby , but not a 4 star hotel, especially because of the lack of good houskeeping service and lack of information about the hotel, itself for new guests.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: sandbari
Reviews.Content: I expected much more. The edges & corners weren't clean. The "heavenly bed" was anything but--after hours of tossing & turning on a lumpy, smothering mattress, I headed for the front desk at 3am to request a rollaway. I slept better on that. The 3-way lamps had 1-way bulbs. The light on the makeup mirror didn't work. The towels had frayed edges. The low-flow toilet doesn't have enough water to cover anything solid--it's like using an outhouse. The room was small with drab decor. Maybe I was spoiled by staying at the fabulous Four Seasons the previous 3 nights, but the difference in room rates was only $12! Spend your money there if you're not trapped at the Westin by a convention.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: toddling40
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 6-night stay at the Westin Boston Waterfront for work--a training session and conference combined. Honestly, I have to say that my experience was first-rate. I'm kind of hard to please at times, but this place excels. Location: The thing is, I understand what some other reviewers have said--in spite of the somewhat condescending management reponses here on Tripadvisor that this is an up-and-coming area, there's not a lot in the immediate vicinity. BUT...Boston's transit is the easiest I've encountered in quite some time. The Silver Line bus from the airport got me to the hotel within scant minutes of exiting the airport. The station is a mere 500 feet from the hotel's doorstep. Then, throughout the week, I was a very short ride to the South Station and a couple of transfers to anywhere in Boston that I wanted to go. This city is so compact that there's nowhere you can't get in very short order. The room/housekeeping: Perfectly arranged and very well-kept. The Heavenly Bed, as usual, lived up to its name. I did have a corner room at the quietest end of the hallway (Room 1264), and perhaps that does help with noise. Environmental controls worked well. Housekeeping was flawless every single day of my stay; everything was replenished as it should have been, and a few toiletries even extra--I loved that there was mouthwash, for instance. Many hotels don't do that anymore. Also, the Africa Kitamu Starbucks coffee was great. The facilities: Like many large convention facilities, there is nickel-and-diming if you allow it. In-room Internet is $12.95. BUT--there is free WiFi in the lobby, and it works great. Also, there is a real--not hotel franchised--Starbucks in the lobby with non-gouge pricing. :) I have a weakness for the lemon pound cake, and it was just $1.85. The restaurants are pricey as well, and room service is crazy outrageous even for a hotel of this caliber, but using the aforementioned transportation, I was able to eat well in town for a lot less. If you haven't tried it, go to the food court at Quincy Market/Fanueil Hall. Great choices at great prices! Also, there is a Domino's location close by that delivers to the hotel. I took advantage of that one evening as well. The lobby itself is very pleasant, and there are lots of seating areas for conversation/meeting. The Mezzanine has great long divans with outlets next to them for utilizing that aforementioned free wifi. All in all, I have absolutely nothing to complain about. It was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing ...”
Reviews.Author: FrankD750
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Westin Boston Waterfront for New Years Eve, Hotel is beautiful, and so it the Lobby. Room was good. Well laid out, good bed, roomy bathroom. However, Ice machine in the hallway and, to be expected, it had no ice as it was New Yearâ€™s eve, and every one is draining the machine dry. Went to top floor to use the ice machine there â€“ another 9 floors up. And it went downhill from thereâ€¦. We were walking back to the Hotel after doing Boston First Night. It had been a long night, and we were very much looking forward to a draft beer and something to eat in the bar. Along comes 2 police cars with sirens blaring pulling into the hotel. Then come 2 more police cars. We get to the hotel and try to get into the bar. We find the outside entrance closed. OK, so we go into the lobby and try to get into the bar through the lobby entrance. The hostess says the bar was closed for a private party. Plus she says that they closed at 11 pm anyway. Let me get this straight: There are no bars anywhere around the hotel to be seen. You have a hotel FULL of people (not to mention 2 in-house weddings that night too). Itâ€™s New Yearâ€™s Eve, AND YOU CLOSE YOUR HOTEL BAR/RESTAURANT FOR A PRIVATE PARTY ?!?!?!? ARE YOU KIDDING ME ?!?!?! And to top it off, the private party is the reason for the police. An altercation broke out among a few of the private party members, serious enough to require 4 cruisers. There is another tiny bar in the lobby, but all it has is a tiny counter that can only fit about 10-15 people. Itâ€™s full. Alright, guess itâ€™s room service or nothing. We go back to the room, and there is no room service menu. We call, they say itâ€™s at the back of a booklet on the credenza. We have the booklet, but the menu is missing. They say theyâ€™ll send one up. Figuring this is gonna be a while, I try going down to front desk to get one. After searching, the desk person says he canâ€™t find one. Back to the room and we call room service again. Weâ€™re 5th in line for a person to come up to the room to deliver the menu! Finally, I had her read the menu over the phone and I placed an order, and mention to them all thatâ€™s happened and how long weâ€™ve been waiting. TO THEIR CREDIT, order arrived very quickly. And then there is the $42 parking !! In all fairness, this is one bad experience. Iâ€™m sure other peopleâ€™s experience vary (but if youâ€™re in the hotel on any New Yearâ€™s eve, donâ€™t plan on partying at the bar !!) All this does not leave me with a good memory of the place, so I highly doubt Iâ€™ll book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but watch for extra charges”
Reviews.Author: xaturnascends
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Boston Waterfront from Dec 31 - Jan 3rd. The Hotel is beautiful. The lobby is very clean and modern and decorated beautifully. There is a bar in the lobby, along with the entrance to two of the hotel's restaurants: O'Connor's (with was GREAT) and another open only for breakfast, which we did not try. The front desk service was very good and the concierge was exceptional. He got us reservations for two very nice restaurants with very little notice, and got us great tables as well! The rooms are nicely furnished, and the beds very comfortable. However, we had a king bed in our room, and there was another smaller bed (almost a cot) in our room that did nothing but take up space. The workout room and pool were wonderful... The hotel provides a free shuttle into center city near most of the restaurants and shopping, which was convenient, and there are always taxi's waiting outside as well.. The hotel is not that far from center city, and it was not a big deal for us. The only complaint that I have, was the parking. There is an underground lot that you can park in, however, the gate never worked and was a pain to get in an out. On busy weekends, we were there over New Years (aka "First Night" in Boston), and it was full. They also charge $32 per night for parking, which is outrageous in my opinion if you are paying good money for the hotel. Drinks out of the minifridge is expected to be expensive, but they charge the same price at the bar downstairs which was a turnoff as well. The walls are also thin and you can here everything going on in the hallways and adjacent rooms. Wireless is available, but like everything else, an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, good South Boston location”
Reviews.Author: HHdreamin
Reviews.Content: I actually had business to do in the financial district, and this was a better value with just a bit of a walk [if you'd like]. The front desk staff was excellent in assisting me with the check in process...particularly since I had just had an AWFUL cab experience from Logan to this location. Side note...avoid Metrocab like the plague, the cab drivers are thugs! They got me checked in immediately and gave me follow-up information on how to report this cabbie with the police...a very nice attribute since I didn't even ask. I had a great view of the city for the one night I was there. As well, the bartender at the Birch Bar located in the lobby area was exceptional as well. I would stay here again for work, due to the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but Huh? What is there to do in this area?”
Reviews.Author: ZP83
Reviews.Content: After leaving the Sheraton downtown in Boston, this seemed like a nice quiet place to stay and I heard they built it for the convention center that was new at the time. The staff could not have been any nicer and gave me a great view over looking the waterfront. The only really good places to eat were in China town which was not to far away. I really enjoyed this hotel because it felt much more welcoming than the sheraton downtown and was much more updated. There is not much to do in the area unless you are in a convention then I guess there is lots to do. I would give this hotel a good gating for its service and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “No Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Another_Actuary
Reviews.Content: Well, I seem to have been on the same conference as the prior poster, and I too found the hotel to be seriously disappointing. Unlike the prior poster, the decor and the TV were fine. Perhaps because I happened to get a room on one of the higher floor, not sure. But the service was far from high end. - At check-in I was asked if I wanted a newspaper (yes), and if I had a car to park (no). Never got a paper until the final day. It wasn't worth complaining about, but it was annoying. But I did get charged for 3 days of parking, which had to be corrected. - And my company wanted to pre-pay the bill. When I got there, I found out it hadn't happened. I contacted our travel coordinator to sort it out. She contacted the hotel. They said we had the wrong form, and they would send the right form that day. End of day, no form. She had to call and hassle them again the next day to get the right form. It didn't get fixed until just before I checked out. - I would try to contact "Service Express" at night to get a wakeup call. It usually took several attempts to get someone to answer the phone. - We had a free afternoon at the conference. The hotel is not particularly convenient to downtown, but touted a shuttle service into the city. Nice, I thought I'd take advantage of it. When I looked into it though, it only ran prior to 9:30 AM or after 5 PM. Not exactly convenient. - The conference I attended had mulitple breakout sessions, and the rooms assigned were consistently too small, with people standing in the back to hear. I can see this happening occasionally for a very popular session, but at this conference, it was the rule rather than the exception - $13 dollar a day for internet in a room costing well over $200 is pretty steep. And my husband and I each had a laptop with us. That was $13 EACH. - I also expected more dining options in a hotel this large, and somewhat off the beaten path. The restaurant open at night was fine, but that was the only choice unless you wanted bar food or Starbucks. I expected better. No, I can't recommend it, and it won't be my choice for my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “What a fiasco!! It's a them versus us mentality ~”
Reviews.Author: echolakeNH
Reviews.Content: No interest in guest service here (all around)... We were greatly disappointed . We should have just stayed home!! We set out to have a relaxing family getaway in the (nearby) city.....what we got were long delays at check in, housekeeping knocking on the door at 7:45am despite a "Do not disturb sign", substandard room service (forgetting an entree and then not delivering it), being kicked out of the hotel at noon despite having been *guaranteed* a 4pm check out by Starwood Preferred Guest upon reserving. I explained to management that we booked two rooms for a family getaway. We arrived at 8pm planning to stay until 4pm. Had we know we were going to be kicked out 16 hours later we would have stayed at another downtown Starwood hotel. I am in the hospitality business on a small scale. I own two vacation homes in the White Mountains of NH. I would *never promise a guest a late check out and then not allow them to stay until their promised departure time. SPG made the reservation and placed me on hold while they called the hotel to extend my departure time. I was told that I would receive a 4pm guaranteed departure . Because the email confirmation had no mention of a late check out (unlike my own business reservations) I decided to reconfirm with the front desk. I was *shocked to find out that they were booked to capacity and that we had to be out in 25 minutes!! The children had to quickly get out of the pool, throw everything into suitcases and leave! I have never in 10 years had a problem with SPG. I believe that the problem was with the poor communication on the hotel's end. I recommend that you stay elsewhere. The hotel is not well run whatsoever and we didn't feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “If it is at all possible, stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: ActuaryCincinnati
Reviews.Content: I was sent to this "hotel" for four days for a professional convention. Given that the price was over $200 for even the most basic rooms, I was expecting something that would make me feel like the hotel was special. Unfortuantely, it was far from it. The basic rooms are just that: basic. One large area with a king and a bathroom. No side office. The furniture and decor are very dated. The size of the televisions in the rooms would be laughable if I weren't subject to it for 4 nights. The most major reason to avoid this hotel, however, is the service. After requesting a refrigerator be brought to my room (something the amenities guide says can be provided free of charge) I was told it would be up shortly. Fast-forward six hours and finally, by the third request and statement that I had items that would spoil if it were not provided the refrigerator was brought up. An isolated incident perhaps, I thought. That is, until I spoke with my colleagues for whom three phone calls were required to obtain their room service. The lousy service permeates the entire hotel. Waiting in line for the front desk, when my turn was up and another gentleman came from nowhere and jumped in front of everybody, the service desk noticed, but did nothing and proceeded to help him. Another nuisance is the outdatedness of charging for in-room internet ($12.95 per day). If you can plan a convention somewhere else, save yourself by doing so, you'd probably do just as well with a cheap motel.

Reviews.Title: “Westin comfort and convenient to Logan & public transport”
Reviews.Author: NorskeDecaturIL_USA_
Reviews.Content: Just finishing a two-night stay after attending a conference at the hotel. Conference rate was $229 for a very comfortable room. Had breakfast and lunch at the conference - food was good, prepared by the hotel. All of the staff was very friendly. I guess the only complaint I have is the the Internet access in the rooms is almost $13 per day. Sure, they have free wireless in the lobby and in the business center, but c'mon.... I like the Holiday Inn Express model where it's included in the (much more reasonable) room rate. Westin's certainly not the Lone Ranger is this regard. The bed is "heavenly" as is the dual-head shower. Nothing like a good night's sleep. I took a taxi from Logan ($22) - and when I took a walk found that the World Trade Center station on the Silver Line is a about a two-block walk from the Westin. For a $2.00 one-way fare you can go anywhere on the system, including to/from Logan. So when I depart today, I saved my company some money. There are several Silver Line buses - and those labeled "SL1" will take you to Logan for that same $2 fare. Provided it's not raining (or snowing) - it's a cost effective way to go. Normally I'm doing business in Cambridge (about a $30-$35 ride), and I can get there too for the same $2 fare. So the hot tip is to pick a hotel that's reasonably close to the MBTA. Last night I walked beyond the WTC station and down along the waterfront to the Yankee Lobster restaurant. I posted a review of it - check it out - it's a fun and affordable place to get good seafood. Along the way I passed Morton's Steakhouse, LTK (might be Legal Test Kitchen - for Legal Seafood), and a couple of other spots. There's also a 7-Eleven near the Seaport WTC (just beyond the station at ground level) where you can pick up reasonably priced drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - remote location”
Reviews.Author: cardtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, luxurious hotel, but unfortunately is not within convenient walking distance to stores, dining, T line, etc. For me, the best part was the easy access to the Convention Center. If you are not attending a Convention, there are much nicer places to stay where you can experience the great city of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel but Lousy Location”
Reviews.Author: amyd20
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel when I moved him in for his senior year at Emerson College. The room was attractive, comfortable, and clean. The only meal we ate there was breakfast and it was standard fare. The only 'down' side to our stay was the location. It is not within walking distance to anything. I used my Starwood points so I didn't have to pay for the room, other wise I probably wouldn't have stayed here because of the location. By the time you pay for a taxi you might as well stay downtown or in the Financial District.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views!”
Reviews.Author: reggie218
Reviews.Content: I used my Starwood Points to stay at this hotel for a 1-night stay in Boston. I was put in the 16th (top-most) floor and had sweeping views of the Boston skyline and the waterfront! The room was very spacious, even with the king size bed in there. I had friends staying at other hotels in Boston and they were tiny. This hotel is located very close to the airport and is about a $10 cab ride to Copley Place, where everything seemed to be located. I could have used the T but I given the limited time I had in town, I didn't want to walk to the T stop, wait for it, etc. There was always a taxi waiting outside and much for convenient for me. If you are going to the Convention Center, this is the place to stay, its literally right next door. If you want to do some sightseeing, I'd recommend staying in the Copley Place area. For the amount and the view I got, it was definitely worth it for me. Oh, and I was able to get late check-out, even if it was just an hour later!

Reviews.Title: “great beds”
Reviews.Author: arisaig
Reviews.Content: Very nice room with fabulous beds. Extremely comfortable and wonderful views of the city, airport and waterfront. Would definitely stay here again for the right price. Not too bad a walk to downtown and T only across the road

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: bullardsc
Reviews.Content: I was a little dissappointed for a Westin it is no different than a Holiday Inn. Great location for the cruise docks and the employees were all very helpful with site seeing and other questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location ok”
Reviews.Author: Travelbeanie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with friends at the end of September and overall we were very impressed with the facilities. We managed to get a deal on Expedia so we paid around Â£38 a night each (3 in a room) for which we got two large double beds and very large, clean room with modern bathroom. There is also a pool, jacuzzi and gym at the hotel along with a shop and couple of bar/restaurants. The only downside that the hotel isn't in the most central tourist area, it's around a 10-15 minute walk from South Station and approx 20-25 minute walk to Boston Common.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel despite the location”
Reviews.Author: JosieLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of September, after getting a good deal on Expedia. Hotel was a short journey via the silver line bus and a short walk. Room was very big with a great view of Boston. Very comfy beds and great bathroom with great showers. Food near the hotel was limited. The Irish bar connected to the hotel did not offer much variety and was expensive. There was a medium sized pool and a small jacuzzi which was perfect for the end of a day of sightseeing. Only down side was the distant to town. It was easily walkable (which we did in the daytime), or you can get a taxi into the centre for about $5-$8. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you can get a good price - you won't find anything cheaper with a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location for Both Airport and Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: CheshireBabe
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel if visiting Boston. It is possible to walk the 1.5 miles into Boston. Alternatively, use the Silver Line ,just five minutes walk away, in order to get both to and from the airport and downtown Boston, just $2.00 per person per trip, very frequent service. Lounge is spacious although food options are limited close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for famalies!”
Reviews.Author: superfunmom
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was absolutly wonderful and it made for a comfortable and relaxing trip for our extended family. Upon arrival, the brought out toys for the children and actually put us in adjoining rooms without us having to ask! Rooms were large, bathrooms pristine. The only possible downside was the location and the fact that you had to pay to park at the hotel. We were not in the heart of downtown Boston and had to drive to get there, but the quality of the hotel more than made up for this in my opnion.

Reviews.Title: “typical westin - clean, overpriced internet, ok location, good breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: dss321
Reviews.Content: Location: It only takes like five minutes to get to the hotel from the airport, but be prepared to pay $20 or more for it. We were able to walk to Faneuil Hall area, the aquarium, and Quincy market area in about 30 minutes. The Old Towne Trolley also picks up right out front of the Westin, which was pretty convenient on the days we paid for it. In short, on the outskirts of the fun stuff, but pretty easy to get to it. Price: Like all Westins, everything on the inside is expensive. The internet was way overpriced, and after I paid for it, I realized I could get the Lobby wireless in my room on the 6th floor. The price of the room wasn't too terrible. Room: The room was very comfortable, clean and nice. Food: The breakfast buffet at Saucity downstairs was great. The pub was good too. Both were pretty overpriced. The buffet at breakfast was definitely the best value because it comes with coffee and juice, which are $4 and $6 respectively on their own, and the buffet was $16.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Parking Fees”
Reviews.Author: ladyj640
Reviews.Content: We booked the Westin on line and got a decent rate. Although it was not directly in downtown Boston its proximity was close enough and there were sight seeing buses that stopped right outside the hotel. The hotel was very nice. The restaurant was a bit pricey and the food a bit bland. The gym and pool area were clean and updated. However the parking was a total rip off. The valet sign out front stated overnight guests $42.00. It didn't state per night and maybe I am not a versed enough traveller, but I didn't realize it was $42.00 per day!! When I tried to speak with the parking attendant she blew me off, as did her manager and the head of the parking company. The parking company is separate from the Westin so I don't want this review to actually go against the hotel I just want future travelers to be aware of this pitfall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: roadtrip21
Reviews.Content: Check-in was easy. We had a great waiter at the restaurant attached to the hotel. Very clean room. It was a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Zrubavel
Reviews.Content: The westin waterfront is not really waterfront, although you can reach the water by a 5-10 minute walk. Since i am used to walk everywhere, it took be about 20-30 minutes to walk to boston downtown - a bit out of the way. Besides this, a wonderful hotel, with a nice lobby, a good bar and a starbucks cafe right in the lobby, very convienient. The room itself has everything needed is very clean and comfy. All in all - very recommended, especially if you are on a convention nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but not the best location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: beantown_illini
Reviews.Content: Having recently lived in Boston, I knew exactly where this hotel was when I booked it. It probably isnâ€™t the most ideal location for tourists, as it isnâ€™t right in the heart of the city. I didnâ€™t have any desire to be in the thick of things, though, so the location was perfect. The hotel is just what youâ€™d expect from a Westin â€“ good quality, comfy bed, great shower. We had a room on the 14th floor with a nice view of the Boston skyline and waterfront. The only issue with the room was that the shower took FOREVER to drain. There isnâ€™t much to do right by the hotel. The ICA and waterfront are a short walk away, but the hotel itself is not directly on the waterfront. There are also some restaurants relatively close by in the Fort Point area, but again, nothing literally across the street. The hotel itself has a few restaurants, though. I would stay here again, but probably wouldnâ€™t recommend it as a base for someone looking to sight-see.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Hotel Only -- Not Near Watefront”
Reviews.Author: NYTrip46
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly serviceable Westin located adjacent to the Convention Center in South Boston. If you are coming for a convention at the center it is the perfect hotel because it is connected to the convention center. On the other hand, if you are coming to Boston for any other reason, such as for a tourist visit, why would you stay at a hotel on the outskirts of Boston that is not near anything. Clearly, the "waterfront" name was intended to fool people. This hotel is no where near the waterfront. Other than the convention center there is very little around -- just look at a map.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: WharfTrader
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Waterfront?! No where near town centre, so as others said if not a conference there beware of trip back into the city. Check-in fine, room pretty standard Westin. Overall no complaints, good standard business hotel. But would not be rushing back

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an OK location”
Reviews.Author: zinc8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. The lobby is stunning and the room was fantastic. Staff was attentive and polite, however, we arrived at the right time. Check-in was a breeze, but 30 minutes later there was long line to check-in. As other reviewers have mentioned, there's nothing in the immediate area, so you'll need a car or need to take taxis to get dinner or entertainment. The major negative was $32 per day for parking. There is nothing around here, no reason parking needs to be so expensive...

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this Westin”
Reviews.Author: Bee001
Reviews.Content: We had one night in Boston on Labor Day Weekend, and were without a car. We had no idea that this Westin had no restaurant! If we had known we'd have stayed in another Westin and I recommend you think about this. The hotel is in an out ot the way location, too far for tired travelers to wander around looking for a restaurant. We ended up with room service, which was exorbitant. I like Westins, but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: BoomerTravel
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Westin hotel attending a business conference being held there. The hotel appears to be very new and the lobby is modern with lots of seats and open space. Check in was very easy and the staff very friendly. They have alot of doorman and staff about the hotel. Many elevators which were quick to be there when needed. The room was very clean and large. New furniture. Large flat screen tv and one of the best king beds I ever slept in. The linen count was high with many many pillows. Bathroom was large with alot of light and a good sized tub and shower. They had expensive shower heads with alot of settings. Bath products were excellent and more than enough plush towels. Room was very quiet and had a nice view of the harbor in the distance. Location is about a 20 minute walk to quincy market. Nothing is next door so you either eat there or walk or cab it to downtown boston. They do have a shuttle service. Ate at the irish restaurant at the hotel and the food and service was great. More food than I could finish. Room service breakfast was exactly on time. Full breakfast. The amount of food was amazing. Everything was so good, coffee eggs, hash browns, etc.. Cab ride to Fenway to see the sox cost twenty. Cab to the airport was ten. If you want a great, comfortable, clean upscale hotel near downtown and the airport this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Hold on to your credit card”
Reviews.Author: needcomfort
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the standard Westin format but if you are not attending an event at the convention center this is the wrong place to stay. It's isolated and there is no waterfront. But that's not the worst of it. I've never had such a bad experience and I travel a great deal. We are owners in the timeshare program that includes the Westin therefore we get discounts on our stays. However, after checking in we learned that the front desk had charged our cards $1900 each for what was suppose to be a three day stay at less than $100 per night with our timeshare membership. When we brought it to the managers attention he said it was in error and would correct the problem. After waiting six hours for a call back we learned he had not taken care of the problem and lied about having made an effort to reverse the charges. The family was charged almost $8,000 and even the general manager seemed to be dismissive. The service went down hill from there. It tooks us almost 24 hours before we could get a straight answer. I will never stay there again and suggest you hold on to your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Westin”
Reviews.Author: terithecook
Reviews.Content: We had booked at the last minute (pending storm changed our plans on the Cape) and got a great price on Expedia. Wonderful room, service was exceptional but no real view of the water (I'm guessing the Expedia price). The staff was extremely friendly, told us where to go and the quickest way to get there. We're used to walking so we stayed away from public transportation - the last day we were there we broke down and took a cab back because it was toooooooo hot! Valet pricing is pricey - $42 a day. Recommend the Birch Bar - great music, quiet and good food. Also, we had one wonderful dinner at Sorellina - it's across from the Westin Copley Place and it was AMAZING. The service was impeccable and we're still sighing remembering how delicious the food was.

Reviews.Title: “hotel name is misleading”
Reviews.Author: shibibi
Reviews.Content: This hotel, despite it's name is anything but on the waterfront. In fact, I doubt that you could see the waterfront from any room in the hotel. My wife and I chose this hotel due to its proximity to the convention center as she was presenting at a recent medical conference. We paid much more that colleagues who stayed in another Westin hotel in a much more desireable and attractive (and probably safer) part of Boston. The name was an important factor in our decision to stay here. We thought we"d be able to take walks on the waterfront which we assumed would be adjacent to the hotel> I guess we should have investigated further. The hotel itself is pretty much what you'd expect of a Westin hotel anywhere. Nice rooms, good restaurants and pleasant staff. Mark, the concierge was the hi-light of the trip for us. He was a wealth of information and directed us to some great restaurants and was able to obtain Red Sox tickets for me when I was unable to do the same myself. I was surprised to see several dogs in the hotel. Pets of guests I guess. That probably explains the heater/fan on the floor of our room when we checked in. Bad idea! Leave your damn dog at home. Most hotels now provide free wireless internet service except those that want to gouge you for a little more money and this hotel was one of the latter. $24.00 per day! Ouch. Also, don't even touch that phone! I consider myself middle class but couldn't afford to make even a local call! I brought the list of charges home to show to my friends. The charges were that outrageous. I'm not so resentful of my Blackberry charges now. Finally, while eating breakfast in the hotel restaurant, I noticed a staff member setting tables. He was placing cutlery on tables and holding the utensils by the fork tines and knife blades. Those parts go in your mouth. He was placing coffee cups by gripping them so that his thumb was inside each cup. Charming.

Reviews.Title: “For Attending Convention Center Events ONLY.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravels2000
Reviews.Content: I went with my family to boston for this whale watching tour (the tour was HORRIBLE due to the 6ft choppy waves and 3/4 of the ship DEMANDED to cancel the trip and go back to port but BHC decided to stay out in the open waters. it was so bad that i was willing to cancel the trip without a refund! i also had to cancel the rest of my day's plans. NEVER use BHC) anyways. the hotel was amazing. the hotel was modern yet with a city type feel. (something to look out for when you are checking in, is the name tags. not very important but its a nice touch to add a little "my passion" line (like "My Passion is Family or Fun") on the 16th floor, you can see the boston harbor and the incoming flights of Boston-Logan Intl Airport. the hotel, however is placed in south Boston, a place that seems uninhabited on the week ends. it is near nothing but the convention center and a lot of workplaces. westin has a complimentary shuttle to Quincy Marketplace and south station. the Westin Wakecup coffee machine delivers delicious and quick cups of coffee. does anyone know where i could get that coffee machine somewhere?

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelfreek
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Westin Waterfront because we were attending a concert at the nearby BofA Pavillion. The hotel was easy (and cheap) to get to as the Boston Transit system has a stop nearby with service direct to/from the airport ($2.00 one way). The rooms are spacious and very clean. The beds were comfortable and the large number of pillow were welcome. I wish the bathroom had a makeup mirror- I wear glasses and can't see very well in the large (and far from me) one over the bathroom counter. I con't say the resturant was very good, though. Saucitiy was closed , so we ate at the Irish Pub. Limited choices and expensive. The staff was helpful overall.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if you bring a pet”
Reviews.Author: kostman
Reviews.Content: They pulled a bait and switch on us. I made reservation, told agent we had small dog, they said fine as long as under 75 pounds. At hotel, they then whip out a pet contract that includes the agreement we would remain with dog at all times, not to be left in room alone. We had plans to sightsee, etc. I told them that this contract was not listed on the hotels website, nor was any of this told to me when I booked. If it was, I never would have booked this hotel,l asked them to find me another hotel , the city was booked up. We had to go back to our room to spend night with pet, and checked out the next morning and drove home..5 hours with very upset and disappointed wife and children.We were to spend 2 nights and had alot of plans to tour the city . This was a HUMILIATING experience, particularly since we did nothing wrong. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, this is how they treat their paying guests ??? Beware of this place

Reviews.Title: “None of the charm of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Daschy
Reviews.Content: First let me say I had no problem with our room, our maid or bell service. Our room was comfortable, clean and enjoyable. When you arrived or left the service was very good. It was all lovely EXCEPT it had none of the charm of Boston. Even though it was convenient to the convention center which is why we were in Boston that is the only thing it is convenient to. The hotel will tell you there are restaurants nearby and they are some but there is very little foot traffic around the hotel especially at night. You are pretty much at the mercy of the hotel including $15 martinis in the lobby bar. The business center wanted $85 to Fed Ex a small package (that I walked to the post office and sent for $5). I expect to pay a premium for services in a business hotel but I felt gouged for these services. Think of a boring city and this hotel could be at their airport. Stay in central Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Wireless Internet”
Reviews.Author: hans617
Reviews.Content: Wireless internet doesn't work. When I called down, they transfer you to an offsite wireless provider. The wireless provider indicated that the wireless access point was not strong enough, and could not support the number of connections.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: serena7
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was very nice and the location was convenient- close to the convention center and T stop. The service and lack of attention to detail did not live up to usual Westin standards. The room was a what you would normally find in a Westin with a nice comfortable king sized bed and flat screen TV, however the carpet was an ugly brown color, presumably to hide stains, and the bathroom had a speckled flooring that looked dirty ( I am not sure how clean it actually was). The bathroom had only one bar of soap and one of the towels had a yellow stain. I saw Housekeeping out in the hallway with the linen cart and asked for an extra towel or two but was greeted somewhat coldly and told they would be brought to me later (they were on the dresser when I returned after dinner). I requested a refrigerator when I booked and checked in but needed to call 3 times before it was finally brought up- it did not smell good nor did it keep very cold. I did not get a newspaper on the morning of check-out- was this on purpose? I saw other doorways with an express checkout envelope and no paper- if so, it is a petty way to save money. On a positive note, the fitness center was roomy and well-equipped, with plenty of towels. I did not use the pool but it seemed nice and was full of vacationing families. Overnight parking for hotel guests was $32.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: jrich00
Reviews.Content: There was a little problem at check-in, as Expedia had not forwarded to reservation to Westin, however the issue was cleared up in 15 minutes. I loved the fact that I was able to check in early. The room was spacious, modern, clean, and had a great view. The only real problem I had was the cost of room service and the cost of the internet service. The hotel is .7 miles from the closest metro stop and to the greyhound bus station, but it is away from the hustle and bustle of downtown. I loved the city of Boston and it has so much history. I would definitely return to Boston and would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to get a night's sleep don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Bevsept
Reviews.Content: Just home after spending two nights in this hotel. We are sleep deprived after listening to metal doors on the bedrooms banging all night long as guests came and went from their rooms. You would get more sleep in a cow barn. The door closers on the bedrooms operate solely on a SLAM basis. In a four star hotel you expect doors to close reasonably noiselessly, not to wake you each time a person enters or exits. The noise is exacerbated by the fact that the doors appear to be of a metal construction. If you want sleep and some rest for relaxation or business do not book here. Doors banging all night long up and down the corridors only ruin your day due to tiredness. We did speak to a manager before leaving the hotel to voice our criticism.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and conference areas but sub par service”
Reviews.Author: WVTraveler12
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Boston Westin Waterfront for a national conference. The hotel itself, the accommodations, and conference rooms were all excellent. It is conveniently located next to the Convenion Center and very close to the T (public transportation). However, the service left something to be desired. One day during my stay, I returned after a full day away from my room to find that housekeeping had left the door to my room ajar. Absolutely unacceptable. After my trip, I found a charge to my credit card that did not appear on my final hotel folio. The charge was equivalent to an entire night's lodging. Upon calling the accounting department, I was told that it was a 'no-show charge' for a night that was not even within the dates of my reserved stay. After speaking with the representative, I asked to speak with a manager. The representative curtly stated "but I told you I would take care of it" and gave me a few other reasons why it would not help for me to speak with a manager. After some resistance, I was transferred to the manager's voicemail. The charge is hopefully reconciled, but it simply should not have happened in the first place. I am still awaiting a return phone call from the hotel manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Visit”
Reviews.Author: vtbiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to visit Cirque de Soliel. Location was wonderful for the two of us who enjoy walking to attractions. Hotel and room were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: GrammyBecky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin from July 6-13, 2009. I combined business and pleasure. I really thought the facility was beautiful and the front desk staff very helpful and friendly. The concierge had a bit of a chip on her shoulder attitude which I didn't appreciate so stopped using her after the first day. The restaurant staff was always very helpful. I thought the pub had very well priced food and drinks. However, Saucity was overpriced and the food was less than average. I suggest Starbucks for breakfast instead of Saucity. Get oatmeal or a breakfast coffee cake with a coffee, better food - lots cheaper. Go to the pub for any eating after 4pm. My biggest complaint was since this hotel is supposed to be a superior rated hotel, why is it every time I pulled up in a cab, the doorman didn't get the cab door, didn't ask if I wanted help with luggage and let me struggle with my luggage into the hotel. They also didn't ask at the front desk if I wanted assistance with my luggage. I thought this all very odd since I'm used to overkill if anything and no one at the Westin seemed to care if they got a tip. I always had to ask them to call a cab. They didn't approach and ask if I needed a cab, I had to ALWAYS go find someone to assist. The front door service needs MAJOR, MAJOR coaching. On the positive side, I loved the hotel furnishings, the cleanliness, the White Tea smell in the building and the facilities in general. I found the location to be fine and transportation was easy into downtown. I would recommend the hotel but I hope they know to improve their rating that they need to coach staff better at the front door and get rid of Saucity.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vvljava
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I got a great Internet rate for our family of four. We were in town as tourists. The hotel is beautiful and the room was spotless. The lobby has a Starbucks and a couple of restaurants. There is parking next door in the parking garage which requires your room key to enter and exit. It's located next to the convention center so my only complaint was that we weren't winthin walking distance of any of the major tourist attractions such as Faneuil Hall, the Freedom Trail, as well as shopping and restaurants. There were plenty of cabs ready to take us to where we wanted to go but plan on paying around $10 to get you to Faneuil Market.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business trip at Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: danielleflorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business trip at the adjacent Convention Center - perfect location for that which made it very easy to go back and forth all day long. Nice decor - seems like a pretty new hotel, very clean. Room was decorated in "minimalistic" tones - ala a "W" style. Liked the convienance of a Starbucks right in Lobby VERY close to Logan Airport Spacious, open lobby - easy for improptu meetings/drinks Ate lunch at Irish Pub restaurant - was ok, a little slow but it was crowded from conference breaking for lunch. Yes, its not in the heart of the city as others have mentioned - but if you are on a business trip or need to attend convention center - its great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if attending event a BCEC”
Reviews.Author: rona118
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property while attending a tradeshow at BCEC. Perfect location for this. Not so great spot if you want to see the main tourist spots of Boston. Nothing was in walking distance in my opinion. I ate that the Irish restaurant at the hotel a couple nights just for the convenience factor. It was fine, but like many hotel restaurants--over priced. ***Watch your credit card statement after your stay**** I had a $6 charge for a bottle of water in the room that I did not use. Some of my co-workers that stayed at the hotel also had a $9 charge separate from their hotel stay charged to their card!! Not cool.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement/Not Gay Friendly”
Reviews.Author: pavlosaohna
Reviews.Content: I went with some friends and my partner to Boston in March of 2008 for St Patrick's Day. We stayed at the Westin Waterfront. The first thing we noticed was that it was not in very good range of "T" station, as we were coming from the airport. It was, however close to a shuttle that takes you to the station. The hotel was amazing. It was very beautiftul and modern-as if you just stepped into a big Ikea. The rooms were very nice; perfect for out get together for the weekend. The overall experience was great until my last day. I found out a family member of mine had past while I was away. I was in the lobby area, and decided that I would go to the poolside restroom to compose myself. My boyfriend went with me to console me, and not 90 seconds after we went in there, a Gentleman with a Westin Badge came in, and told us to "Take that crap to your room", and just stood there staring at us. I felt so terrible. I sent a letter to Westin regarding the matter, and security said that since I didn't know the man's name, nothing could be done. I got a letter from the hotel manager saying that this is not the norm, but I still paid $480 to be insulted. I cannot recomend this hotel for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel but less than optimal location”
Reviews.Author: GrantParish
Reviews.Content: I generally like Starwood properties and was pleased with this Westin overall. It is relatively new, the room was nicely appointed and I found the service to be good. The concierge with helpful with directions and dinner suggestions. Not too keen on the location because there is little to do within walking distance. We were told there was a shuttle that would take us to the train station but after waiting a long time, we gave up and walked to the station and took the subway to Copley Square. Oddly, we ended up having dinner at the Westin there. One advantage of the location was the proximity to Logan airport. I took the Silver Line from the airport and was at the hotel in about 20 minutes. I was surprised that the hotel website did not mention this option. I only knew of it because I called the hotel and specifically asked if there were public transportation options from the airport. Big convention hotel so lots of traffic and noise. Hotel is not on/near the water and the view from my window was not â€œHarborviewâ€� but â€œabandoned empty lot view.â€� I know it is not fair to compare prices of hotels in different cities but I could not help thinking back to my stay two weeks earlier at the W Midtown Atlanta where I had a much larger nicer room for half the price of the Westin Harborview. I was at this hotel for business but given the price/location would probably not choose to stay there if I were traveling for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Westin does it again: Great stay at the Waterfront!”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerTom
Reviews.Content: The Westin Boston Waterfont is my "go to" place when I take my clients to the Boston Design Center, but this time my wife and I went to celebrate my birthday. And celebrate we did -- a very special thank you to Donna Frechette and the wonderful folks at the Westin for an unexpected upgrade to a Harbor View Suite (awesome room with living room/dining room and bedroom!) and a beautiful cake and candles waiting when we arrived!! It made for a very happy and memorable weekend at the hotel that was already my favorite Boston property!

Reviews.Title: “Another Westin expect the best (and pay for it)”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeLACa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only two years old.I stayed here for three nights last September (Irish bar not open then) and two nights this June. Location is not on the water as the name implies, you can lokk at the water some blocks away. I prefer Starwood Hotels and am a Gold member of SPG. There was no SPG Gold/Platnuim lobby desk had to wait with all other guests. Every eemployee of the hotel was profisional and friendly and asked how they could help. Rooms are spacious and beds are great. I did not have a laptop and the expensive business center did not offer SPG members use of a computer with out charging $6 per 15 minutes. Pool is excellent and is not small, needs a jacuzzi. Gym is Westin par good machines. Last year when I paid a rate for the room I was upraded to a harbour facing room on the 14th floor. This visit I was given a room facing the convention center on the 8th floor. I was using Starwood points and cash for the room Breakfast maybe that is why I did not get a higher floor. Thebuffet was expensive at $23.00 and they closed it a half hour early to set up lunch. As all Starwood hotels the bill was under the door on the last night and express checkout saved time. We used the shuttle (great driver)to go to Fanuiel Hall, it should run more hours of the day not just 5-7:30 PM. I would stay here again. Room service great food and service but it was expensive when %20 service charge plus $3.50 delivery fee (paper said does not go to server) and tax.

Reviews.Title: “New and Clean but caters to conference goers.”
Reviews.Author: novatravelreview
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you are going to the convention center or arriving by Train at South Street Station. Also about 1 mile walk to financial district which I would not recommend in bad weather. Over-all this hotel is clean, new, and well run. Breakfast is very over-priced so try to get a room rate which includes breakfast. I also got a better rate booking directly with starwood versus the rate the hotel quoted me. This place gets noisy when a large convention is in town as the convention center is literally across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you have business in the area”
Reviews.Author: jamfan
Reviews.Content: First off I was traveling for business and was lucky to have my mother and 4 year old daugher join me. I was away for almost a week, so was glad to have them along. Check in was a breeze even though the lobby was buzzing with conventioners. The woman that checked us in wheeled out a Radio Flyer filled with toys and let my daughter pick what she wanted! Very nice touch indeed. Very friendly and helpful. Despite what others have said about the concierge service here we never encountered anything but helpful staff, very friendly and willing to give directions, whatever. When we called down for the "trolley tour" they informed us that there was a magician on Saturday morning for the kids, very nice touch. They always said hello to us when we passed by. My daughter used the pool as well and had a blast. Although we didn't use it, the gym looked awesome. The restaurant food was pretty good, good wine by the glass selection. The rooms were comfortable, clean, roomy. Nothing to complain about there. We had a view of the water and in the distance Logan airport. I loved the staff at this hotel, I have nothing but praise for them. Really friendly and courteous! The reason we picked this hotel was b/c I could walk to the business that I was at all week, and also it was the luck of the draw on priceline @ $150 a night. Now if you know Boston, that's pretty good. Anyway, you really do have to cab it to most anywhere from this hotel. I personally didn't have the leasure to walk a couple of miles in the evening for dinner. So, we ended up taking cabs to the North End on most evenings. We only had the opportunity to take their shuttle once. Keep in mind their shuttle runs from 5pm to 7:30pm, not during the day at all. With that said, save money by staying here, but be aware that you'll have to cab it, or bus it on the silver line to catch the T. No one mentions that the silver line is a bus. Good time and good stay at this hotel, even though it's a bit out of the way of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from a Westin.”
Reviews.Author: LillyDeViaje
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable beds, convenient location for conferences, pricey. Get the lobster truffle mac n' cheese downstais. Decedent and delish!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: CIVGreece
Reviews.Content: Stayed for work, May 09. Walking distance to the center (20 min) or few dollar taxi ride. Great skyline view from the city looking rooms. Has a well equipt gym, pool, and rooms. Very helpfull staff. Free internet in the lobby and paid internet in the rooms. Usually very busy due to its size and use as a convention hotel. Would recommend it for work, might want a city center hotel for leisure though, closer to old Boston. Starbucks in the lobby is a good plus too.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the night”
Reviews.Author: Bertie3003
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our tour of New England for one night as it was close to the airport. We found it easily, parked in the self parking (approx $27) and were quickly checked in to a room on the thirteenth floor. We explored the restaurants and went for a swim before heading down to the bar to chill inffont of the TV showing the game. The concierge was excellent when asked how to spend the evening yet not go to a restaurant - one of the harder questions to answer i thought. The whole hotel was fine, probably set up more for the business traveller then leisure but everyone was extremely helpful and polite. The next morning we loaded the car up and left it there before walking to Downtown crossing which wasn't really that far at all and then we wandered across Boston all the way to Copley Place and back. The Transit is just across the way from the hotel but we were in the mood to mooch before our long flight home, so I would have to disagree with those people who complain about the hotel being far from anywhere , I would say it was about a mile from Downtown crossing. A very pleasant stay. My only complaint about the hotel was that out of the nine hotels we stayed in (ranging from inns to enormous hotels) this was the only one with a charge for internet connection in the room and it wasn't wireless so useless for my i-touch.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, great staff, noisy hallways.”
Reviews.Author: kdh59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, Rooms very clean and the beds are VERY comfortable. The staff is great and there is plenty of staff to help you with anything you need. Great at giving directions, providing restaurant suggestions, maps, getting taxis arranged, etc. The lobby is large and very loud. One complaint many from my group had was we all experienced hallways noises that woke us up in the night. Door slamming from several doors away sounded like they were right in your room, must be some strange design "flaw". I would suggest bringing ear plugs, as I had the fan running on the ventilation system but that was not enough to buffer the hallway noises. This hotel is right next to a convention center, so there were many groups and "conventioneers", so the activity level in the hotel was very high during the first week of May. Public transportation is right across the street and walking into the city takes only about 15 minutes. Rooms do not really have that much of a view, it is not right on the water as you might think.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: MomTravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March 2009 for a special event. This is a fairly new hotel near the convention center. Overall this hotel is very nice. Rooms are spacious and the Westin beds are extremely comfortable. The Irish restaurant at the hotel is reasonably priced. Lobby restaurant features a good, but expensive breakfast buffet. The lobby itself is modern and large. Charges of internet access in rooms and meeting rooms; expensive business center. If I was attending an event on this side of town again, I would definitely stay at this hotel. If not, I may check out different lodging options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Left a bad taste in my mouth...”
Reviews.Author: jonparent
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for a home show. Parked in the underground garage ($32/day). At check-in was upgraded to a suite without even requesting it. Very spacious room and extra room with couch, table, bathroom and flat screen TV. Breakfast was steep - around 40 for a parfait and an omelette and an orange juice. Bad taste - checked the credit card statement a few days later - was charged for using the minibar. However, this was confusing since we were not given keys to either minibar (it was a suite with two). Attempted to dispute the charge via AMEX and was denied - hotel stands firm that we splurged on several alcoholic beverages that we did not even have access to.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Don't Be Afraid Of Location!”
Reviews.Author: tadak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Boston Waterfront last year and it was great. I've read lots of complaints about location and I don't quite understand them. There is a "T" station right across the street from the hotel (literally a five minute walk out the front door). Using the T, you can be at the airport in about 10 minutes (for less than 5 dollars for 2 people). Or, you can be downtown at restaurants and other attractions in about 10 minutes as well. No need for expensive taxis or rental cars. If you're up for a bit of a walk, you can be in downtown in 20-25 minutes. The hotel itself was great too. Comfortable beds, soundproof windows, and we paid just over $100/night. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Really great views”
Reviews.Author: reallypickylady
Reviews.Content: While I only stayed 1 night I found the hotel to be very pleasant. The decor is updated and pretty, the service was just fine. The young lady at the outdated business center even let me use her computer to download a file. The food was good too. The best part was the view from my corner room. I could have looked out onto the harbor for much longer but I had to catch a flight. If you need to be in this area, don't hesitate to book.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, Superb service”
Reviews.Author: Quincy444
Reviews.Content: Relatively new, modern hotel situated in waterfront area (adjoining the conference/convention centre). Hotel boasts several places for dining (for full meals or just a coffee) and there are also resteraunts (such as Legal Seafoods, etc) situated within a few blocks of the hotel. A relatively short 15 min walk will find you in downtown Boston. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and very attentive to your needs, and the rooms/lobby were bright, clean and airy. This hotel is only about a 10 minute drive to Logan airport, and provides facilities for online check-in, as well as airport shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles26
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family (husband and two teenagers) on New Years Eve. I must admit my initial reaction was one of disappointment because I had overlooked its location and I thought I had booked a more central hotel so that we could enjoy the first night activities. However you have to make the best of your situation. The hotel is very large and spacious. The rooms are modern and clean. There were four of us in a room which was OK for one night before flying back to the UK, but for a few days the wardrobe would not have been large enough. The view once the fog had cleared and it had stopped snowing was quite nice. The beds were lovely and very comfortable. The bathroom was a good size with quality fittings. The shower looked very impressive but was a let down!!! The gym was well equipped but the swimming pool was very small and we didn't use it. The gift shop was good and had a good selection of souvenirs, sweets and toiletries and the prices were reasonable. The Irish bar served good food and we thought was reasonably priced, certainly not the most expensive that we had come across. Because we decided not too go out in the evening, we were able to order food for the kids and take it up to the room which was very handy and a lot cheaper than ordering room service. We had breakfast at the hotel. The food was ok, nothing special. The waitress we had was rather miserable and the price was average. The reception staff were very helpful and allowed us to keep our room on at no extra charge for a couple of hours which we found unusual and a nice surprise. We did get a taxi to Macys and it was around $8.00. but we walked back and it wasn't too far and quite enjoyable despite the freezing cold. We used the valet parking because I thought I had read somewhere that it was only valet parking but I gather you can park your own car. In summary a large modern hotel, handy for the airport, not too far from the shops but not in the centre of things. I don't think I would return.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: bojomania
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints at all about the Westin for the 4 nights I stayed here for a conference. The service is excellent, the rooms are spacious, clean and well decorated. Their staff were extremely friendly and very helpful; I was very surprised to read negative reviews. The location isn't perfect, we needed a taxi to get to main sites but the conference I attended was at the Westin so this was the reason for staying here. They have great conference facitilies, a Starbucks and very good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “bad service/prices”
Reviews.Author: flames12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Waterfront for 5 nights for a conference. Charges for internet and food were all fairly steep (see below), but expected. What was not expected was the rude behavior of the staff. Perhaps a 20-something doesn't command the type of respect that the usual business class does, but wow. My room-mate was arriving into Boston before I was, yet I was not allowed to add his name to the room and so had to check in before he could access the room. Seriously? When I did check in, I was given a single King bed. When I told them that I reserved 2 beds, not 1, I was given a very rude response + lecture that I was mistaken. So I pulled out my reservation printed from my computer and was then told that all they had was a handicap room with two beds. It was fine, but not what you expect at these prices. I also stayed a night at the Doubletree Guest Suites. If you don't have to be near the convention center, I would HIGHLY recommend it over the Westin. They had larger and nicer rooms, great staff all at a much cheaper price. Some example prices from the Westin California omelet: $16.00 Tazo tea: $6.00 1 day of internet access: $12.95 PS - oh yeah, and there was never any hot water in the shower between 7-8 am.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: WhollyHeretic
