Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here when we were up for a Red Sox game.Our stay was very nice and everything in the hotel is excellent quality. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. There were some nice views in the hotel but the one from our room was not great.

Reviews.Title: “Youâ€™ll Be Fine”
Reviews.Author: nevertravels
Reviews.Content: Prompted by a Red Sox ticket offer from some friends and a day at the Science Museum thrown into the mix we decided an overnight in town would make the adventure easier. To be honest the Westin was not our first pick, nor was it the second, or third â€¦or even the top 10, but with a week left to reserve a room before the game date it quickly became our only choice. I was surprised at not just the room prices on Boston, but also the availability or lack there of. Iâ€™m not sure if it was a busy weekend, but we tried everywhere online and via telephone for a booking. I can say that there were no conventions that I was aware of during our stay. From the experience of our stay that may have changed our overall experience. After reading reviews I was a bit apprehensive as to what to expect from the place that had now become our weekend default. We are low key, no fuss family of four. The Weston is easy to find and easy to drive to. There are 4 levels of underground parking. You do not have to use valet parking. You can drive directly into the garage and self-park within steps to the elevators to the lobby. The garage was a bit of a tight fit with a full size truck. There would have been a problem if I did not have a couple of spaces to pick from. We checked in late on a Saturday and there were approximately by my count 15 spaces left. There is other â€œon your ownâ€� fee parking lots nearby and possibly some on street. There should be no parking fears here. The cost of parking for our one overnight stay was $30 and we were able to remain parked until 6pm the day of checkout. We were advised to keep our room key, swipe it and deposit it on our way out the gate. That came in handy as the game was to end sometime late in the afternoon. BTW a cab to Fenway Park from the Westin cost $15.00 Check-in process was done in reasonable time. There was a good size line when we checked in. It took about 15 minutes. The lobby however, is a great space. Plenty of seating, tastefully decorated, with a bar and a much needed albeit a more expensive Starbucks than at home. On the converse, check-out was a snap. I say that having not seen a â€œfinal billâ€� with all the charges applied, hidden or otherwise. We did not require any additional services. We called the hotel directly for reservations. The room was a Double/Double 14th floor facing the Cruise terminal and the end of the Logan runways. Plenty to look at if you wish to sit and catch your breath for a few. I do wish a Queen/Queen was available for our stay. The room was well furnished in a contemporary styling, great bedding, nice carpet and window treatment. I will say the addition of flat screen televisions have made any room seem bigger and more stylish. There were plenty of channels that kept us well entertained and informed. The AC worked well although it seemed a bit loud. A steady woosh of air out of the vent was much like that of a large fan. This did cancel out most of the hallway noise that tends to be prevalent on a busy weekend, but it did not cover up the door closings or slammings as mentioned by other reviewers. Noise wise, it was far from what could be considered dead quiet. The bathroom was great. Full lighting, Kohler fixtures, double shower heads, very easy to use. As mentioned in a previous review there is no bath fan only a vent that provides natural draft venting. Skeptical I was, but it does work for odors and steam, it just may take a bit longer. There was one bathrobe in this room that was available for use. The iron in this room was broken and would not heat. The family raved about the pool and hot tub. Both were used on two separate days. Use room key to enter the pool area, towels provided there, kid friendly (parental supervision) and if Iâ€™m not mistaken accessible 24hrs. We decided not to eat at the restaurant in the lobby. This decision was gauged on our energy level and the appearance that it may have been too expensive for its value. Based on a few recommendations we walked (10min) to Salvatores, who but the way, serve colossal portions. Good food, well worth it and the foot traffic in the area seemed livelier than everyone has mentioned. It felt like a generally safe area. The next morning we opted for a quick bite and a latte at Starbucks instead of a sit down or eat-in breakfast. Overall I would now consider the Westin our without fault, default. Not at the airport, not near Fenway or Quincy Market BUT, we got great a value that suited our need. Based on the savings we saw compared to the other hotel offerings, itâ€™s â€œout of the waynessâ€� was less of a hindrance when balanced with its cost. Quite clean, still new looking, well kept common areas and I thought the room was very well cleaned. What ever notions or hesitations you may have about staying here all we can say is, â€œYouâ€™ll Be Fineâ€�. We would not hesitate to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Asaptraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this beautifully appointed Westin. Although it is a business hotel with the convention center right next door, it provided us a great Boston experience. It is in a newly restored wharf area with a brand new T station right across the street. They have a Starbucks and indoor pool on the property with heavenly beds and baths. Staff was very professional. Check out the Seaport deli across the street for breakfast, and lunch. This may seem out of the way, but it is the same distance to Boston attractions as the Copley Westin for a lot less. Would stay here again. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: BermudaBum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided on a whim to have dinner (Petit Robert Bistro in Kenmore Square)in Boston last Saturday, so, being an SPG member and looking for points, I looked up rates at all Boston-area Starwood properties - Found a deluxe king room here at the Westin Waterfront for under $160 ! The hotel's very easy to find from the highway, and the T's right across the street. (Took the Silver Line to South Station, hopped on the Red Line to Park St, picked up the Green there - Not exactly rocket science, and it took about a half hour). We found the decor in the lobby to be very pleasant and relaxing, and enjoyed the "white tea" scent piped in. At check in, we were asked whether we would prefer a higher or lower floor, which I though was very nice, and, after expressing our preference for a high floor, were given a room on the 8th, an SPG member floor. The room was modern and comfortable, and we didn't have any problems with noise from other guests like some previous reviewers, even though the hotel was fairly full this weekend. After dinner across town, we stopped at City Bar off the lobby - Nice vibe, good drinks, not too crazy-priced. It was fun to compare this location to the other City Bar we know, at the Lenox in Back Bay - That one was a little more "happening", I guess, with more apparent locals, as opposed to the mix of conference types, etc here. So all in all, we got a good deal, had no problems, found nothing to prevent us from considering this hotel one of our Boston options.

Reviews.Title: “Well above average experience”
Reviews.Author: gjv001
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and over full of itself”
Reviews.Author: PlainsWoman
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here because my husband had to attend two back-to-back meetings that took place in this hotel. His corporate travel agent booked the room, but ended up having to get two separate prices for the two meetings. We arrived by the Silver Line Bus at the World Trade Center stop and not knowing the city, went to the D Street entrance and came into the hotel from a little used entrance. The clerk was soft spoken and condescending. She couldn't understand the two rates, and didn't have me down as a guest, and mocked us for using the D Street entrance, rather than the front door C Street entrance. Finally, she allowed me to check in with my husband. She said we would have to check out and check back in for the 2nd meeting, but had arranged it so that we could stay in the same room. I had to keep asking her to repeat herself because of the high ceilings and her quiet voice. I finally commented that the place certainly echoed a lot, imitating her quiet voice. She asked me to repeat myself - twice. The 3rd time I said it in a loud voice, whereupon she accused me of screaming at her. Wow, what a welcome. The room itself was spacious, clean and comfortable. There were too few hangers in the closet for 2 people, and there was only 1 bath robe. This was never addressed during our stay. We were never given a key to the mini bar, so no problems there with being billed for that. The towels were large and fluffy in the bath, but some had threads on the edges and some had holes. I use those towels at home in my rag pile; I don't put them out for guests. Amenities in the bath were pretty sparse for a luxury hotel, but the soaps were in the shape of leaves, and pretty generously sized. I loved the double shower head; my husband hated it. The maid did not clear away a used wine glass for two days, until I put a note on the glass that it was dirty. I also reduced the amount of housekeeping tip that I left that day. When she finally got the hint, I restored the full tip. Our room actually had a view of the waterfront. (We were on the 7th floor.) Admittedly, we had to look over another building and the air conditioning units of that building, but, it was a 1/4 waterfront view. We took the advice of other TripAdvisor members and did not eat in the restaurant or bar of the hotel. I stopped by the concierge's desk to ask for advice on a restaurant and how to use the business center, but the man was so rude, I gave up. One of the door men overheard the conversation and gave me directions to a great restaurant and told me that the concierge is "full of it" and not to take it personally. When my husband checked out and checked back in, I was out exploring and had to go to the front desk and get my key re-issued. That 2nd clerk was tremendously helpful and friendly - the only front line person that either my husband or I encountered that was friendly or helpful. The T-stop in front of the hotel is the #7, which runs to South Station, which is about a 10 minute walk. The T-stop on the other side of C Street (which runs into the Convention Center/hotel) is World Trade Center, which takes you to the airport for $2. There is a Dunkin' Donuts on Summer Street, which runs in front of the hotel on the way to South Station, about a 5 minute walk away. Also a convenience store open from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. at Melcher, along that route. There is a 7-11 on the other side of the C Street bridge, closer to the waterfront. For fast food, South Station has plenty of food. For restaurants, I tried LTK (Legal Test Kitchens) which was very trendy but superb. We also walked up to the North End and tried Cantina Italiana, which makes all of their own pasta and their own sangria. A little pricey, but I can see why families eat there - the leftovers would feed the family for the rest of the week! I liked the suggestion from another TripAdvisor member about the Walk Boston website, as it shows approximate walking times from point to point in Boston. This location is so far away from anything that you either have to walk or take a cab to get to the tourist sites or a decent restaurant. I'm a big walker, so a 1/2 hour walk up to the North End doesn't bother me. (Don't walk the other direction into South Boston!) Overnight parking is up to $41, by the way, which is a major reason that I rented a car for one day and took Greyhound for my day trip the next day. I arranged my rental car ahead of time (Enterprise) and had them meet me at the hotel early in the morning. (Concierge was affronted when the rental person came in and he found out that I had arranged the rental without him! See other reviews as to why I preplanned.) I could leave the rental car there without having to pay the parking fee when I came back at the end of the day. (Although it is good form to tip the doorman when they move the car to the overnight parking area.) Gas is more expensive in the Boston metro area and there are no gas stations near the hotel, so factor that in when planning a car rental. There are lots and lots of free overnight parking spots on the bridge on Summer Street, a couple minute's walk from the hotel, but do read the signs about which side of the street gets cleaned on which nights. We did not get charged extra for our USA Today copy. For as much money as was paid for this room, you'd think that we'd at least get courtesy, direction to the elevators or a pretense at a smile. Even at a Super 8 we get a free breakfast. Other places have manager's receptions in the evenings. This hotel is a sterile, unwelcoming money pit.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelJudge
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a smart, modern hotel adjacent to the convention centre, about 10 minutes easy walk from the railway station. It has everything you would expect to find in this style of hotel with the added advantage of great, unobstructive views from the higher floors. The room was spacious, well appointed and comfortable. If I was sent to Boston on business (I wish!), I'd want to stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Good looks but noisy”
Reviews.Author: bostowyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night while attending a wedding. It was very convenient to the wedding location. The hotel caters to the convention crowd and certainly feels like a large, chic, urban hotel. The decor is very contemporary and minimal. The heavenly bed and heavenly shower are truly very nice and the room was open and airy with large windows. Check-in and out were very efficient. Parking was an additional fee even for those staying at the hotel. My chief complaint with this hotel is a seemingly complete lack of soundproofing. It was very noisy in our room. We could clearly hear other guests having normal conversations in their rooms. I think that's pretty inexcusable in a brand-new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Westin only by name.”
Reviews.Author: kliz15
Reviews.Content: As a loyal SPG member I was pleased to find this new Westin when I started planning my fall trip to New England. We were not worried about the proximity to downtown and thought this would be a great place to stay as our home base. We traveled to Vermont, Maine, New Hampshire, Connecticut and Rhode Island. The hotel served to be a perfect place to jump onto the highways and avoid the big city. We did take a few drives downtown but the streets are insanely confusing and the crowds are out of control. (And don't bother asking any locals or the valet for directions. Everyone is clueless!!!!!) We went to Fenway Park for ALCS Game 4 and found it easier to take a cab. It was about $20 each way with tip. Parking by the stadium was $40 so it was worth the convenience. If you want to drive downtown to park and have dinner most places charge about $20. So thatâ€™s a little maddening. But to be honest there were very few restaurants there worth checking out. PF Changs & Cheese Cake Factory are the best but theyâ€™re also available if you take a drive outside the big city. We found solace in Medford. Grocery shopping at Super Stop and Shop, Subway, Chipotle, Bertucciâ€™s. The other way dowards Dedham we found Target, Old Navy, Five Guys Burgers & Fries. The rooms were comfortable. I had a 14th floor room overlooking the waterfront. A lovely view. The bed was wonderful & the rooms were VERY Clean which was a blessing. The tub was sparkling and even the grout was perfect. Good job housekeeping. But thatâ€™s were it stops. My poor husband went to pull the towel off the rack our 2nd night and there were splotches of stuff all over it. Either vomit or blood. NASTY. I called housekeeping and they came and picked up the towel to see our concern and said they'd refresh the towels. (Duh, they were all used anyway!) I had my baseball tickets sent to the hotel and they charged me $10 for the courtesy of signing for me. By the way they never told me that until I got my bill!!! UNBELIEVABLE!!! They charge you $5 to use the computer in the business center and $1.50 per page to print. I was told that they do this because this is a convention center and run by an independent company. Valet is $41 and run by the city. (But that is clearly posted). Finally my room had bar charges that were posted to my room that were not ours. When we went to dispute the $10 & the bar charges, we were refunded the bar but the $10 was left because â€œthey could do nothing about it.â€� I went back later and spoke to a manager and he took it off. I was pretty ticked that this hotel has no amenities for the SPG Gold members. I have stayed dozens of times at SPG properties over the years and have never been nickel and dimed like that before. Bottom line: The hotel is clean, comfortable and conveniently located just outside downtown and if you have a car, a great place to jump on highways. Be prepared to be charged for every little thing because itâ€™s a convention center and apparently itâ€™s normal protocol for those types of facilities. P.S. the price of $500+ per night is ridiculous. I used points to get the rate down. But Iâ€™d never pay that to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Kamtini
Reviews.Content: The Westin Boston Waterfront is a lovely hotel. Its public areas and rooms are decorated beautifully. The staff was professional, the gym was well-equipped, and the room was spotless and nicely furnished. My 10th floor room, overlooking the harbor in the distance, was also very quiet. The only minor complaints regarding this hotel is that the room service food was not up to par (really - I had better food in the Sioux Falls, SD Holiday Inn last month!) and the hotel's location. I was in Boston for work so didn't mind the travel necessary to reach downtown - it was further than I had expected, though. There are few restaurants (most of them pricey ) within walking distance, so you generally need to taxi downtown to really enjoy Boston. If you are in Boston for pleasure, I suggest you book downtown because it is a fantastic city to walk around in - beautiful architecture, wonderful shopping and great dining. This is my third stay in Boston and I still have to recommend the Marriot Copley (see review) as my favorite - both for convenience and service. I would, however, stay here again if I was in town for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if attending a conference”
Reviews.Author: annievee
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a conference. Problem with the hotel testing their announcements and firealarm during our conference sessions which was unpleasant. A little out of the way but they do have shuttles to Faneuil Hall and such. Note that the shuttle is really a large SUV and can only accommodate about 6 or 7 people. Be early and get IN or you will have to wait a 1/2 hour for the next. Did a prepay online at spg and saved almost 100 dollars on the price. Was even given a beautiful room overlooking the city and harbour!

Reviews.Title: “NEW but not noteworthy”
Reviews.Author: TripleJJJ
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin Wterfront Hotel in Boston, yes it is new but definitely not noteworthy. First of all, the name is misleading. The hotel is not located on the waterfront. Our room was on the ninth floor, had windows facing two different directions, and we could see a bit of the harbor in the distance. We were told that the location was two blocks from the cruise terminal...not exactly! We hired a taxi and were glad that we did! The hotel has very limited shuttle service. If you are planning on touring Boston, stay in town, becausetheir shuttle only operates about four hours a day. Taxi service is readily avaiable. The reception staff was efficient but not friendly; the Concierge desk was courteous, the housekeeping staff was sufficient, and the restaurant was average. The room was large, but not exceptional. After staying at The Westin Beijing, Financial District this spring (absolutely incredible) I found everything about the Westin Waterfront to be mediocre except for the price. This is a "convention center" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, typical Westin -- Skip the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: bernies_mom
Reviews.Content: I like Westin Hotels, the beds, the showers and the drinks. The staff was fantastic, friendly helpful, far above expectations. The hotel is a way from Boston and beware of walking distances -- what was described as a 1/4 mile walk was really 2 miles, they are a walking city so take good shoes. There aren't a lot of restaurants in the area so you end up tacking a pretty pricy cab ride onto any trip. Most rooms do have a pretty view of the water. This hotel fails on it's restaurant -- Sauciety -- a play on words combining sauce and society. Seriously -- can they stop trying so hard to invent things. When you are traveling if you are so tired you are eating in the hotel restaurant, you don't want some weird crap on your plate. We ordered off the menu instead of the buffet for breakfast and were punished with the typical hotel 25 minute wait for your food, then our eggs were over cooked, while I recognize the need to put vinegar in the poaching water, I think they forgot the water and then they served "home fries" which were so overseasoned with some southwest mix they could not be eaten. We tried our luck a second time for lunch. Had a WONDERFUL mushroom bisque soup and a burger which was buried under some concoction of onion sugar and vinegar that was ICE cold. Who wants their hot food doused with an ice cold sauce? It was AWFUL and lunch for two people, two burgers, two cups of soup and two waters was over $60 -- which is insane. The atmosphere did not warrant that nor did the food quality. Accolades to the front desk staff -- go find a new chef!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katyjg
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - we stayed for 3 nights whilst on our honeymoon and thought it was great. We had booked a suite and although it wasnt what we would describe as a suite - two room joined together so you have a sitting room and then a seperate bedroom, it turned out to actually work quite well. The breakfast was great but pricey if its not included in your room rate. We ate in the bar one night - didnt fancy going out - great cocktails, try the french 75, and a very nice burger. Its a bit of a walk into town but it didnt bother us - weather was lovely and it only took 15 mins to get to the centre of things. Its not a very touristy hotel - mostly used by people going to the conference centre so if your looking for something more geared towards tourists and near all the action this hotel isnt for you!

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel but desolate location”
Reviews.Author: Daryl_G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because it was within walking distance of a tradeshow I attended but, that was the only thing that was within walking distance in this sterile area of town. The lobby is big, nice, modern and airy. The rooms are nice and comfortable. Staff somewhat aloof and cool but I've read in other reviews that this is typical of Boston. You are on your own if you want a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Too many fees...”
Reviews.Author: cfitzge
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay the weekend at this hotel, it would normally be out of my price range, but I got a good deal from someone who could not use the room and could not get his money back. The room itself did not disappoint. It was a nice room, the bed was extremely comfortableâ€”the â€œheavenly bed,â€� the â€œheavenly shower,â€� was also quite nice, I was a little disappointed in the cleanliness of the bath, I expected at an upscale hotel that I would feel comfortable actually taking a bath; I did not. Being on a budget I was unhappy with the number of extra fees. The worst one was $31 a day to park your car in the garage. In that area of Boston there is no street parking, and with the cheapest room being around $300/night I think they could have included parking with the room rate. Another fee that I was surprised to find was the fee to connect to the Wi-Fi. I stayed at a Holiday Inn Express (which was about $100 a night) a couple months ago, and free Wi-Fi in ever room. Again, it is an amenity that is advertised on their website to attract customers, but there is a huge charge for the service. In room movies were $9 each, again, at the Holiday Inn they were around $5 or $6. Maybe, itâ€™s just because I am used to travelling on a budget and if you have big bucks you donâ€™t mind spending themâ€¦but I was just disappointed, I thought that for a higher price more amenities would be included, not less. I did not find the staff particularly helpful, the front desk person would not give me the cost of certain services, but said I had to come down and get a list from the â€œhostâ€� (concierge). I often got transferred around on the phone line trying to figure out who I needed to talk to get an answer about certain questions I hadâ€¦and I feel as if the woman who checked me in was just plain snobby. No one offered to help me with my bags or get a baggage cart; they said that they only offer that if you pay for the valet parking. I enjoyed the large hotel and the comfortable room, it was a long walk to the garage to get your car, but itâ€™s a difficult part of Boston to navigate anyway. I am originally from about 20 miles north of there, but I got lost several times. It is not really close to very many attractions...or at least not close enough to walk; you would have to take a cab. There is the Childrenâ€™s Museum, The New England Aquarium, and The Science Museum, but again, not within walking distance (especially if you have children); there is a T station about Â½ to Â¾ of a mile away. The hotel is huge and very open. And I think poorly designed; I want to be able to go down to the gym or pool and just run into hotel staff and guests, not everyone getting a coffee at the Starbucks on the way to work, taking a date to dinner at the expensive restaurant, or going out of overpriced martinis at one of the two bars at the hotel. I also got lost in the hotel several times. Getting in and out of the garage was also an issueâ€”it is not at all marked and often when you see an exit sign it is an exit for a person and not a vehicle. The good parts were the room was large and comfortable, the bed and shower were awesome. Iâ€™m sure that the views in some of the rooms are great, the one I had (the cheap one $300/night) overlooked the parking garage and the building under construction next door. All in all, this seems like it would be a great hotel if you were travelling for business, it is right next to the convention center in Boston. But, not a good hotel if you just want to get away and pamper yourself or have a nice family vacation. If you want to stay at a higher end hotel in Boston for leisure, I would recommend the sister hotel Westin Copley

Reviews.Title: “Lacking The Extras”
Reviews.Author: hankark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days in August 2008. Everything is clean and in order. Overall I found the Hotel to be kind of boring. Not very "warm" or inviting. Somewhat austere. One restraunt very stark and formal and expensive. Basically no reason to leave the room unless leaving the hotel. And then it is not very convienently located to find other restraunts. Certainly not worth paying their askng price. LOVED BOSTON THOUGH!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated / overpriced”
Reviews.Author: travelers_us
Reviews.Content: Best part of room were the bed and dual shower heads in bath! Room size average, bathroom average size -- in fact, about the same size of our $80. Ramada Inn hotel room. Worst part was the service (bathrobe from previous guest still hanging in room, no refrigerator available, room view (paid $339/night) looked into a parking garage -- had to request/demand room change and finally got a good view. Room service and restaurant overpriced! Not enough concierge staff /desk clerks. Concierge not very helpful - asked for help in getting a car rental but only to be told we should have planned better (needed the car the following a.m.) and that rental agency was already closed for the evening. Ended up calling an 800-number and getting the car on our own without trouble. Location very good if attending conference in convention center. But otherwise, no other restaurant/eateries in close proximity without taking a cab or the T.

Reviews.Title: “great for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: Foodwise
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, nice bathrooms-marble/kohler--typcial Westin style, nice view, not waterfront-but city view, spacious rooms. staff fairly courteous, but not always accurate with registration or basic cab fare information. Food was fairly tasty, but overpriced--especially the $9 almonds from the mini bar. Overall, a fine stay for business, but not for generic tourist sightseeing. walls are thin and if you're a light sleeper you will not enjoy these rooms-need ear plugs and respectful neighbors to keep quiet during the times when people should be quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Westin”
Reviews.Author: luxlovernyc
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood preferred guest, I've stayed at many Westins. This one was merely adequate. As others have noted, the location is really poor -- completely out of the way, although you can walk to the North End in about 25 minutes. The room had a good view -- floor-to-ceiling windows and the heavenly bed, which was good. But otherwise, just a standard room, although clean. The lobby was cavernous and lacking any charm and there was always a long line for the desks. They don't appear to have enough staff. Valet parking was over $40! We never ate at the hotel, but did enjoy having the STarbucks in the lobby. The gym and pool were nice. All in all, it was fine, but I wouldn't choose to stay there again,given all the great hotels in Boston more centrally located and it certainly wasn't inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Sheesh!”
Reviews.Author: Stans2
Reviews.Content: Really average and really pricey--perhaps because its next to Convention Center--feels like an airport--not an airport hotel, an airport---rooms are okay and for 4 bills, yikes!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Content: The Good New hotel in a quiet part of town Close to metro The Old Town Trolley stops directly in front of the hotel Cabs are always available The front desk staff are very helpful when it came to checking us in and out Our group arrived after lunch at about 2:30 by this time lunch was not being served, however the bartender asked the kitchen to prepare lunch for us...maybe the Westin should consider having him teach a Customer Service Class to other members of staff The rooms are large, clean and the beds were comfortable The Bad A few reviewers mentioned this and it's true...the wall are paper thin The concierge service is inconsistent...sometimes they answer the phone, however most times they don't The same goes for the shuttle service...it would be nice to have all day service 7 days a week Inconsistent service at Sauciety (the hotel restaurant) The Starbucks in the lobby does not accept Starbucks Cards The Ugly Some of the staff at Sauciety (the hotel restaurant) need customer service training. Our group had brunch on Sunday, Aug. 10, 2008 and came across the most horrific waitress I have ever have the grave displeasure of meeting. Once we seated she came over after we were seated for approximately 15 minutes. She offered us orange juice but we told her we would like tea service first, then our juices later. After serving the tea she never bothered to return to our table to remove empty dishes etc. She did however returned to rudely take the tea caddy to another table. She never asked if we were finished or needed any additional assistance. Mind you she was very attentive to the table directly behind us and opposite us. Hotel management will be hearing from me about this situation in more detail. I would stay at his hotel again because I truly believe that they are just experiencing temporary "growing pains."

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: twin123185
Reviews.Content: My wife had a conference next door so I tagged along! Perfect location for conventions - a bit of a walk to the financial district but a short walk to public transportation. it was a $20 cab ride from the airport but it would have been $2 by The "T" if I had researched how to get there from the airport ! Rooms were excellent - the shower and beds were great. A/C was awesome - especially in the lobby. Food in the restaurant very good as well though a bit overpriced I felt. We had a very nice stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3wheelers
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, but they charge you $30 a day to park, it's a hike to get to almost any attraction in the city, they charge you hourly for internet access, and the front desk/concierge is so busy that service requires a fair amount of waiting. All in all, Westin is a good chain of hotels, but this Westin was far over-priced for the service and lack of convenience. We researched a few hotels before we traveled to Boston and everytime we made our hike past the Longham we wished we'd booke there instead. Also, the subway/bus/public transit system connects near the hotel, but it is a real pain to navigate and you have to pretty much switch trains at every stop to get where you are going from here. If you haven't been to Boston, its a real walking city. You'll want to be closer to the action, not on the outskirts by the convention center (ofcourse if you're going to a convention, the center is right next to it)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aahoffy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Boston Waterfront from August 1 to August 3, 2008. We booked our trip along with airfare through Travelocity Last Minute trips. Because of this, I can't exactly say how much we paid for our room at the Westin -- we chose it soley on it being a 'luxury' hotel and because of the 'Heavenly Bed'. That said, this Westin is definitely beautiful although I wouldn't exactly call it 'waterfront'. We took a water taxi over from Logan International Airport, just for the fun of it ($10/per person vs. $2/per person on the subway). We though we'd be getting off of the water taxi and strolling a block to the hotel. More like hiking about 4 huge city blocks. Folks, it is soooooooooo not on the waterfront! Just fyi. It wasn't the end of the world but kind of a surprise. The lobby was very zen-like with tall birch trees (yes, in the lobby) and modern furnishings. We arrived at 11am and decided to stop in to see if we could check in early. No problem, they had a room ready. That was really nice since that prevented us from lugging our bags all around town for most of the day. The check in was smooth. The clerk asked us if we wanted the key to our minibar but we declined knowing we could spend a fortune if we had it in our posession. Our room was a king size bed, city view room on the 11th floor. We had a great sweeping view of Boston and a partial view of the harbor. Very nice. The room was clean and cool. The bed was covered in bright white linens and the furniture was dark wood. Nice wide flatscreen TV. No clutter. Masculine, modern, very swanky. The only problem we had early on was a complete abscense of toiletries --- no soaps, shampoo, lotion, etc. I called the Service Express folks and asked for 'toiletries'. Perhaps it was my mistake because, although there was a delivery made in around 15 minutes, they delivered a plastic bag filled with razors, q-tips, cotton balls,mini combs, toothpaste/brush, nail polish remover. No soap, no shampoo. We called for those items specifically when we returned that night. We also only had one robe, no slippers and the water was loud when the folks above us ran theirs. Alas, all of that was minor and made no real impact on our enjoyment of the hotel. We ordered room service twice. Everything was excellent. Totally overpriced with a $3.50 'delivery charge' plus 18% gratuity and a 5% sales tax. Outrageous but that didn't stop us because, well, room service is such a treat! Breakfast was wonderful and we'd order it all over again :) Oh, the bed --- absolutely 100% heavenly. It was awesome. We skipped going out our second night to stay in, rent a movie and drink beers in that bed. It was that good. The hotel's location is convenient to the subway stop at the World Trade Center. One trip on the subway is only $2. Don't make the silly mistake we did and take a taxi to the Sam Adams Brewery in Jamaica Plain. There is a subway stop just about 3 smaller city blocks from this brewery. Also, Boston is very 'walkable' and we did alot of it. There is even a website called Walk Boston that has maps letting you know how many minutes it takes to walk all over town. That said, this particular hotel is away from the center of the city action so if that is what you like, this isn't the one for you. We would stay here again as it was a beautiful hotel with really comfortable beds, great water pressure (forgot to mention that!) and helpful staff. It is pricey but we felt that we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel but customer service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: GamecockGirl
Reviews.Content: WIth some re-thinking of its customer service approach, this hotel could easily go from just OK to excellent. The facilities are by far the high point. Our room was spacious, clean, attractive, and modern with comfortable beds. The bathroom was larger than expected, well-lit, and very tastefully decorated, with a Heavenly Shower that lived up to its name. The hotel lobby is active, beautifully decorated, and welcoming, with lots of places to sit and enjoy the natural light coming in through the large lobby windows. We worked out at the gym and found it to be well-equipped for our needs. The indoor pool is next door to the gym, and the guests we saw swimming (mostly families) seemed to be enjoying themselves. Though the location appears to be in a growing part of the city that is being renovated -- lots of construction in the area -- we didn't find it to be an unappealing location. There are some decent restaurants within walking distance, and a reasonable cab ride took us to Fenway (we were in the city to see a game there). It would probably be a less appealing location for folks who wish to do lots of walking to plentiful retail outlets and fun tourist attractions. To us, the unappealing part of the hotel was something some other folks have referenced in their reviews -- the lack of "can-do" attitudes and customer service-focus in some of the employees. The restaurant is a good example -- it offers a breakfast buffet which is fairly tasty (but not cheap), but, alas, both days that we ate there, we noticed that there just weren't enough servers for all the tables and very few workers bussing tables. Tables sat with huge piles of plates on them for periods of 20 minutes or longer while other diners patiently waited for seating. Other tables remained empty altogether for long periods of time (maybe the staffing for those tables was not available?). However, the hostess stand was packed with people eager to eat (we noticed about 50 people, in addition to us, waiting to get in the restaurant, and that size crowd continued the whole time we ate). Some were frustrated that they had been told the wait was 15 minutes then had to wait 30-45 minutes. Some people left before their parties were called for seating. Meanwhile, I saw two restaurants employees in the dining room reading magazines and looking bored while guests buzzed about them, looking for help (maybe the employees were on break, but they were burning time in plain view of all the guests -- not very professional looking on break or not on break). Both mornings in the restaurant we saw these same kinds of sights. We wondered aloud how much more money the restaurant would be making with some new management on the scene and theorized that it would be a huge increase in revenue with some new direction. The whole scene just lacked efficiency and direction on the management front. The servers looked frustrated and harried. We also encountered the lack of customer service approach when it came to things like valet service, waiting about 35 minutes to get our car. When we asked two other employees out front if they could please help us track down our car, they all seemed to want to try to avoid doing any additional work. No one said they would check on it for us and see if the car had been picked up yet. Instead, they all said, "I'm sure it's on the way," and declined to take any responsibility for researching the situation. That was frustrating, as we had flights to catch and the time window was getting tighter and tighter, particularly for my flight, as we waited. I ended up bailing out and got a cab to the airport, due to time panic, and my friends continued to wait for the car. (I did make my flight, which was good! :) ) We did encounter an especially friendly, attentive bartender (I wish I had gotten his name) who seemed to take pride in his job and made us feel valued as customers. But I can't recall another employee who was as customer-service oriented. It's such a beautiful hotel -- it's a shame that the staffing/management part of things isn't as good as the facilities. I think we'll choose another hotel in Boston next time. BTW - I noticed long check-in lines as we were heading out. :(

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tilly&Kyle
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, with very luxurious rooms. The beds are very comfortable. I have never experienced such great lighting in a bathroom EVER! The staff was very friendly, even when my husband dropped our car keys down an elevator shaft. Maintenance was called immediately, and our keys were returned within 10 minutes. (much to my husband's relief) We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: stoutbrewer
Reviews.Content: We had a excellent stay on our Boston vacation. The staff were always available when we had a question. Check in was fast despite a convention registering just before us. This hotel is not located in the city center. However we had no problem navigating with our car or on mass transportation. A good GPS. is a must for Boston. I realize from some of the reviews, we are more adventurous than most people. The view of the waterfront and Logan Airport across the harbor was relaxing. Our room was very quiet. We never heard anyone in the next room or hallway. My son loved the pool and the soft beds. We always felt safe venturing out at night walking to a restaurant. One night we found a Italian Restaurant that had great to go pizza. There is a Micro Brewery around a ten minute walk away. It's closed on Sunday and Mondays. We used the free WiFi in the lobby area. I didn't see the need to pay for it up in the room just to check email. The compliant we had was with having to Valet park our car. If you want fast food and shopping out the door this Hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “CONVENTION OK,NOT VACATION”
Reviews.Author: pitbullrn1
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 4 day stay for a business conference in Boston, where I traveled alone. Good: Loved,loved,loved the mirrors in the bathroom. The light goes completely around the mirror, so you don't have those hideous overhead shadows making you look like a ghoul! Ditto for the makeup mirror...such clarity! Loved the smell upon arrival, very clean and relaxing. In-room Starbucks coffee a plus, as was the nice comfy bathrobe (once I got it, see below). The lobby is spacious and calming as well, especially at night. I used the fitness center daily...loved the individual TV screens on the equipment! Bad: Rude employees at Starbucks and the hotel giftshop! They did not greet me, nor was there a 'thank you!." In fact, the clerk never said a word during an entire transaction in the gift shop!! There is only one restaurant, which is OK, but overpriced. There are NO restaurants close by, so I hope your convention includes meals! Our conference did include meals, which were exceptionally good. The pool is to small for anything other than splashing around. My television recieved few channels, more news and sports than anything else. What I really wanted was nice background music, and all I had to choose from was a small bedside radio which was mostly static. I had to call for my 'complementary robe" that I found I was supposed to have from the note on the (empty) hangar on the back of my bath door. But the worst part about the stay was THE NOISE from the hallway!!! Unless you take great care in closing the door manually, they SLAM! And ANYONE talking in a normal voice in the hall is completely heard inside the room. No spa service, but the concierge told me I could have an In-room massage for $135. Bottom line: if your conference is here, OK, but know you'll have to take a taxi for anything not provided by your conference. Also, bring earplugs or white noise to block the INSIDE NOISE.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel But Terrible Location for Restuarants etc.”
Reviews.Author: mtrunner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin since I was attending a conference. Admittedly the hotel is great if you are attending a conference but that is about the only benefit of the hotel. There are very few choices in terms of restuarants and bars in the area. The few places that are close by Morton's Steakhouse and Legal Seafood Test Kitchen were so packed I couldn't get in. I basically had to get a cab every night to go to dinner which isn't cheap. Also the rooms were generally nice but the rooms are not quiet at all. I could hear people in the room next to me and I woke up several times because I could hear people talking in the hallways. I am not sure if the hotel forgot to insulate the walls but it is EXTREMELY loud. A real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tagesthemen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a conference at the Convention Centre next door. It is perfect for this as it is connected by a skybridge to the Westin. The rooms were very spacious - definitely above average for a standard room. It has the additional advantage of being close to the airport. I stayed 6 nights here and had no real problems. I ate in the restaurant (Saucity) once for both breakfast and dinner and found it quite good. The Westin Waterfront is not cheap but then Boston hotels are not cheap. The area is uninspiring - I would only stay here on business.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, do not stay with children”
Reviews.Author: Travel_two_plus_two
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks very nice and very stylish. The rooms are very comfortable and clean, nice linens, flat screen TV etc. Overall, however, I would agree with other reviewers comments that the service is lacking and not as we expected for any Westin. Check-in was okay. We had the same problems as one reviewer regarding garage access and our key had to be reprogrammed. Hotel brochure lists child friendly activities and welcome packs but none available when we asked. Hotel brochure also advertises "service express" services including diapers and wipes if you run out - we did, and when we called service express they said none were currently available, of any size (so we drove into the city to pick some up). Surprised to hear about the complimentary shuttle into the city as this was certainly not mentioned to us, we were directed to use a taxi to get to Faneuil Hall. Tried out the restaurant for (an after dinner) dessert and it was terrible - staff would not bring some hot water for baby bottle to be heated but rather insisted that they take the bottle away. Wait staff could not answer questions on the food. In addition, food not great. We ordered decaf coffees and got caffeinated, even though we asked several times to make sure that they were decaf. The (caffeinated) latte that was delivered, arrived as a shot of espresso with a pot of cold milk! Tea was delivered in a teapot that could not be opened to add the teabag - it felt as if we were there all night sorting out simple things, when we just wanted a quick convenient dessert while the kids were being calm before bed. Service express manager provided a very sympathetic ear when we complained about service. If you want to stay in this location, go to the Seaport Hotel - that is a fantastic hotel with great service and is excellent for families with kids. Despite the great rate that we got, would prefer not to stay here again. =

Reviews.Title: “Westin on Waterfront... Over-priced!!”
Reviews.Author: Dunroamin08
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Westin in Boston. Firstly the location isn't great, but walkable to downtown. The vibe in the hotel is quite pretentious. The rooms were clean-ish... there were some stains on the seats and bottom of the bed. The main problem we had was the price. We booked through hotwire so saved $60 before taxes... we paid $200. The wireless internet isn't free ($14 for 24 hour period) The bottled water they leave in your room also isn't free... $5 per bottle if you use it. We felt we paid through the nose for nothing, but to top it off we were woken at 8 a.m. and asked what time we would be checking out at! Check-out time is 12pm. Will never stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay June 08”
Reviews.Author: lisajane
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with decent facilities, clean room and a very relaxing ambiance. Admittedly, the location isnt excellent but if you are prepared to walk, the the aquarium is only 20/ 25 mins (follow the waterfront) away and is a safe walk. I loved the bed here - very relaxing and comfortable after trekking around Boston. Nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Westin Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: pharmjen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. I have to admit, I booked the hotel because I got an excellent rate from The Westin's website ($190/night before taxES) but was nervous after reading some of the reviews here. The hotel really wasn't bad at all. We had no probs with the concierge (called for an extra robe and got 2 within 10 minutes) and check in was fast. Parking will cost you $31/day but you do get access until 6pm the day of your check out. We were on the 4th floor with a bad view but didn't care because we arrived at the hotel an hour early - didn't feel like waiting an hour plus for a room on a higher floor. Would have been able to get one if willing to wait. Yes we could hear water running from a neighboring shower (once) and heard some doors slam, but you can't expect complete silence - at least I don't - when in a hotel. My only complaint/disappointment was that I felt like our room was cleaned on the fly - like towels looked like they were quickly folded and thrown on the rack. I just expected a bit more care from a Westin. But other than that, great, comfy bed and awesome shower. Room was pretty updated, including an LCD tv. Drinks at the bar/hotel food was extremely overpriced though, so beware. I suggest you get your morning coffee at one of the hundreds of Starbucks or Dunkin Donuts throughout the city - the hotel Starbuck will rob you blind. The location wasn't a problem for us at all. In fact, we used the Old Town Trolley one day to sightsee and one of it's stops was actually right at the hotel. We did a lot of walking but Boston is a VERY walkable city. I didn't mind walking although the weather will play a big factor in that decision. Cabs are a bit pricey IMO but the subway is also a good option for longer distances. Didn't take the subway to/from hotel so not exactly sure of the closest T stop, but I think it's within 2 or 3 blocks. You're not going to walk out of the hotel and be smack in the middle of the city so if that's a must for you, be sure to check out more centrally located hotels. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Boston and liked the Westin. For the price, I think the hotel was a good value (be sure to check their website for special rates!) for what we got and would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: jry-i
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nicely located and has large rooms. Otherwise, there is not anything special. The customer service was lacking, to say the least. We asked two times and still weren't helped with our bags. The conceriege service was border-line rude coupled with not very helpful. There were several other guests in line behind me when we checked in that were discussing the lack of customer service and commented on the number of people having to handle their own luggage. I would not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, Expected More”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: If you in town for an event at the convention center, the property is right next door, which is convenient. If you are in town as a tourist (or combo) stay somewhere else. It's too far walk to the features and attractions of Boston. The hotel itself is not very special for the price (even by Boston standards). "Normal" or "bland" are words I would use to describe everything from food to cleanliness to room features, etc. Decor seems dated, and I didn't find the "heavenly bed" as anything special. Sound proofing is not up to standards - I could hear the TV next door. I'd expect this in a less property, but not a Westin. Not much is within walking distance. The tea party boat is closed until 2009. You could visit Harpoon Brewery. For restaurants try Barking Crab, Anthony's Pier 4, or No Name Restuarant (all within walking distance). I might stay here again if going to the convention center (or try the Renaissance 2 blocks away), otherwise I'd stay somewhere else. Nothing special. Also - the Boston taxes of hotel tax, city tax, and tourism tax really add up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: JLW05
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline. While I didn't get a huge savings over the regular room price I did save enought to cover the $31 a day parking fee and that was certainly nice. The hotel lobby was very nicely done - large but withouth that convention-like feel that some large hotel lobbies project. Check-in went smoothly and the clerk was very accomodating. Priceline does not guarantee two beds and the clerk went out of his way to find us a double bedded room with a connecting king (I booked two rooms). The rooms themselves were a nice size. They were long but I do wish they were a bit wider from bed to dresser. However, they were very clean and the bathroom was a nice size. The beds were comfy and for there were plenty of pillows on it which I like. There was a flat screen tv and internet service was available for $12.95 a night. Most hotels do not charge for internet access anymore and most even offer wireless access. The bathroom was large and clean. The main problem I had with this hotel was its location. Of course, I knew before I arrived that it was not what I would consider centrally located. It is located near public transportation but it is a good 20 minute walk into Boston proper minimum depending on where you want to go. We were six people and it didn't even pay for us to take public transportation. We drove into Boston and paid for parking. This is supposed to be a 4 star hotel and I hate to sound spoiled but there were just lots of little glitches that I don't usually encounter in hotels of lesser quality. First, the hotel clerk didn't properly activate our room key to give us egress out of the garage so that we got stuck by the exit and had to call upstairs for help. Took a bit of time and then we had to stand in line and have the card activated for a second time. Then our toilet stopped working. Luckily, it was just before we left the room and so we called the front desk and the toilet was fixed when we got back hours later. I have no idea how long it took for a worker to come in and fix the toilet but it could have been a problem if the toilet had broken down late afternoon or during evening hours. When I got my bill, I was charged for a purchase from the honor bar despite the fact that I didn't even have the key for it. I was also charged for the second room -several hundred dollars- even though Priceline makes you pay in full when the room is booked. Hopefully, the problem was rectified at the front desk when I checked out but I won't know for sure until I get my bill. Also, each room is supposed to have a robe but one of my rooms didn't. No big deal but I have a sneaking suspicion that I may end up charged for it even though I informed the hotel clerk that I didn't take it home with me but that it was never in the room to begin with. I just think a four star hotel shouldn't make these kind of mistakes. To sum it all up, the rooms are nice, the price of the hotel is good for Boston but the hotel is a bit isolated and there there are small problems with customer service that one wouldn't expect from a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: twnashville
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay! Boston is such a great city. Mark, the concierge, was so very helpful and really made our stay. It was my husband's b-day and he went out of his way to make it special. We had a great rooms with a great view. There's a Starbucks in the hotel. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfy. Take the Old Town Trolley. It is worth it to get a sense of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: weejim
Reviews.Content: This hotel was picked for me by a congress company and on reading the reviews I worried that it was not up to scratch. After an excellent experience I don't think anyone should have misgivings about coming here. The reception process went well and I was easily able to change from 2 queens to a King room, which was excellently appointed with great plasma TV, good bathroom and great air con. The rooms were very clean and well stocked with all the things you might need. The hotel has a choice of bars and lots of lounge space with big screen TV for the mad red sox fans boston is polluted with. (Go Yankees). I took breakfast and dinner in the restaurant both were good if not spectacular but well above hotel average. Thee was also a Star***ks for those who donâ€™t like coffee. Always lots of taxis waiting it took no time to get to the city centre, I took the T into town, itâ€™s a 6 minute walk away and you have to change to the red line at south station to come into town, a little awkward when taxis are so cheap. For those attending a congress this is superb, literally a 1 minute stroll to the entrance. So in summary yes its in a new area still lacking amenities, but itâ€™s a good modern hotel ideal for business, maybe less so for holidaymakers who might be better off in Cambridge or the back bay

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, could have free wireless!”
Reviews.Author: disgrun
Reviews.Content: Getting to the Westin is easy- take a cab, or take the Silver Line bus from Logan Airport ($2, pay in exact bills to the driver or get a ticket in the arrivals hall before going to the bus stop) to the World Trade Centre. There, follow the signs to the Westin â€“ the walk is about 5 mins across a walkway, and itâ€™s worth it, as you get a great skyline view of Boston. The World Trade Centre is the first stop from Logan, and takes about 3-4 minutes to get to. Itâ€™s much better value than a cab, and Silver Line buses are very frequent. With a hotel of this class and price though, Iâ€™d have expected a shuttle bus to the airport. The Westin is a very well-appointed hotel, and I really enjoyed staying there. Check-in was fast and painless, and staff was friendly. The room was clean and of a good size, and the bathroom was great â€“ the best part being the double power-shower, which was wonderful in the morning. The room came with a TV (annoyingly, the default setting was to go to pay-per-view), and a coffee machine. A good touch was the Starbucks coffee in the room â€“ a choice of African roast or mixed blend. Having a decaf option would also have been welcome. The room service was, as noted by other reviewers here, generally ok but sporadic. I stayed six nights and some days the coffee wasnâ€™t replaced; some days the shampoo was not replaced;â€¦and a rubber thing which was lying on the ground when I got to this Westin was not hovered up during my stay there. I think this probably had to do with low staff numbers rather than staff quality - throughout my stay I was surprised by how few service staff there was on the floors. Hotels already pay service staff very little - they could employ a few more and get standards up. Fast internet is available in the rooms. This is $9.95 for a 24-hr period, or around $5 for 30 minutes. Go figure. There is free wireless access in the lobby, although staff told me â€˜it might not workâ€™. Again, for a hotel this price, providing free wireless would be a good thing. The hotel has 2 bars, both in the lobby. The main bar is in the Sauciety eatery. The food is expensive ($10 for a tasty but simple salad), as are the drinks ($5-6.50 for a beer, $14 and above for a cocktail if I remember correctly), but the barman was very good and friendly and the atmosphere chilled out. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, and the cakes there are fairly inexpensive ($2.26 on average), but the coffee is going towards $4. There are some restaurants on D Street near the hotel, but I didnâ€™t try these. I was recommended a restaurant called Salvatoreâ€™s on the street, a few minutesâ€™ walk from the hotel. Getting into Boston is easy, but takes a little bit of time. You can either take a cab, or the Silver Line from the World Trade Centre, or, as I did, walk 5-10 minutes to South Station and take the T or the commuter rail from there. The walk is scenic (skyline views) but may be cold in the winter. Again, this is where a hotel shuttle bus would be very useful! If you have time, you can walk straight into the financial district in about 20-25 minutes from the hotel. The swimming pool was ok, very chlorinated and to a good size. The fitness room was also good. A good touch were the changing rooms with lockers and stacks of available towels. If you have children, the swimming pool has no lifeguard, so it is not a place to let them swim on their own.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for airport”
Reviews.Author: fairhsa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night prior to a flight out of Boston, just because it was close to the airport. Although the hotel itself does not offer any airport transportation, the silverline MBTA bus does go from a short distance from the hotel, direct to the airport, for USD2. It took around 10 minutes. This was the best bit of the hotel. Other than this, my stay was pretty ordinary. As a platinum starwoods member I am entitled to a suite (if available) on checkin - I did get this, although it was just two rooms with an adjoining door and the door was locked when I got to the room so I could not access the other room! They came and unlocked the door but it would not stay open, so I had to ring again for a door stop, which came eventually. No other benefits for platinum so anyone expecting free internet (unlike the copely place westin) or free breakfast (unlike the properties with lounges) will be disappointed. The pool is ok but not as nice as the photos. Gym is ok. Did not try the food. The hotel is very new and shiney - if you like that sort of thing you might like this hotel. I found it somewhat sterile and impersonal. Reception staff were ok but not great, the concierge was extremely rude - when reception told me about the airport bus, they said the concierge would know the timetable... well, she did not and said "how should I know" when I asked! Amazing. The bed is the standard westin bed - you either love or hate these beds. The bathroom (in both of my rooms) was small and pokey, with a shower-over-the-bath affair which is odd for a suite. On balance would probably try other options if in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value In Boston”
Reviews.Author: jennyj74
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be a "tourist" for a long weekend in Boston and this location was perfect for us. The hotel was GREAT to say the least , super friendly door man, and front desk Great too. Very clean , beautiful hotel. The price for this time of year was incrediable. Would stay again and highly suggest for others to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: SullyBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are regular Westin customers, and usually experience great service. Unfortunately, the service at this hotel is not up to the standards of other properties. My 65-year old mom was staying in the hotel while visiting me recently, and slipped in the shower. Like many newer hotels, they have forgone the rubber mat in the tub for aesthetic reasons. She hit her head on the tile wall, and a had a huge cut that ended up requiring 18 stitches. At first, she called down to the front desk, but nobody picked up, even after she let it ring for a long time. She then called me, so that I could take her to the emergency room. At the same time, my husband called the Westin from our home to request that security go to the room and wait with her until I got there. It took me 15 minutes to get dressed and drive to the hotel to pick her up, and I got to her room before the security guard. Thank god her injury was not life-threatening. In addition, it took the hotel 2 full days to contact my mom to see how she was doing after her fall, even after we spoke to one of the managers. Obviously, this was a unique situation, but if the level of service was this bad in an emergency, can you imagine what it will be like for something without the urgency, like a request for new towels?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: BargainQuest
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for a convention. It was a beautiful hotel. They gave me a room on one of the top floors, overlooking the convention center, downtown Boston and the water -- it was a floor to ceiling window! Gorgeous view! The room itself was very spacious and comfortable. Exceedingly clean and well-kept hotel! The elevators were very fast too (one of my pet peeves is slow elevators). High speed wireless internet in the rooms worked great, although there was a daily fee of about $10. Although a bit on the pricey side, the hotel's restaurant was very good, too. Being new to Boston, I found the concierge helpful in directing me and my friends to restaurants and attractions. I also found it very easy to access transportation via taxis right outside the hotel, and the bus station just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel - Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: sal98
Reviews.Content: Simply a horrible experience from the day I arrived to the day I departed. Uncaring staff who couldnâ€™t care less; housekeeping was bad (dirty room and hallways, lacked amenities), room service was less to be desired, the hotel was not centrally located - I could go on and on. I would NOT rate this as four star property.

Reviews.Title: “Not What You Expect From a Westin”
Reviews.Author: tigerider
Reviews.Content: I will start off with the positive. The beds are very comfortable and the hotel is in great shape. That's it - short and sweet. Now on to the what seemed to be an endless amount of problems with my recent stay. One, or possibly even two, of these by themselves could lead one to believe it was an isolated bad experience. However, if you read on you will see that lack of customer service, cleanliness and satisfaction is an issue of severity with this property. I arrived in Boston on a red-eye and contacted the hotel at noon to see if I could get an early check in and if my room was available. I was informed it was ready so I took a diverted from a friends house to the hotel. Upon arrival, I was told the room was not ready and it would be 1-2 hours. They seemed unconcerned that I was told otherwise on the phone. When I asked for a member of management, they informed me there was nothing that could be done. They did offer their Fitness Facility as an option for me to shower since I had just got in from a red-eye. I politely turned down the use of a public shower. Not the answer you'd expect from a Westin. The room was moderately clean. There was hair in the bathtub and the robe hanger was there with a Westin Note to "enjoy" the robe, but no robe on the hanger. Lastly, there was no cups in the room. I phoned down and asked for a wine menu and was told one would be sent up. 2 hours later and 3 phone calls reminding them, I received it. One moring they houskeeping staff arrived at 8:30am to service the room. I asked if they could come back. At 2:00pm I had to ask the front desk to have the room cleaned, because they had forgot to come back. There is nothing within walking distance of this hotel (bar, food, full service gym - nothing). You have to take a taxi to go anywhere. If it's not bad enough you are stranded at the hotel, but there is only one restaurant on the property. The one and only restaurant on the property is perhaps the worst issue with the hotel. I was there for 3 days and had to eat 3 meals there. You had to request for a wait staff to take your order. Drinks were not refilled. The order was wrong. There were other tables asking to speak to the manager regarding their service as well. On the lighter side, they did discount 2 of my 3 meals because of the obvious customer service and order accuracy issues. To sum it up, the Waterfront Westin (That really isn't water front, but is viewable from the water) is a nice hotel - physically. The location and staff are what make this a hotel to avoid. There are plenty of nice hotels in Boston that offer much much more!

Reviews.Title: “Service could improve”
Reviews.Author: KL5500
Reviews.Content: I used points and cash to stay at this hotel. No recognition given for Gold SPG Card. Bath room floor had someone else's hairs on it when we checked in. Robe missing from bathroom door - no shower cap or other amenities. Housekeeping did not care when I pointed this out. Rooms need a good hoovering - I found M&M's on the floor beside the bed and a large build up of dust If you are prepared to use the T it is not a bad location. Beds are comfortable though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Chupa1uk
Reviews.Content: I got a fantastic deal on this hotel from otel.com (It was a secret hotel, that I managed to work out, that cost Â£290 for 5 nights!), but was quite unsure if to book it due to the reviews I had read, but I am glad that I did. Even though this hotel is out of the city centre I must admit that it did not cause any inconvenience to our stay. The transport links in Boston are fantastic and with the T stop being just over the road it was so easy to get to any area in a few minutes. Cabs were also rather cheap, it only cost us $5 - $8 to get from Copley and Downtown back to the hotel. We have stayed in central Boston previously and I must say that staying by the Waterfront was no problem at all, if anything it was rather relaxing as there were no busy street sounds when trying to sleep. There is also a plentiful supply of cabs outside the hotel and the Boston tour bus comes to the hotel reception. In all the hotel was very nice. The room was large, clean and very comfortable. We also found the staff very nice and friendly, check in was quick and easy and check out was made even better as they allowed us to delay check out until 5pm! We also found Teresa on the service desk very helpful, she managed to put us in touch with a really cheap and convenient way to get out to the Outlet Village and provided us with take away menus when we wanted a night in after all the shopping we had done in the day had worn us out.

Reviews.Title: “Ring in the NEw Year!”
Reviews.Author: Gin15ger
Reviews.Content: I live in Boston but wanted to have a special New Year's Eve with my boyfriend. I booked last minute for a harbor view room. The view of the firework's from my room located on the 5th floor was spectacular. I was worried about the noise considering the hotel was having a ball but the walls are thick enough that I never heard anyone in the next room or in the hallway. The room had all the amenities needed and the bed was super comfy. Roomservice for breaksfast was less than desirable. I like real eggs not that other stuff but coffee and bacon was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cedarvalley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a convention in November 2007. I would highly recommend staying here if you are attending a convention at the new Boston convention center. It was very convenient and luxurious. The beds were great and we had a nice view of the water with sailboats passing through and the city skyscape. The subway station (Silver line) was also right across the street as well, which made going out to restaurants and shopping easy. Starbucks coffee is available in the room (pods). The pool is small but nice and the exercise center was also nicely equipped. My only complaint would be that our room cards constantly deactivated. This happened probably 6 times during our stay and continued to happen when I kept it separated from my cell phone and other cards. I have never had this happen before at any other hotel, and we travel frequently. Hopefully the Westin can fix this issue, as we noticed other guests also having the same problem.

Reviews.Title: “perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Savannah20
Reviews.Content: I heard about this hotel from a friend, and as I was in Boston last August, I choose the Westin Waterfront. The hotel seemed so big and more a business hotel (convention center just next door), but looking carefuly, a lot of families were staying there. Staff is professionnal and smily (bellman, front desk housekeeping ). Very lighty lobby (nice atrium) wooden and natural materials everywhere. I had a very comfortable room with a great view of Downtown Boston, huge bathroom, and fabulous sleeping in "heavenly beds", specific to Westin !! also had a coffee maker with Starbucks in room. There is a fitness center and a nice indoor pool, which is very appreciated when you walked in town the whole day ! I was visiting friends in Cambridge (opposite side of town), taxi drive is 15minutes from here and costs around $17/way. Downtown and Historic Boston is a 5-7 minute taxi drive, costs $8/way. I had breakfast buffet at restaurant "Sauciety", simply delicious! So even if the Westin is situated south of Boston (as they said!), I would definitely go back there and recommand it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “The bed is comfyâ€¦.”
Reviews.Author: flansy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in November and two of those nights between 4am and 5am the fire alarm for the building went off. The alarm, a flashing strobe light, whooping noise, and a recorded bored womanâ€™s voice alerting you that an alarm has been triggered and to stay in your room, is effective, but copasetic to sleep, it certainly is not. The alarm flashed, and boomed for 10 minutes, before a tired manâ€™s voice came into our room, said that something happened in the kitchen and thatâ€™s about it. I suppose in a way it was exciting. I had never been in a hotel when a fire alarm had gone off. Going off at 4am, wasnâ€™t too pleasing though. It happening again the next morning at 5am was even less pleasing. In addition to this, and a complete lack of apology (let alone acknowledgment) from anyone, the hallway floors are dirty. I canâ€™t imagine that they ever vacuum. The entire place is over run by conferences, and it is not remotely located close to anything helpful, interesting, or historic, beside perhaps the convention center and the airport (and the airport bus stop). On the bright side, the staff are friendly and cordial. So they have that going for themâ€¦ Then again, if you happen to get a handicap room, plan on the shower flooding the entire bathroom and possibly the rest of your room. Honestly, for the money you pay to stay here, you should get a lot more. However, since it was obviously built to go with the new convention center and they seem to have no lack of business, I doubt they are going to change anything, any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not Close to Anything”
Reviews.Author: BOSOX2007Boston
Reviews.Content: Unless your going to the convention center.... Don't waste your time or money. The Hotel is in the middle of an industrial area.... miles from anything. We staying there on Sat (11/5) for my wife's birthday are we were VERY disappointed. The hotel is extremely loud- from the lobby to the rooms. We heard they person below us coughing all night. Lots of wonderful hotels to stay at in Boston and this is not one of them !!!! I would rather shovel rocks than stay there again !!

Reviews.Title: “Corporate Travel Agent Point of View”
Reviews.Author: corpagent
Reviews.Content: FRONT DESK STAFFS VERY UNRESPONSIVE TO corporate clients request to charge room and tax only on 3rd party cc...this inspite of faxing authorization letters/copy front and back of cc. While other high-end hotels are quick to response such request, this property is staffed with don't care attitude. Other hotels like Langham, Hyatt, and Millenium cater to corporate clients. Send your clients there.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track but nice”
Reviews.Author: BronxMiddleMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Waterfront because we were going to see my son at college (Berklee) and got a decent price on Hotwire. Overall this is a nice hotel - four stars is not too much of a stretch, though three or three and one-half is probably more realistic. Our room was extremely clean - nice flat screen tv - comfy beds, immaculate bathroom (crucial). My wife commented that it seemed brand new, which may be the case based on reviews here discussing recent removations. Only real drawbacks of the hotel itself are 1. walking past all the yuppies with square glasses in the lobby, and 2. the fact that absolutely nothing is free (want some water - there's a $5 bottle in your room; Wi-fi? All yours for the low price of $7.99 for 24-hours. Parking? About $30 a day above the price of the room, but this is Boston). For the price you'd think they'd could toss a bottle of agua in, huh? The real drawback to this particular Westin is that it's off the beaten path - you can SEE Boston from the hotel but getting there is a bit of a trip. We took the subway which is about a quarter mile walk past dark warehouses to the South Station, then two trains to get to the Back Bay. Tolerable, but I wouldn't want to do it in January.
