If you're in Boston for a conference this is a perfect hotel since the monster of a Convention Center is right next door and the hotel is a quality one. But if you're looking to "see" Boston you might want to look for something a little closer to the action. Oh, also map it out, it's a little challenging to find, and calling the hotel for directions is like calling Fidel Castro for an encouraging discussion on democracy. Pretty useless.

Reviews.Title: “A Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkhart
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel as we flying into Boston and then heading out the next morning. It was fine for that. I would not stay here for a vacation to Boston, however, as the location is fairly remote and there is not much there except the attached convention center. The whole area is under construction with new buildings and you could be anywhere - no feeling of being in Boston. If you are attending a convention it would be fine. The hotel is fairly new, clean, pleasant enough. It was quiet. Staff was fine. It feels like a scaled down Westin, though. Not as nice as some other properties in the same chain. The lobby bar is nice and has a decent wine selection. Oh, and the parking is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Location not great but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: guvnor1001
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many Westin's around the world and this one provided no surprises. As you can see from many of the reviews, this is primarily a conference hotel and is located adjacent to the new Boston exhibition centre. This does have the advantage of only being about 8 minutes drive from Logan which is great if you have an early morning flight or arrive late. I had booked single night stays at either end of the week and received my requested room on the first stay and was upgraded to a suite on the second (due to my Starwood status). Both rooms were clean, fairly new and everything you would expect from a Westin. The Westin Heavenly bed always ensures I get a great nights sleep and this hotel also had flat screen LCD TV's with HD pictures which was a nice touch. The hotel had a great bar but I spent most of my time with friends in the back bay area of Boston ($12 cab ride away). Service at check-in and check-out was courteous and quick. In Summary, I thought the hotel offered reasonable value ($130/night cheaper than equivalent Boston hotels on the same nights) but if you want a location that you can walk to restaurants and night life I would opt for the older sister hotel (Westin Copley Place).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is not organized!”
Reviews.Author: nappykali
Reviews.Content: I was at the Westin Waterfront for 1 night as a guest of the Starwood hotel chain. This means, that I was placed in a complimentary room. HOWEVER, upon inspection of my bank statement, not even on the guest folio, I found out that they charged me for the night I was a guest there as well as 3 additional rooms. This was over a month ago, and this discrepancy has yet to be corrected. As a meeting planner, I pay very much attention to these details of a hotel in which my clients would perhaps consider to host their event/meeting. Because of this experience, I will never plan a meeting at this hotel. Not only are they unorganized in their Accounts Payable Dept., but their turnaround in guest services is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Loved sipping cocktails in the lounge after a day of sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: soul4blues
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. He is a Starwood Preferred member so he cashed in some points to cover the stay. I was initially a little taken back by how seemingly far the hotel was from the heart of Boston. I wasn't dissapointed for long. Everything was a resonable walk / cab ride away. BE AWARE- We took a cab to a local restaurant. There is a traffic light for people coming out of the hotel parking lot. We waited for 5-6 minutes for the light, which never changed to green. The cab fare was already 6 dollars before we even left the property! I was needing to use the ATM so I wasn't happy with this. Check in was a breeze. Because of my BF's membership status we were given a room on the preferred level. The room was nice, the bathroom was spacious. Decent amount of towels and pillows. We did a sightseeing tour (recommended for tourists) and were able to purchase tickets through the concierge. The trollley had a regular pick up and drop off at the hotel (as with many others). Sauciety is the cheesy named restaurant inside the hotel. We had breakfast here one morning which was overpriced but decent. The waiter was tremendously rude. He forgot to bring out my fruit but still managed to add it to my bill. I would skip the restaurant all-together. The lounge was great, very open. Great cocktails and martinis. I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: MiMIFlorida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Waterfront for three nights in August. We had a very nice comfortable room at the end of the hallway. I can't complain about anything, it was kept very clean, and had the most comfortable beds. It is within walking distance to downtown, for me a little far for the hubby. The lobby is very pleasant and the staff was helpful. The only negitive was the parking cost but I guess that is a negitive in any big city.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Westin Ever Visited”
Reviews.Author: SJTraveler07
Reviews.Content: I was "trapped" in this hotel for a week attending a conference. This hotel has one "plus"...it is attached to the Boston Convention Center. Everything else about this hotel is definitely a "minus." First of all there is nothing near this hotel...no restaurants, no bars and little of the cultural offerings of Boston. The "T" is a short distance away but there are no travelers' amenities within a reasonable walk of this hotel. My experience was one of inconsistent service, indifferent staff and inaccessible managment. You cannot access the management of this hotel...it is as if the management does not exist. Avoid this hotel unless you have no other options.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: DoloresD
Reviews.Content: I booked the Westin Waterfront at an unbelievable rate of $167 per night. Comfortable bed, clean room with nice sized bathroom and flat screen TV. Friendly staff. Restaurant and bar a bit pricy but food is good. Hotel offers direct access to the Boston convention center and is perfect if you are attending a convention. You can walk to the downtown area in about 20 minutes. Easy acess to/from the airport using the bus system for $2.00. would I stay here again...yes if I was at an event at the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Great people!!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaManila
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, new, and very clean. The staff was exceptional. My husband got sick during the trip and the restaurant somehow found some chicken soup for him, even though it wasn't on their menu. After we landed in Memphis, I realized I had left my jewelry locked in the hotel safe. I called the hotel and they were so nice. I received my jewelry via FedEx in two days. I can't praise them enough. The head of the staff personally called me to tell me my jewelry was on its way. They could have easily "lost" the jewelry and I will be forever grateful for their care and professionalism. Donna Jackson

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindy_le2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on July 7th throught July 11th. We arrived at the hotel around 7 PM on Saturday night and the check in was extremely slow. It is a beautiful hotel with only 1 person at the front desk. The room itself is nice and clean. I have to give credit to our maid. Very sweet and friendly. The pool is nice and clean without any kiddy pool. The exercise room is pretty neat with all the equipments. Next day, we came down to information booth. Another extremely long wait to ask for information of how to get around in Boston. It was a long line and once again with only 1 person to help. We booked the trolly for $32 per person. My advise, don't bother to book at the hotel. Get onto the trolly and then you can pay them later when they get to the 2nd stop at the Aquarium. You can also get a discount there. The only convenient thing about staying at this hotel is that you can catch the trolly right at the front door. In room service is extremely expensive. We ordered in room service breakfast for a wooping $30 for only 1 person which include 2 eggs, 2 bacons, potato, 2 toasts and 1 glass of orange juice. So stay away from ordering breakfast. There is a convenient store 7 Eleven & Dunkin Donuts right down one block from the Hotel. For dining, strongly suggested the Barking Crab. Very affordable with good food. Also, if you have a chance, go to China Town which cost about $7 each way by taxi for some cheap, good food. We went to a dinner at Antony Pier 4. What a waste of money? The food was plain and the price is extremely expensive. A large lobster (about 2 pounds) for $55 and a sole for $30. If you willing to spend a lot of money for dinner with horrible service. Hope this will help with you trip in Boston. Overall, loves Boston. Will definitely come back. Not so sure will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: shrubba
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin on a friday night using my starwood points. The lobby is very clean and sleek. Check in was took a few mins and up to the room. The room was great - clean and very large. Loved the bed and the flat screen tv. The bathroom was clean - water temp and pressure were perfect. Valet parking was a little high for me - $39.00 but since I wasn't paying for the room I did use it. Check out wasn't till 12:00pm which was nice. Overall I loved the place and would defintely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “De Facto Choice for New Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: advantage2000
Reviews.Content: Found myself in the Fitness Room, and it was cool! Basically what the Fitness Room entails is: a professional treadmill, a DVD player, an LCD TV and fitness DVD's. The bedding was sumptuous and comfy. The service was prompt and courteous. The lobby was clean, well-designed and airy. The elevators and hallways are well-groomed. The elevators are plentiful and responsive. The concierge was knowledgeable and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not on the water, but still nice.”
Reviews.Author: Journalistical
Reviews.Content: Westin Waterfront had great service and my club-level room was excellent. The cleanliness was stunning, and the bed was very comfortable. The room had a huge flat screen TV that I never turned on because the view of the city (and a tiny bit of harbor) was so breathtaking. The hotel restaurant "Sauciety" was a rediculous rip off considering how many great low-priced seafood places were within walking distance of the hotel. The best of these were the Zagat's -rated "No Name" restaurant and the veteran-friendly "Seaport Bar & Grill," both less than Â½ mile away. The WestinWorkout gym was very nice and the pool looked and felt clean. Check-in and check-out were smooth and painless and the trip to and from Boston/Logan international Airport was very simple. One word of warning: PARKING IS NOT FREE. It's $24-per-day for hotel guests. Yikes! I parked on the unmetered side-streets for free, but had to drive around for a while to find open spots. Keep this in mind if you're traveling with children or are physically challenged. You may have to walk quite a ways from a free parking spot to the hotel. Other than parking, the Westin Waterfront was great.

Reviews.Title: “Staff made the visit great -”
Reviews.Author: sophiegirl04
Reviews.Content: This will be a mixed review - in some things this hotel excels, in others, not so much! Unless you are there on business at the convention center; it is not that convenient to the attractions in Boston; so you will cab or drive everywhere. One of the tourist trolley lines does stop there, so that is a possibility, and the hotel does sell tickets. The restaurant is not great, is very pricey, and has limited hours- and again, there are not a lot of alternatives close by. For some reason, room service was far superior to the dining room - rather unusual. There is a starbucks in house, and a nice lobby bar. The rooms are standard Westin - although smaller; especially the bath and closet. If you are family you may have a problem. there is a business center in house, staffed by very friendly people - but again, pricey. Parking is $39 PER DAY if you use their garage - there is limited on the street parking. What made my stay here excellent was the staff - the conceriege was one of the best I have ever had (and I travel often and use them regularly!); the bellmen, valet parkers, and room service waiters were all great. Even the Starbucks staff were extra friendly! Service is my #1 priority - and I was here on business - so the hotel worked well for me. I would stay personally if I could get a good deal to offset some of the pricey aspects such as parking & dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great for meetings/conventions”
Reviews.Author: ibeplato
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June for three nights for a conference in the hotel. Here's my quick review: Pluses: - wonderful rooms, flat-screen tv's with high definition programming, great work area with wired and wireless internet access, and perhaps the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Mini-bar in the room - great restaurants, a bit pricey ($22 for the breakfast buffet), but they had a good selection of items. I had dinner and lunch here as well and both meals were fantastic, especially the seafood salad at lunch. Steaks are great, and every meal seems to come with french fries and multiple dipping sauces - great location for meetings at the convention center - helpful staff, no real complaints - very nice fitness center with new equipment, exercise equipment had built in television and headphones were complementary, the pool was a good size as well - no problems getting a cab, and they have a shuttle to the airport every half-hour (you have to pay for it). - very close to Logan, only about a 10 minute ride. Minuses: - I wouldn't stay here unless I had a meeting at the hotel or the convention center, there isn't much within walking distance (only one decent restaurant, the Legal Seafood Test Kitchen), it isn't on the water, it's about a 3 block walk to the water. It's definitely a business traveler's hotel - Way too far from downtown Boston and the major tourist/dining areas. About a 5-10 minute cab ride to the Faneuil hall marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but no shuttle”
Reviews.Author: CAsqueaky
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed over Father's day weekend, June 15-18th. The hotel was very nice, with a great staff. Our favorite part was the pool and hot tub. My husband booked the hotel assuming there would be a shuttle to/from the airport and downtown Boston, but there was not. Really, it is my only complaint, I am sure there is no shuttle because it is connected to the convention center, can you imagine the number of trips? (However it is only 3 miles from the airport). Walking to downtown with a child was not doable, so we paid for a taxi each time, which wasn't bad, about $6-$8. So, my recommendation is stay someplace else that provides a shuttle unless you are staying for the convention. When we were there Ebay was in town and the hotel was full of people, but it did not feel crowded, just a little noisy. When we return to Boston we will definitely stay someplace more compatible to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Fantase62
Reviews.Content: My husband and two kids stayed there for three nights in June. Very nice lobby and modern simple "zen" rooms. We were directed to a T stop at south station by the front desk when there was one closer across the street from the convention center. Would have saved some time. I also experienced the maids leaving their carts outside in the hall near their closets - which was right near the rooms on the way to the elevator. We would leave the room in the morning and it was still unmade when we arrived late afternoon -- then the maids came to clean and we had to hurry and change so that they could do the room. Courteous door staff and garage.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sandra04
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Boston Waterfront in May. The hotel is beautiful with a dramatic open air lobby and very clean and modern rooms. In addition, the staff was always eager to please. Just as an anecdote, I left my coat in the hotel room when I checked out. The hotel staff went out of their way to quickly retrieve it and mail it back to me. The service was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Bed and Pillows”
Reviews.Author: virgil
Reviews.Content: Westin Boston Waterfront isn't really close to the water. It is a very clean hotel next door to the convention center. The room was clean and the bed very very comfortable. The doormen very friendly. Do not charge any room service the prices are very high. Also do not take any bottles of water left on the dresser they are $5.00 each. Every thing is close if you like to walk other wise you can take a taxi. I found out going to a location cost more than coming back for some reason. Must go to the North End.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business traveler attending the conference next door”
Reviews.Author: J0ely
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from April 15-18 for the AIIM conference. I was here for a conference and for that, location is perfect. The hotel has a skywalk way on the mezzanine level to the new conference center. You can stay indoors the entire time which is great when weather in Boston is crappy which I experienced. There was a lot of wind and rainstorms during my stay in Boston so weather was not conducive to walking around. My husband and daughter (4 years old) came w/ me on this business trip. So things we liked: 1) Nice ambience -- very modern decor. 2) Nice lounge area where you can sit around for snacks & drinks. Good alternative to eating at the only restaurant at the hotel, Sauciety. 3) Indoor Pool -- for my daughter who loves to swim 4) Proximity to the Conference & airport-- as I was attending a conference there. Things we did not like: 1) Location is a bummer if you are a leisure traveler trying to experience Boston -- This is not really Boston, it's South Boston, parts of which are still really rough neighborhood. Not a good place to walk around even if weather cooperated. Kind of a bummer for my family that was there for leisure. 2) Very few restaurants around -- so you are sort of tied to the one restaurant on the premise. We did go and try the Legal Test Kitchen (5 min cab ride and probably within walking distance) -- which was fabulous. But food is a little expensive if you have to eat all your meals at the hotel 3) Service is not quite there. First night we were on the top floor and there was this little loud noise from a fan they have up on the top of the building w/o enough insulation. Really loud and there was something wrong w/ the temperature control in the room and it was so hot. Next morning, I changed to a couple floors down and I didn't have the noise or temperature issues. On a separate occasion, my husband took my 4 year old for lunch at the hotel restaurant. Asked for ketchup and never got it for my daughter after asking 3-4 times to the waiter. He would have helped himself if he could find the ketchup. Last year in June, I stayed at the Hyatt Cambridge for a conference. This hotel is nicer, newer, more amenities and definitely more convenient location to the conference center. But one of these days, I would love to stay at one of those hotels in Copley Square to get the full Boston experience. For price comparisons, I got a conference rate of $229 per night. I hope they work out the kinks in the service -- it would be so much better then.

Reviews.Title: “NOT waterfront, but nice”
Reviews.Author: msserene
Reviews.Content: First, everyone should know the Westin Boston Waterfront is NOT on the waterfront. It's a couple blocks away and there is not even a good water view. The hotel is next door to the convention center and in a more commercial part of Boston. You cannot walk anywhere from the hotel and must take a cab wherever you might want to go----restaurants, historic sites, shopping, etc. That said, the hotel is quite nice itself. The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are very nice, there is a good restaurant and bars. There is a Starbuck's in the lobby. It has all the amenities expected in a 4-star hotel. Hotel services are great. The location is the only issue. If you are attending a convention at the center, it's the best location possible. Cabs are always waiting in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just what one expects for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: caocao
Reviews.Content: I bid $100 /night for a night in downtown Boston and got this hotel, and that includes two weekend nights. A great bargain. The hotel does charge for everything, including $30/night for parking in its garage. What I did instead was to park my rental car on the street for nothing. It's only a 2 minute walk from the nearest parking spots. Just make sure you read the signs carefully so you don't park on the side that will tow for street cleaning that night or in spots that require a resident permit. The furnishings are all nice and new. The view is so so - the area is still quite industrial and has many car lots. I got a corner room and it was quiet. My friend got a room off a normal corridor and she did not sleep well one night because of noise. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant "Sauciety" is on the pricey side (e.g. $6 for a 8 fl oz orange juice, one size) , quite basic and not particularly good given the pretension of the hotel. I had a bagel and it was like the kind you get in a supermarket. I also ordered a soft boil egg which came hard boil, served in a bowl where the egg rolled around. Because the egg was very hot and no egg cup was used, I had to wait until it cooled down before I could hold onto the egg and shell it. (May an egg cup is not a common thing in the US? I don't know.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Stay”
Reviews.Author: NoCal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here May 20-23 and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Itâ€™s a very new, modern hotel and the rooms are good sized and decorated with a modern style (as is the entire hotel). Even though the hotel was full and there were 3 conferences going on, the rooms were very quiet (with the exception of slamming room doors, but thatâ€™s pretty standard everywhere). It drives me crazy when I can hear someone elseâ€™s TV, someone walking above me or flushing the toilet. I didnâ€™t hear any of that, as well as no street noise to speak of (I was on the 10th floor). Amenities include a 32â€� flat screen TV, wireless and wired high-speed Internet ($10/day), in-room coffee, mini-bar, wine glasses, cordless phone, safe, wooden hangers and bathrobe. There is a Starbucks right off the lobby which was convenient for my breakfast each day. There is a Silver Line (subway-like bus; part of the T system) a half-block from the hotel. I took it from Logan Airport (less than 10 minutes) and also into downtown, where it connects with the main T system at South Station (Red Line).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you're attending a convention at the convention center”
Reviews.Author: DavidS050
Reviews.Content: Just finished an 8-night stay while attending a convention next door to the hotel. There is a connecting walkway that makes travel simple for convention center attendees. Check-in was a breeze, and while I have read previous comments concerning rude service, I experienced none of that during my eight days at the hotel. I can't say the staff were overly courteous, however, they always smiled and answered my questions to my satisfaction. My room was perfectly adequate and clean, with marble bathroom, and 42" flat panel TV. The king size heavenly bed was spectacular, and while I normally have trouble sleeping in hotel beds, this one put me to sleep within 10 minutes.... I agree with previous readers regarding on-site food selection; It is limited and very expensive. You have to travel across the bridge to get to the good restaurants in the downtown area, however, people seem to forget that this hotel caters mainly to convention center attendees. There are two very good restaurants within a three-quarter mile easy walking distance called The Barking Crab, and Anthony's Pier 9. The Barking Crab has picnic tables, down to earth great seafood choices, in a very casual (jeans) atmosphere, while Anthony's Pier 9 is more upscale with extremely good food. Anything else, requires a short cab ride costing $8-$10. The hotel bar, while not having the most ambience was adequate for late night cocktails. Overall, a fine hotel for convention center attendees, and adequate for others trying to save a few dollars from the pricier downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Where oh where are all the other restaurants?”
Reviews.Author: mlux633
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new, large, bright, and the rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated. There are many "howevers" after that, however! The area had no other restaurants within easy walking distance--I can't quite figure where meeting attendees will eat lunch once the convention center is in full swing. The hotel's only restaurant, Sauciety, has a strictly a la carte menu with the goofy premise of choosing sauces for everything, and is overpriced even for a hotel dining room--I mean, come on, $23 for a dry piece of chicken, plus $6 for side dishes! My sister and I had an extremely mediocre dinner for $96 with no apps or drinks and only one dessert. The only other choice in the hotel--and remember, there didn't seem to be anything else nearby--was the lobby Starbucks, which offered no fruit or sandwiches and closed very early in the evening. In summary, great room, nice people, just figure out somewhere else to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: M_EPortlan
Reviews.Content: This a horrible overpriced hotel with poor service and marginal rooms. The rooms are at best average, more like a 3 star hotel than what you might expect out of a Westin. I recently stayed there but some guests from my company who arrived later only to be informed that their room was not available and were sent to a hotel more than 30 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “OK Westin, a zen lobby and flat screen TV do not make a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hartss
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly adequate new Westin. The bed was of course comfortable. The lobby was really cool - slate, limestone, very sleek. The room was fine - nice HD flatscreen TV, very clean. I love Westin Hotels, don''t get me wrong. Then why did this property leave me cold? Only two reasons, really, and maybe it was just timing. 1. The check-in was very perfunctory, not the warm greeting I have received at other Boston hotels in the same price category. In fact, I have not had a hotel stay in recent memory - and I travel a lot - during which I felt as anonymous and invisible as I did here. The staff needs to be trained on service points - especially the doormen. 2. Although the lobby and room were nice, what's with the hallways? So drearily decorated, it was depressing - I kid you not - walking back and forth to and from the room. Olive drab to the nth degree - literally. Would I come back? Yes, for the Starwood points, as the other (and much better) Westin in Boston has become wildly expensive and my company doesn't let us stay there anymore. I guess could grow to tolerate boring hallways.

Reviews.Title: “It ain't pretty it just looks that way!”
Reviews.Author: Jonnoh64
Reviews.Content: Facility is beautiful, room was good though closet too small for two people. Bathtub bottom was stained and went uncleaned over five days despite our mentioning it. Location is too far from downtown attractions/shopping given other options. Staff? Some good, some were VERY poor. The doormen were all very helpful and courteous. The check in woman was ambivalence personified. The bar staff made us, and the strangers next to us, very aware that we should feel lucky they agreed to serve us! We were clearly inconveniencing them by wanting to order a night-cap as they wanted to close up early (i.e., an hour before the posted closing time). This was explained to us thus: "Look, we get paid a lot of money and the management looks around and realizes they're losing money so they shut down early". There were over 40 customers and two bar staff at the time. I am not making this up. The "Service Plus" line on the in-room phone went unanswered on three occasions and when I finally got a staff-person they were also clearly disinterested in helping. Lastly, reservation quoted on internet was NOT what I was billed (it was $600 higher - possibly to off-set the cost of keeping the bar staff on until closing time, not sure).

Reviews.Title: “Sleek hotel with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: OhioChowhound
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during the weekend of the Boston Marathon. Location was not ideal for the marathon, but once we figured out the T, it was fine. In better weather, it is only a mile or so to walk to all the Boston attractions. The Silver Line T (World Trade Center stop) is very close. The room was beautiful and was exactly as pictured. The bathroom was very nice with granite countertop, a robe, and nice big towels. The bed was extremely comfortable - best hotel bed I've been in. Service was great, especially for the large crowd staying there. The gym was very nice with lots of machines. Pool was a little small, but nice. Room service food was so-so, but the food in the lobby with the bar service looked awesome. The bar was really nice and they even had a guy making sushi. I would definitely stay here again. It's not the best location if you want to have all the Boston attractions right outside your door, but I liked having the big hotel with all the amenities and didn't mind the location.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and modern hotel outside central Boston”
Reviews.Author: glencora
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve just spent the weekend at the Westin Waterfront in Boston celebrating our sonâ€™s birthday. Initially we were disappointed in not being able to find a hotel at a central location due to the Marathon, but the hotel was so nice that it made the distance factor a mute point. The hotel is large (about 800 rooms), sleek and modern. The lobby is dramatic and was pleasantly filled (even at 10:30 at night) with people socializing. Check-in was a snap, in spite of the fact that the hotel was totally sold out. Our rooms were spanking clean, modern and roomy. Our bed was wonderfully comfortable, so much so that my husband, who is usually a very early riser, slept until 9:30 the next morning. We had a huge flat screen tv, Starbucks coffee and tea for the coffee maker and a variety of ultra-modern conveniences. Our bathroom was roomy and modern and had beautiful granite countertops and a stone floor. The pool, which we did not have the time to use, looked beautiful. There was a Starbucks in the lobby. Check-out was also very easy. The employees were polite and helpful, including after putting our two sons in a room with a king sized bed rather than two doubles as requested. They were conscientious about security and insisted that I come down to the registration desk to identify my sons. I appreciated this detail, despite the fact that it required I get redressed, after a recent experience in a luxury hotel where I was offered a friendâ€™s room key by a hotel employee when she didnâ€™t answer her room phone. I would return to the hotel without hesitation, with the one concern being its out of the way location. There was public transportation right near by, but we never needed to use it. My impression is that one gets far more for the money by staying a bit out of the center of downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mcn_mi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Boston Waterfront this past weekend and overall, enjoyed the experience. The rooms look exactly as pictured on the site - very modern and comfortable. The bathrooms are a nice size, slate floor and granite countertop. The room was pretty clean - and I am very, very picky about cleanliness. We did notice that the walls are a bit thin -- meaning if your room is quiet (i.e., you're trying to sleep) and someone in the room next to you is watching TV, talking or flushing the toilet -- you can hear it. There were also a lot of kids on our floor that were incapable of walking from the elevator to their room, so they ran. Sprinted. Needless to say, that was anything but pleasant. But the entire hotel is pretty swanky - nice cocktail hour in the lobby bar..very relaxing and good feng shui, if you're into that. And having a Starbucks in the hotel is more than convenient - it's dangerous! But it proved to be a life-saver after our experience in the hotel restaurant, Sauciety. This is no fault of the hotel, but it could have been the worst dining experience we've ever had. There was a breakfast buffet for $21 (normal price for a hotel restaurant) which supposedly included everything on the buffet table, as well as almost everything on the menu..? The explanation didn't make much sense to us - our waiter was rushed and had a think accent. But he took our orders and never came back to the table again. My fiance wanted to modify his order but never had the chance. So he asked another server to place an order for him (which was never placed) and to have our server come to the table - and he never came. My fiance finally tracked him down and had him come to our table, so we could ask if he was still our waiter and tell him how unhappy we were with the situation. Instead of talking to us, he had the manager come out. But that was the best option, as he handled everything very professionally and apologized to us for the inconvenience. We appreciated it but we'd never, ever dine there again. The other thing to consider with this hotel is that it's not actually in the downtown Boston area - it's near their World Trade Center and Boston Convention & Expo Center. But there's a bus/train station nearby - so you can get virtually anywhere in the city via train, even to the airport. We learned the airport lesson the hard way, as we took a cab to the hotel once we'd landed at Logan, and even though the Westin is about 3 miles from the airport, it cost us $20! We took the bus on the way back -- much more cost effective.

Reviews.Title: “Room service!? Still waiting...”
Reviews.Author: miredintx
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference hosted here the week of March 26th. The room, bed and facilities were fine. On my last night, I filled out the breakfast menu card and hung it outside on the door as directed. Since I had an early afternoon flight, I thought I would spend my final morning enjoying a casual breakfast in the room. I requested the breakfast be brought to the room at 8 AM. When it had not arrived by 8:45 I called room service and asked about it. I was told the kitchen was running a little behind and I would receive a call back with an update. At 10 AM, still not having received breakfast or the promised call back, I went down to the restaurant where I was seated and ordered breakfast. This thoughtless behavior marred what was otherwise a pretty good experience for a VERY patient person.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat beautiful, somewhat disapointing”
Reviews.Author: zuttoman
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate and I'd been dying to try this new Westin. There are parts of it that are standard Westin-glam. Dark wood, dramatic entrance, etc. But there are several details that felt more like a big, "value" convention center hotel. For instance there are great design elements in the room including dark wood furniture and a big mirror over the desk. But the closet is this industrial door with an industrial door knob and hinges. It's jarringly out of place in this hotel. Overall it feels more like a Sheraton than a Westin. For the right price, it's a fun hotel but I fear that because it's a Westin the prices are going to climb and it's certainly not as nice as other Westin's I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Seen Boston already?”
Reviews.Author: ptedhath
Reviews.Content: I live 20 miles outside Boston and my wife and I come into town quite often for a late dinner and a night over. I use priceline quite often and decided to try 4 stars /S.Boston,waterfront area. Knowing that the only 4 star properties available would include the Westin, I gave 100 bucks a shot. Sure enough, the Westin took it. My comments on the hotel are as follows: valet parking is pricey @ 36 bucks. flat panel tv in room is a nice touch The hotel is brand new so all of the bathroom fixtures, tub etc are clean and the bathroom mirror is great. Legal Test Kitchen is a not your regular Legal Sea Food restaurant. Great place for dinner only 2 blocks away on D St. and an easy walk from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel for someone attending a conference next door. Also, perfect for a copule that lives in New England who wants to try something new but doesn't feel the need to stay downtown to do the sightseeing thing. Paul H. Acton,MA

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: mexico51
Reviews.Content: I booked a Saturday night stay for a surprise get away to celebrate my husbands 62nd birthday and it was a waste of money! I brought a bottle of wine to chill and when we checked in the refrigerator was not working. We left to explore Boston and asked if someone could come up and get the refrigerator working to chill our wine. We came back to the hotel 6 hours later and still no one came up! We called and asked to speak to the manager on duty, he apologized and offered us dessert. We had already had our dinner and suggested breakfast. He explained to fill out the menu and make a note that it was complimentary, we did and much to our dismay, when I got our credit card statement we were charged! The food was terrible from room service. Nothing was edible, the yogurt parfait was warm and the granola soggy and there was a layer of water floating on top of the yogurt! We did not get the coffee we ordered, but we did get the cups and sugar and milk. The cart it came on had 2 strands of hair on it. I asked at the check in desk if they had any kind of gel, etc. to put in the tub for a bath. The girl said at the gift shop they carry it. I went to the gift shop and asked and they said no. The manager on duty said they have a body wash that should have been in the room but it wasnt'. This may not seem extreme, but for us it was. My husband and I have to pay someone to take our beeper when we go away. We have to be available for elderly residents in the building we live in in case of a medical emergency.So we rarely get to go anywhere. I thought Westin was a name I could trust and know we would have the very best service available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but not in central Boston”
Reviews.Author: BeatriceNY
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel; clean, spacious & modern. Good b/c the conference I attended was in the hotel. Not a great location if you want to see Boston. It is outside the main area.

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: thora777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what I would call upscale comfort; Everything you would expect from a Westin (non-smoking, clean,Heavenly bed and bath, good location, excellent service) presented in a comfortable environment-when I stay at a hotel, I just want to unwind for the most part, and the Westin Boston excels at this. I've stayed at this hotel twice and had no problems with checkin or out; the room was great, staff was helpful and friendly. And I found the resturant, Sauciety, yummy. Service and food top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: craigpatt
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 4 nights at the Westin Boston Waterfront, the hotel is of a good standard although probably more suited to business travellers during the week, particularly if there is a conference on. You can walk to downtown (approx 20 minutes on foot) or a cab is approx $10. I would consider staying at the Westin again however there are some good hotels in the centre too which are worth looking at.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the family friendly Westin”
Reviews.Author: EastcoastRafiki
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Watrefront for one night with my husband and children ages 4 and 6.We were very impressed with the service,cleanliness,food and family friendly vibe we experienced there.The hotel is modern designed to appeal to the business traveler with its location next door to the Convention Center.Valet was friendly and prompt as were the door men.Check in was great and although the lobby clearly represents a large,high end adult property,the kids were given and excellent grab bag of goodies in a cute drawstring bag wich made them feel welcome.That scored huge points with us as well.We had a suite which was decorated in an modern style low on charm and warmth,but was immaculate.Every request I made was met in a friendly and prompt manner.Pool and workout were very clean. Dinner was good ,but pricey offering some nice taste experiences and service was excellent.The chef came out to ask us if we liked our meals and he sent our children to complimentary sundays! Starbucks was great staff there were very friendly and they too offered my kids some complimentary treats.Although,I would not normaly choose this property as a vacation spot because it has the feel of a more of a adult travelers hotel( no game room,kid food casual spots or other screaming kids running through the lobby) I was pleasantly surprised at how welcome we felt and we will definately travel to theWestin with my children again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Convention Center Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl610
Reviews.Content: The organization I work for will be hosting their 2007 annual conference at the BCEC, the convention center attached to the Westin Boston Waterfront. I was looking forward to staying at the hotel and was not dissapointed. The property is beautiful, with very sleek, modern decor. Check-in was a breeze. The Heavenly Bed is truly heavenly. I love how easy it is to walk from the hotel to the convention center. On my last day at the Westin, I needed a late check out so that I could meet with the Events Manager at the BCEC. They were more than happy to accomidate for a minimal fee. I am so looking forward to returning to this property for further site visits. Great job Starwood! On another note, there is not much by way of shopping and restaurants in the Waterfront area. However, it seems as if there are extensive plans for development. Once the development occurs, I believe the Waterfront district will be a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: havanahipster
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best properties that Westin owns. They automatically upgraded me to a suite when I checked in. The decor of the lobby, fitness center, and hotel rooms is ultra modern and everything is extremely clean. There is a full service Starbucks in the lobby of the hotel. Definitely two thumbs up!
